Actaeon (Elk Centaur).biography:
The Actaeon is a rare and solitary protector of woodland creatures. Standing 9 feet tall, it has the arms, torso, and face of a human, but the lower body and antlers of an elk. Covered in a brown, elklike hide, it can blend into forest environments as if invisible.

Actaeons react aggressively to the slaying of woodland creatures or other similar offenses. They often attack with large wooden or bone spears, appearing suddenly from hiding with a 1-5 chance on a 1d6 for surprise.

Once per day, an Actaeon can use a breath weapon that fills a 10' cube. Those caught must save vs. dragon breath or be polymorphed into a normal forest creature such as an owl, squirrel, or deer. A successful save results in a 24-hour transformation.

Actaeons are integral members of the woodland community, often found among creatures such as centaurs and dryads. Their rarity and bravery make them celebrated champions of the forest. They frequently collaborate with druids to safeguard the woodlands, particularly when a serious threat arises.

Some actaeons may possess spellcasting abilities; refer to the "Monster Spellcasters" section on page 215 for more details.

Habitat: Forests.
Carrying Capacity: 3,000 cn at full speed; 6,000 cn at half speed.

Adaptor.biography:
Adaptors are a mysterious and highly intelligent species found across all planes. They are known for their vast knowledge and unique cultural philosophy that prohibits sharing information between planes or with human societies. Adaptors travel extensively, observing civilizations, and exchange information only with their own kind.

These creatures are natural polymorphs, able to transform into any being of human or demihuman size. After exposure to an attack, they can change color as a sign of adaptation. Adaptors rarely stay in one place for more than three days and can shift between planes at will.

Adaptors can alter their physical structure to survive in any environment. Once exposed to a particular magical attack, they become immune to it. For example, if struck by a lightning bolt, they take full or half damage once, but will become immune to electrical attacks afterward. This adaptation lasts for 1d10 turns if not used again.

In combat, adaptors are skilled with swords, attacking twice per round with a significant bonus. They may also use advanced devices incomprehensible to others, such as a flame tube, trance inducer, or energy neutralizer, if the DM wishes.

Although they share some traits with doppelgangers, adaptors cannot replicate specific individuals.

Terrain: Anywhere humans are found.

Load Capacity: 3,000 cn at full speed; 6,000 cn at half speed.

Aerial Servant (Haoou)*.biography:
Aerial servants, also known as haoou, are humanoid figures composed of roiling fog and have an ominous presence. They are native to the elemental plane of Air and are only found on the Prime Plane when summoned by a cleric using the aerial servant spell.

These beings do not relish being summoned for service and are resentful towards those who bring them to the Prime Plane. Despite this, they do not intentionally misinterpret commands. They are powerful beings who do not engage in combat but are exceptionally skilled at capturing and retrieving objects or creatures as ordered by their summoners.

Only magical weapons or spells can harm them, and they can travel at incredible speeds, often surprising their targets. Their grip is nearly impossible to escape, with a victim's chance of breaking free equal to their Hit Dice or level percentage.

On their home plane, haoou have an empire in regions with few other inhabitants, where they often clash with helions and djinn. They fear creatures and attacks related to the element of earth.

Terrain: Plane of Air; Any.

Load Capacity: 5,000 cn at full speed; 10,000 cn at half speed when carrying items or prisoners.

Animal Herd (1 HD).biography:
This set of monster statistics represents most wild grazing creatures, such as caribou, deer, elk, goats, moose, and wild oxen. All but the most inhospitable climates in the world will feature at least one type of herd beast. PCs might target members of a herd to obtain meat. The Hit Dice and damage dealt by these creatures vary depending on their species. Below are some typical herd creatures:

In a typical herd, only one out of every four animals is male; the others are females and young. Males have at least 3 hit points per Hit Die, while females have the standard number of hit points. The young have only 1-4 hit points per Hit Die. If the herd is threatened, the females and young will retreat, while the males stay to defend them.

If a group of 16 or more creatures is attacked, there is a 40% chance they will panic and stampede toward the source of danger, trampling anything in their path for 1d20 points of damage. This action requires no attack roll.

These creatures are typically found in open areas and lightly wooded regions.

If a group of 16 or more creatures is attacked, there is a 40% chance they will panic and stampede toward the source of danger, trampling anything in their path for 1d20 points of damage. This action requires no attack roll.

These creatures are typically found in open areas and lightly wooded regions.

4RJ5FS3GcmULlqSA.description: The Death Ray or Poison saving throw is a roll made by a character to resist deadly effects like instant death or paralysis from poisons, spells, or traps. The player rolls a d20 and compares it to their class- and level-specific target number on the saving throw table; success means avoiding or mitigating the harm. A failed roll often results in death (for poison) or other severe consequences, though optional rules may instead inflict substantial damage​​​.
4RJ5FS3GcmULlqSA.name: Death Ray or Poison

7bVXvHbNVGCECusv.description: If a herd of 16 or more is attacked, there is a 40% chance they will panic and trample anything in their path for 1d20 points of damage.
7bVXvHbNVGCECusv.name: Panic

BCkRyu1652KT8slL.description: The saving throw against "Stone or Paralysis" protects a character from attacks or effects that could freeze them in place (paralysis) or turn them into stone. If the saving throw is failed, the character becomes immobilized or petrified, depending on the effect. Paralysis leaves a character aware but unable to act, while petrification turns the character and their carried equipment into a stone statue. The duration or permanence of these effects is specified by the source, and successful saving throws avoid them entirely​​​.
BCkRyu1652KT8slL.name: Turn to Stone or Paralysis

I8ywnUOL6Qz9XGAY.description: When alarmed, females and young will flee while males defend the herd. Males have at least 3 HP per Hit Die.
I8ywnUOL6Qz9XGAY.gmNotes: Males protect the herd while females and young escape.
I8ywnUOL6Qz9XGAY.name: Male Protection

RFQqb4Z122RxN8bi.description: The saving throw against Breath Weapons is used to resist or mitigate the effects of a wide range of powerful exhaled attacks, not limited to dragons. This includes attacks like a dragon’s fiery or icy breath, a gorgon's petrifying breath, or a chimera's elemental breath. Each creature’s breath weapon has specific effects, such as damage, paralysis, or petrification. A successful saving throw generally halves the damage or avoids the secondary effect (such as paralysis or petrification), while failure applies the full consequences. The target number for the saving throw is determined by the character’s class and level.
RFQqb4Z122RxN8bi.name: Dragon Breath

RSaS8mbnLQiPqN8v.description: The thick hide of the animal provides basic protection.
RSaS8mbnLQiPqN8v.name: Thick Hide

ZXrizzM0vfvcjlv4.description: If the herd panics, they trample anything in their way, causing 1d20 points of damage.
ZXrizzM0vfvcjlv4.name: Trample

aQFkB7GpiRyhXE3I.description: The animal attacks using its powerful hooves or horns, delivering a 1d8 blow.

A successful save, rolled on a d20, often reduces or negates the spell's effects entirely. This saving throw is applicable to numerous magical attacks, such as charm spells, fireballs, or paralysis effects, and covers damage, control, or debilitating conditions caused by magical devices or spellcasters. The target number for success is based on the character's class and level.
mQzEU5cdrlr7vlTx.name: Spells or Magic Staff

The target number to save is determined by the character's class and level, as found on the saving throw table​​.

Ant, Giant.biography:
Giant ants are large black ants, about 5’-7’ long. Unlike their smaller cousins who live in colonies of thousands, giant ants live in colonies of about [[/r 14d6 #Ant individuals]] individuals, [[/r 10d6 #Gathering food]] of which will be out gathering food at any given time and the remaining [[/r 4d6 #Guarding nest]] will be guarding the nest.

The morale of giant ants that are scavenging is 7, but when defending the nest and the (non-combatant) queen, their morale is 12 and they will fight to the death without any self preservation instinct.

Giant ants are nocturnal omnivores, although they will not normally attack live prey unless they outnumber it greatly. They prefer to scavenge corpses and vegetable matter.

For some reason, giant ants are sometimes attracted to shiny objects, and they will grab them and return them to their lair. They are even known to sometimes dig gold, and there is a 30% chance that their lair will contain 1d10x1,000gp worth of gold nuggets.

Terrain: Any except Arctic.

Ape, Snow.biography:
Snow apes are squat, baboon-like creatures with shaggy white fur, making them difficult to spot in snowy conditions. They are somewhat intelligent, capable of using simple tools like clubs or sharpened bones but unable to comprehend more complex weapons like bows.

These creatures are reclusive and cruel, often using ambush tactics against smaller prey. If cornered or trapped, they fight fiercely with increased morale.

The snow ape uses one arm to wield a weapon and the other to hug its victim. The hug deals 2d6 points of damage each round until the target is freed. Snow apes communicate using a complex sign language and leave messages using stacked rocks and snowballs.

Snow apes are omnivorous and particularly enjoy eating giant insects and red meat but will avoid very large monsters or groups. They live in snowy mountain forests and only seek shelter during severe snowstorms.

Terrain: Arctic, Mountains (cold).

Ape, White.biography:
White apes have lost their color due to many years of living in caves. They are nocturnal herbivores, looking for fruits and vegetables at night.

They do not go out of their way to attack characters; if approached by humans and demi-humans and given a chance to flee, they will do so. But if creatures approach their lair, the apes will threaten the intruders. If their threats are ignored, they will attack. They may throw one stone per round for 1d6 points each.

White apes are not intelligent and are sometimes kept as pets by Neanderthals (cavemen). Normally, in the wild, they live in caves in family groups of 2-8 members.

Terrain: Cavern, Hill, Mountain, Ruin.

Archon (Female).biography:
Archons are incredibly powerful beings of law and good, existing to oppose chaos and evil. They work both directly and indirectly, assisting adventurers in their quests against evil forces. Archons have the bodies of giant eagles with golden-feathered wings. Male archons possess the head, arms, and torso of a giant, muscular man, while females have a dragonlike neck and three heads: two bull's heads and a central human-like head.

In combat, the male archon can wield any human weapon, often using enchanted ones, while the female can either gore with her bull heads for 3d10 damage or breathe a 10' cone of fire for 4d6 damage. They are immune to fire, poison, and 1st-4th level spells of all types.

Archons can cast spells as 12th level clerics and teleport at will. Once per day, they may use a "bolt of purity" to make victims become Lawful and peaceful for 2d6 turns, or create a "sword of flame" that inflicts 4d8 damage. They live in small family units of one mated pair and 1d3 young, and are rarely encountered with their offspring.

Terrain: Any, any Planar.

Load Capacity: 5,000 cn at full speed; 10,000 cn at half speed.

0MIqaE6MvcQn1oF2.description:
This spell creates a magical barrier up to 30' in diameter and 30' high, consisting of whirling and dancing hammers. The barrier is obviously dangerous to any who pass through it.

Damage: Any creature passing through the barrier takes [[/r 7d10 #points of damage]] (7-70) points of damage. No saving throw is allowed.

This spell is commonly used to block entrances, corridors, or other key passages.
0MIqaE6MvcQn1oF2.name: Barrier*

12fFYgPYWascDnWO.description:
Confuse alignment, lasts for one turn per level of the spellcaster and can be cast on a creature by touch. No saving throw is allowed. For the duration of the spell, any attempt to discern the recipient's alignment will yield a false result. This false alignment will remain consistent for all subsequent detection attempts during the spell's duration.

This spell allows the spellcaster to determine the alignment (Lawful, Neutral, or Chaotic) of any one creature within 10'. It can also reveal the alignment of an enchanted item or area, if applicable.
12fFYgPYWascDnWO.name: Confuse Alignment*

1oIdvIrYQOgXEE4R.description:
When casting this spell, the spellcaster must name one type of animal (such as wolves). For the duration of the spell, the spellcaster can communicate with all animals of that type within 30'; the effect moves with the caster.

The spell allows the caster to speak to any normal or giant forms of the named animal type, but only to one type at a time. The spell cannot be used to communicate with intelligent animals or fantastic creatures.

The animals typically react favorably (with a +2 bonus to reaction rolls) and may be persuaded to perform a favor for the spellcaster if the reaction roll is high enough. The animal must be capable of understanding and carrying out the request.
1oIdvIrYQOgXEE4R.name: Speak with Animals

4x6a5Y8sX0gq5PSh.description: The Death Ray or Poison saving throw is a roll made by a character to resist deadly effects like instant death or paralysis from poisons, spells, or traps. The player rolls a d20 and compares it to their class- and level-specific target number on the saving throw table; success means avoiding or mitigating the harm. A failed roll often results in death (for poison) or other severe consequences, though optional rules may instead inflict substantial damage​​​.
4x6a5Y8sX0gq5PSh.name: Death Ray or Poison

57Hrp5QDGxyGL96N.description: Archons can teleport at will to any location within their sight or to known places.
57Hrp5QDGxyGL96N.name: Teleport

6KqhC8n24kvm3Xpe.description:
This spell creates poison in a creature or container upon touch. A creature must succeed on a saving throw vs. poison or die instantly. When cast on a container, the poison affects its contents with no save.

Notes: Poisoning is usually considered a Chaotic act.
6KqhC8n24kvm3Xpe.name: Create Poison*
6KqhC8n24kvm3Xpe.spellEffect: Creates poison in a creature or container

8Q0LjJujN4Qxhdfl.description: This spell causes all mechanical and magical traps within 30' of the spellcaster to emit a faint blue glow. While it reveals the presence of traps, it does not provide information on their type or how to disarm them. Ambushes or natural hazards like quicksand are not considered traps and will not be revealed by this spell.
8Q0LjJujN4Qxhdfl.name: Find Traps

9fM3j6FsLMNQLHNr.description: Continual darkness, creates a similarly-sized area of total darkness, unaffected by normal light sources and infravision. A continual light spell can cancel it. If cast on a creature’s eyes, the target must make a saving throw vs. spells or be blinded.
9fM3j6FsLMNQLHNr.name: Continual Darkness*

ABPzQUnLEhNZaJ6a.description:
This is the most powerful healing spell available. When used to cure wounds, it restores nearly all damage, leaving the recipient with only [[/r 1d6 #damage remains]] points of damage remaining.

Healing Process: Restore the target to full starting hit points, then roll 1d6 and subtract that amount from their total.

Alternative Uses: Instead of healing damage, Cureall may be used to cure one of the following conditions:

  • Remove a curse
  • Neutralize poison
  • Cure paralysis
  • Cure disease
  • Cure blindness
  • Remove a Feeblemind effect

If the recipient is suffering from multiple afflictions (such as wounds and a curse), the cleric must specify which one the spell is curing.

Effect on Recently Raised Creatures: If cast on someone who has just been affected by Raise Dead, Cureall eliminates the need for two weeks of bed rest, allowing the target to function normally immediately. This is the only magical healing that works on a newly raised creature.
ABPzQUnLEhNZaJ6a.name: Cureall

AcNO202JwGv0Dgxh.description:
When the spellcaster casts this spell and then touches any living creature, it will calm the creature and remove any fear. If the creature has been affected by a fear spell or effect that normally does not allow a saving throw, the remove fear spell can still be effective. If the spellcaster uses the spell on someone afflicted by a magical fear effect, the victim gets to make a saving throw vs. spells, with a bonus to the roll equal to the spellcaster's level of experience (up to a maximum bonus of +6). If the saving throw is successful, the victim's fear is dispelled. Regardless of the spellcaster's level or any bonuses, a roll of 1 will always fail.

The reversed form of the spell, cause fear, will make any one creature flee for two turns. The victim may make a saving throw vs. spells to avoid the effect. This reversed spell has a range of 120'.
AcNO202JwGv0Dgxh.name: Remove Fear*

BNjEeI6JjWKXKjtK.description: For the duration of this spell, the recipient is immune to damage from normal fire and heat. They also receive a +2 bonus to all saving throws against magical fire (such as dragon breath or fireball). Additionally, any damage taken from such magical fire is reduced by 1 point per die of damage, with each die dealing at least 1 point of damage. For red dragon breath, the damage is reduced by 1 point per Hit Die of the dragon, but never below 1 point per Hit Die.
BNjEeI6JjWKXKjtK.name: Resist Fire

Bwg1rihoDVZccd2A.description:
This spell paralyzes up to four creatures, affecting any human, demihuman, or human-like beings such as bugbears, dryads, gnolls, hobgoblins, kobolds, lizard men, ogres, orcs, nixies, pixies, or sprites. It does not affect undead or creatures larger than ogres. Each target must make a saving throw vs. spells or be paralyzed for nine turns. If the spell is cast at a single target, that creature receives a -2 penalty to their saving throw. If cast at a group, up to four creatures of the spellcaster's choice can be affected, but without any penalty to their saving throws. The paralysis can only be removed by the reversed form of this spell or a dispel magic spell.

The reversed spell, free person, lifts the paralysis from up to four victims affected by the normal form of the spell (including *hold person* cast by a magic-user or an elf). It has no effect on other forms of paralysis, such as that caused by a ghoul.
Bwg1rihoDVZccd2A.name: Hold Person*

Bxy3XllvWTqHwClG.description:
With *Truesight*, the cleric gains the ability to see all things as they truly are within a 120' radius. The spell reveals all hidden, invisible, and ethereal objects or creatures, functioning as the *detect invisible* spell.

Additionally, the cleric perceives any secret doors, and can see through any form of disguise, polymorph, or other alterations. Deception is impossible. The spell also reveals creatures' alignments, experience, and power levels.
Bxy3XllvWTqHwClG.name: Truesight
Bxy3XllvWTqHwClG.spellEffect: Reveals true forms of all things within 120'

C2ifEgO279H9ech6.description:
By casting this spell, the cleric gains the ability to navigate toward a specific place, even if they have never been there before. For the duration of the spell, the cleric instinctively knows the direction to their destination.

Special Knowledge: In addition to knowing the correct path, the cleric gains magical awareness of any special knowledge needed to reach the location. This may include:

  • The location of secret doors
  • Hidden or obscured passages
  • Passwords required to gain entry

Duration Effects: When the spell ends, the cleric retains only a general sense of the direction to the destination; all other special knowledge is forgotten.

Restriction: If the cleric attempts to record or disclose the special knowledge to others in any way, the spell is instantly negated.

This spell is often used to find fast escape routes or to navigate unknown terrain.
C2ifEgO279H9ech6.name: Find the Path
C2ifEgO279H9ech6.spellDuration: 6 turns + 1 turn per level of the caster
C2ifEgO279H9ech6.spellEffect: Shows the path to an area

CR8jSRmjE1h82KPV.description:
This spell allows any one weapon to inflict 1d6 additional points of damage per attack (similar to a magical staff of striking). The weapon will inflict this extra damage with every successful blow for as long as the spell lasts. This bonus does not apply to attack rolls, but only to damage rolls.

If the caster casts this spell on a normal weapon, the weapon may then damage creatures which are normally affected only by magic weapons; the weapon will do 1d6 points of damage per strike (regardless of the normal damage of the weapon).
CR8jSRmjE1h82KPV.name: Striking

DCOAMvsiIPYmONQn.description:
This spell instantly teleports the cleric and all equipment they are carrying to their designated sanctuary, regardless of distance.

Sanctuary Requirement: The cleric must have a permanent home (such as a castle) that includes a meditation room. This room serves as the spell’s destination.

Initiative Advantage: During the round this spell is cast, the cleric automatically gains initiative unless surprised.

Restrictions:

  • The spell affects only the cleric and their carried equipment.
  • Other creatures cannot be transported.
DCOAMvsiIPYmONQn.name: Word of Recall

DdntpIwHlHOkpS1w.description:
Free person, lifts the paralysis from up to four victims affected by the normal form of the spell (including *hold person* cast by a magic-user or an elf). It has no effect on other forms of paralysis, such as that caused by a ghoul.

This spell paralyzes up to four creatures, affecting any human, demihuman, or human-like beings such as bugbears, dryads, gnolls, hobgoblins, kobolds, lizard men, ogres, orcs, nixies, pixies, or sprites. It does not affect undead or creatures larger than ogres. Each target must make a saving throw vs. spells or be paralyzed for nine turns. If the spell is cast at a single target, that creature receives a -2 penalty to their saving throw. If cast at a group, up to four creatures of the spellcaster's choice can be affected, but without any penalty to their saving throws. The paralysis can only be removed by the reversed form of this spell or a dispel magic spell.
DdntpIwHlHOkpS1w.name: Free Person*

DpDwPhObP5UmyJvE.description: Once per day, the Archon may create a sword of flame, which lasts for three turns. It deals 4d8 damage on a successful hit.
DpDwPhObP5UmyJvE.name: Sword of Flame

E0vYGW3avZ8aY7IQ.description: Archons can cast spells as 12th level clerics. They are immune to fire, poison, and 1st through 4th level spells of all types.
E0vYGW3avZ8aY7IQ.name: Spellcasting/Immunity

EIlqU03lgO8z34hN.description:
Blight, imposes a -1 penalty to morale, attack rolls, and damage rolls of enemies. Each affected creature may make a saving throw vs. spells to avoid these penalties.

It affects only those within a 20' x 20' area and only those who are not yet engaged in melee combat.
EIlqU03lgO8z34hN.name: Blight*

F8h8ldk3IsaP4htn.description: This spell inflicts 2d6 + 2 points of damage on a creature touched by the caster. A successful melee attack roll is required to deliver the spell.
F8h8ldk3IsaP4htn.name: Cause Serious Wounds*

GSRSNFUEAPJR1RlG.description:
This spell animates normal skeletons or dead bodies within range, transforming them into enchanted skeletons or zombies. These undead obey the caster until destroyed by a dispel magic spell or another cleric.

Effect: For each experience level, the caster can animate 1 HD of undead. Skeletons retain the HD of the original creature, while zombies have +1 HD.

Humans and demihumans are treated as 1 HD for this spell. A human’s corpse would be animated as a 1 HD skeleton or a 2 HD zombie.

Notes: Animated undead are immune to sleep, charm, and poison effects. Using this spell for good is advised for lawful casters, as animating the dead is often seen as a Chaotic act.
GSRSNFUEAPJR1RlG.name: Animate Dead

GcT1tTDUyHiveRVV.description:
This spell allows the spellcaster to determine the alignment (Lawful, Neutral, or Chaotic) of any one creature within 10'. It can also reveal the alignment of an enchanted item or area, if applicable.

The reversed form, confuse alignment, lasts for one turn per level of the spellcaster and can be cast on a creature by touch. No saving throw is allowed. For the duration of the spell, any attempt to discern the recipient's alignment will yield a false result. This false alignment will remain consistent for all subsequent detection attempts during the spell's duration.
GcT1tTDUyHiveRVV.name: Know Alignment*

HeHObPk4B07Xzfqc.description: This spell allows the caster to sense the direction of a known object within range, but not its distance. It can detect a common object with a partial description, such as "stairs leading up," but will only indicate the direction of the nearest such object. To find a specific object, the caster must know exactly what the object looks like (size, shape, color, etc.). The spell will not locate a creature.
HeHObPk4B07Xzfqc.name: Locate Object

HorZPBLxSrHQbqy5.description:
This spell summons an intelligent elemental being called an Aerial Servant to retrieve a specified item or creature and return it to the caster. The servant appears immediately, and the cleric must describe the target and its location, or the servant will depart.

The aerial servant is ethereal at will, allowing it to bypass most barriers, but it cannot pass through a Protection from Evil effect.

Task and Duration: The servant will attempt to find and bring back the target within the spell's duration (1 day per caster level). If the spell ends before the task is completed—whether the servant is still searching or already returning—it is considered a failure.

Strength and Carrying Capacity: The aerial servant has 18 Strength and can carry up to 500 lbs (5,000 cn).

Failure Consequences: If the aerial servant cannot complete its task within the spell duration, it goes insane and immediately returns to attack the caster.
HorZPBLxSrHQbqy5.name: Aerial Servant
HorZPBLxSrHQbqy5.spellEffect: Servant fetches one item or creature

I6sYk2A830ng9qKb.description: The saving throw against Breath Weapons is used to resist or mitigate the effects of a wide range of powerful exhaled attacks, not limited to dragons. This includes attacks like a dragon’s fiery or icy breath, a gorgon's petrifying breath, or a chimera's elemental breath. Each creature’s breath weapon has specific effects, such as damage, paralysis, or petrification. A successful saving throw generally halves the damage or avoids the secondary effect (such as paralysis or petrification), while failure applies the full consequences. The target number for the saving throw is determined by the character’s class and level.
I6sYk2A830ng9qKb.name: Dragon Breath

IhJuCCY3OjI8DaRa.description: This spell cures almost any form of blindness, including those caused by light or darkness spells. It will not affect blindness caused by a curse.
IhJuCCY3OjI8DaRa.name: Cure Blindness

JDowHjRNo0tA4qH4.description:
The reversed form of the quest spell, *Remove Quest* dispels an unwanted quest or removes a quest-related curse. The base chance of successfully removing the quest is 50%, modified by ±5% for each level difference between the caster of *Remove Quest* and the original caster of the quest.

For example, an 11th-level cleric attempting to remove a quest imposed by a 13th-level caster has a 40% chance of success, while a 36th-level cleric removing a quest cast by a 20th-level cleric has a 99% chance of success (capped to prevent automatic success).
JDowHjRNo0tA4qH4.name: Remove Quest*
JDowHjRNo0tA4qH4.spellEffect: Removes an unwanted quest or curse

JVofLAISns3oLvWy.description:
This spell summons an enchanted spring from the ground or a wall, flowing for 6 turns and producing enough water for 12 men and their mounts (about 50 gallons).

Each level above 8th allows the cleric to create water for an additional 12 men and mounts. The caster can control the amount of water produced, up to the spell’s maximum.
JVofLAISns3oLvWy.name: Create Water

JaLYJZlUePXJUWpx.description: This spell heals one living creature of 3d6 + 3 points of damage.
JaLYJZlUePXJUWpx.name: Cure Critical Wounds*

L1bPCeNOTmFnSrCI.description:
This spell summons a vast swarm of insects in a 30' radius, obscuring vision and driving off creatures with less than 3 Hit Dice (no saving throw). The caster can direct the swarm to move up to 20' per round within a range of 480' but must remain still and concentrate.

If the caster is disturbed, the insects scatter and the spell ends. This spell can only be cast outdoors and above ground.
L1bPCeNOTmFnSrCI.name: Insect Plague

Lk57ms5QpZLHoJvA.description:
This spell grants the cleric the ability to communicate with any living or undead creatures within 30'. Even unintelligent monsters will understand and respond.

Effects:

  • Creatures spoken to will not attack the cleric while in conversation.
  • However, if attacked, they may defend themselves or flee.
  • The cleric may ask only one question per round.

The spell lasts for one round per level of the cleric.
Lk57ms5QpZLHoJvA.name: Speak with Monsters*
Lk57ms5QpZLHoJvA.spellDuration: 1 round per level of the cleric

MXeUcLoj3iVmazVP.description:
This spell creates enough food to feed up to 12 men and their mounts for one day. For every level above 8th, it creates enough for 12 more people and mounts.

Note: Created food spoils after 24 hours and cannot be stored for future use.
MXeUcLoj3iVmazVP.name: Create Food

ORrx6jUEK77GX2vy.description: Cause disease, infects the target with a wasting disease. The target must make a saving throw vs. spells or suffer a -2 penalty on attack rolls and hindered healing. The disease is fatal within [[/r 2d12 #Cure Disease duration in days]] days unless removed by a cure disease spell.
ORrx6jUEK77GX2vy.name: Cause Disease*

Oj9GrwEFeD6GBTsV.description: Curse imposes a penalty or misfortune on the target, with effects limited only by the caster's imagination. If the curse is too powerful, it may rebound on the caster (DM's discretion). Typical curses include a -4 penalty to attack rolls, a -2 penalty to saving throws, halving of a prime requisite, or a -4 penalty on others' reaction rolls. The victim may make a saving throw vs. spells to avoid the curse.
Oj9GrwEFeD6GBTsV.name: Curse*

Pbw6Qf04NbSpjxWg.description: When this spell is cast, all creatures within 30' of the spellcaster are protected from freezing temperatures without harm. Those affected also receive a +2 bonus to all saving throws against cold-based attacks. Additionally, any cold damage dealt to them is reduced by 1 point per die, with a minimum of 1 point of damage per die. The effect moves with the spellcaster.
Pbw6Qf04NbSpjxWg.name: Resist Cold

Pz4TFvDMjsnSagwr.description: The saving throw against "Stone or Paralysis" protects a character from attacks or effects that could freeze them in place (paralysis) or turn them into stone. If the saving throw is failed, the character becomes immobilized or petrified, depending on the effect. Paralysis leaves a character aware but unable to act, while petrification turns the character and their carried equipment into a stone statue. The duration or permanence of these effects is specified by the source, and successful saving throws avoid them entirely​​​.
Pz4TFvDMjsnSagwr.name: Turn to Stone or Paralysis

QVwz9wBfVP8FwJGc.description:
The reverse of *Speak with Monsters*, this spell prevents one creature from communicating in any way.

Effects:

  • The target may attempt a saving throw vs. spells, but with a -2 penalty.
  • If the save fails, the victim is unable to communicate for the spell’s duration.
  • This includes all forms of communication: speech, hand gestures, writing, telepathy, etc.
  • The victim can still cast spells but cannot use magic items requiring command words, as the words turn into gibberish.

Duration: 1 turn per level of the caster.
QVwz9wBfVP8FwJGc.name: Babble*
QVwz9wBfVP8FwJGc.spellDuration: 1 turn per level of the caster

Qx8BeSVk52sXOvbF.description:
This spell enhances the morale of friendly creatures by +1 and grants them a +1 bonus to all attack and damage rolls. It affects only those within a 20' x 20' area and only those who are not yet engaged in melee combat.

The reversed form, blight, imposes a -1 penalty to morale, attack rolls, and damage rolls of enemies. Each affected creature may make a saving throw vs. spells to avoid these penalties.
Qx8BeSVk52sXOvbF.name: Bless*

SICopuBcsBpBRVt0.description: The reversed form of the spell, cause fear, will make any one creature flee for two turns. The victim may make a saving throw vs. spells to avoid the effect. This reversed spell has a range of 120'.
SICopuBcsBpBRVt0.name: Cause Fear*

TdpX7IPRcZ3n1Ygl.description: Once per day, the Archon can use a bolt of purity, which causes all victims to become Lawful and peaceful for [[/r 2d6 #lawful and peaceful for this many turns]] turns. It does not cause damage and removes all evil thoughts (no saving throw).
TdpX7IPRcZ3n1Ygl.gmNotes: Bolt of Purity causing Lawful and peaceful behavior.
TdpX7IPRcZ3n1Ygl.name: Bolt of Purity

TvMSBDMxwsMhqKN5.description:
This spell cures any disease, including those caused by mummies or green slime. At 11th level or higher, it can also cure lycanthropy.

The reverse, cause disease, infects the target with a wasting disease. The target must make a saving throw vs. spells or suffer a -2 penalty on attack rolls and hindered healing. The disease is fatal within [[/r 2d12 #Cure Disease duration in days]] days unless removed by a cure disease spell.
TvMSBDMxwsMhqKN5.name: Cure Disease*

Ub19QG3LZN97yvz7.description: This spell heals 2d6 + 2 points of damage on one living creature when touched by the caster.
Ub19QG3LZN97yvz7.name: Cure Serious Wounds*

VTPcmMGWU9lD6Qth.description: This spell renders any poison harmless in a creature, container, or on an object. It can revive a creature poisoned within the last 10 rounds but does not heal any other damage.
VTPcmMGWU9lD6Qth.name: Neutralize Poison*

WdSCmnG1r2M0cmyl.description: When the spell is cast, the caster will see evilly enchanted objects within 120' glow dark red. It also causes creates that intent to harm the caster to glow when they are within the area of effect. Not all Chaotic alignment creatures will have evil intentions, but many do. Traps and poisons are neither good nor evil, merely dangerous; this spell does not reveal them.
WdSCmnG1r2M0cmyl.name: Detect Evil

Wjegaco0v7wJ0GZK.description: This spell inflicts 3d6 + 3 points of damage on a creature touched by the caster. A successful melee attack roll is required.
Wjegaco0v7wJ0GZK.name: Cause Critical Wounds*
Wjegaco0v7wJ0GZK.spellEffect: Inflicts critical damage on one creature

XX1lG3MavBmUHfrq.description:
This spell creates an invisible barrier around the caster, extending 10' in all directions. It grants each creature within the barrier a +1 bonus to all saving throws, while attacks against those inside suffer a -1 penalty on attack rolls.

Effect: Enchanted creatures (such as magically summoned or controlled beings) cannot engage in melee with anyone inside the barrier. However, if a protected creature attacks an enchanted one, the barrier no longer prevents melee attacks, though saving throw bonuses and attack roll penalties remain active.

Missile and magical attacks from outside the barrier still suffer the -1 attack penalty but are otherwise unaffected.
XX1lG3MavBmUHfrq.name: Protection from Evil 10' Radius

YNL7xySUXQOVUCKA.description:
This spell allows the caster to communicate with plants within a 30' radius, treating them as if they have intelligence. The caster may ask simple favors, such as making a path through dense undergrowth, which the plants will grant if able.

Effect: Enables communication with plant creatures, including plantlike monsters such as treants.
YNL7xySUXQOVUCKA.name: Speak with Plants

YfNX73KIYkKmUFfp.description: Darkness, creates a sphere of darkness instead. It will block all sight except infravision. Darkness cancels a light spell if cast upon it, but may itself be canceled by another light spell. If cast at an opponent's eyes, darkness causes blindness for the duration of the spell or until canceled. If the victim makes a successful saving throw vs. spell, the spell has no effect.
YfNX73KIYkKmUFfp.name: Darkness*

ZVIcKs6D4jZRFRe1.description:
The reversed form of *Raise Dead*, this spell creates a death ray that kills a single living creature within 60' unless the target succeeds on a saving throw vs. death ray.

Undead Effect: If cast on an undead creature with 10 or more Hit Dice (such as a phantom, haunt, spirit, nightshade, or special), it restores 3d10 hit points instead of dealing damage.

A Lawful cleric will typically only use *Finger of Death* in life-or-death situations.
ZVIcKs6D4jZRFRe1.name: Finger of Death*
ZVIcKs6D4jZRFRe1.spellEffect: Kills one living creature or heals high-HD undead

ahGsQfZvjPCxJxWS.description:
This spell creates and invisible magical barrier all around the caster's body (less than an inch away). Here’s the revised text with all references to "cleric" changed to "caster":

While the spell is in effect, characters and monsters attacking the caster suffer a -1 penalty to their attack rolls, and the caster gains a +1 bonus to all saving throws.

Additionally, enchanted creatures are unable to touch the caster! (An enchanted creature is one that normal weapons cannot affect, only magical weapons can hit. A creature that can only be hit by a silver weapon—like a werewolf—is not considered enchanted. Any creature that is magically summoned or controlled, such as a charmed character, is also considered enchanted.) This barrier completely protects the caster from all melee or hand-to-hand attacks from such creatures; however, it does not prevent attacks from missile weapons. Enchanted creatures using missile weapons still suffer the -1 penalty to attack rolls but can still hit the caster.

This spell does not affect a magic missile spell used by magic-users.

If the caster attacks an enchanted creature during the spell's duration, the spell’s effect changes slightly. Enchanted creatures are then able to touch the caster, but still suffer the attack roll penalty; the penalty and the caster's saving throw adjustments remain until the spell's duration ends.
ahGsQfZvjPCxJxWS.name: Protection from Evil

anxYZzw5M60eAsYx.description:
This spell compels the target to undertake a specific task or quest as commanded by the caster. The target may attempt a saving throw vs. spells to resist; if successful, the spell has no effect.

Typical Tasks: The task might include slaying a particular monster, rescuing a prisoner, retrieving a magical item, or embarking on a pilgrimage. If the task is impossible or suicidal, the spell fails automatically.

Duration: The spell remains in effect until the specified task is completed. This spell compels the target to fulfill the task but does not compel them to do so willingly. Once completed, the target may hold a grudge against the caster, potentially seeking revenge depending on the circumstances of the quest.

Curse: A target who refuses to undertake the quest is cursed until they resume the task. The nature of this curse is determined by the GM and may be twice the usual strength of a standard curse.
anxYZzw5M60eAsYx.name: Quest*
anxYZzw5M60eAsYx.spellEffect: Compels one creature to perform a task

b4jFyGm6VmMR1TFJ.description:
This spell allows the cleric to animate non-living, non-magical objects, causing them to move and attack. Magical objects are unaffected.

The spell can animate either:

  • One object up to 400 lbs (4,000 cn), roughly the size of two men.
  • Multiple smaller objects, as long as their total weight does not exceed 400 lbs.

Combat Abilities: The DM determines the movement rate, number of attacks, damage, and armor class of animated objects. As a guideline:

  • A man-sized statue might move at 30' per round, attack once per round for [[/r 2d8 #points of damage]] damage, and have AC 1.
  • A chair might move at 180' per round, attack twice per round for [[/r 1d4 #points of damage]] damage per attack, and have AC 6.

All animated objects use the cleric’s chance to hit in combat.
b4jFyGm6VmMR1TFJ.name: Animate Objects

b8GXBzvYeTBO81gq.description: This spell makes spoiled or poisoned food and water safe for consumption. It can purify one ration of preserved food (either iron or standard rations), six waterskins of water, or enough regular food to feed twelve people. If cast on mud, the spell causes the dirt to settle, leaving behind a pool of pure, clear water. The spell does not affect any living creatures.
b8GXBzvYeTBO81gq.name: Purify Food and Water

bbmfDiNpXj2wPHiP.description:
This spell creates light as bright as daylight in a spherical volume with a 30' radius. It lasts until dispelled or countered by a continual darkness spell. Creatures that suffer penalties in bright daylight also suffer them within the area of effect.

If cast on a creature’s eyes, the target must make a saving throw vs. spells or be blinded until the effect is removed. This spell can be cast in an area, on an object, or directly on a creature's eyes to cause blindness.

The reverse, continual darkness, creates a similarly-sized area of total darkness, unaffected by normal light sources and infravision. A continual light spell can cancel it. If cast on a creature’s eyes, the target must make a saving throw vs. spells or be blinded.
bbmfDiNpXj2wPHiP.name: Continual Light*

c33Z50rFgAHp8idL.description:
This spell removes one curse from a character, item, or area. Some curses, especially those on magical items, may only be lifted temporarily. For permanent removal, a dispel evil spell or a remove curse cast by a higher-level caster may be required (at the DM's discretion).

The reverse of this spell, curse, imposes a penalty or misfortune on the target, with effects limited only by the caster's imagination. If the curse is too powerful, it may rebound on the caster (DM's discretion). Typical curses include a -4 penalty to attack rolls, a -2 penalty to saving throws, halving of a prime requisite, or a -4 penalty on others' reaction rolls. The victim may make a saving throw vs. spells to avoid the curse.
c33Z50rFgAHp8idL.name: Remove Curse*

cwHZIt7Sk5NllyZy.description:
This spell creates a sphere of light, as if cast by a bright torch or lamp. If the spell is cast on an object (such as a weapon), the light moves with the object.

If the spell is cast at a creature's eyes, the victim makes a saving throw vs. spell. If the saving throw fails, the victim is blinded by the light for the duration of the spell, or until the spell effect is canceled.

When reversed, this spell, darkness, creates a sphere of darkness instead. It will block all sight except infravision. Darkness cancels a light spell if cast upon it, but may itself be canceled by another light spell. If cast at an opponent's eyes, darkness causes blindness for the duration of the spell or until canceled. If the victim makes a successful saving throw vs. spell, the spell has no effect.
cwHZIt7Sk5NllyZy.name: Light*

cwbqzSDiSVakiJgH.description: The Magic Wand saving throw is used to avoid the effects of attacks or abilities activated through magical wands, such as paralysis rays or damage-dealing beams. A successful save, rolled on a d20, indicates that the character avoids or mitigates the harmful effects. The target number to save is determined by the character's class and level, as found on the saving throw table​​.
cwbqzSDiSVakiJgH.name: Magic Wand

dGHphmFPkrbempGm.description: The saving throw for Spells or Magic Staff includes resistance against magical effects cast by rods, staves, wands, or through spells. A successful save, rolled on a d20, often reduces or negates the spell's effects entirely. This saving throw is applicable to numerous magical attacks, such as charm spells, fireballs, or paralysis effects, and covers damage, control, or debilitating conditions caused by magical devices or spellcasters. The target number for success is based on the character's class and level.
dGHphmFPkrbempGm.name: Spells or Magic Staff

dmJrEhTf0lVrjFu6.description:
This spell allows the caster to see a glow around any magical creature, object and place within range. Magical creatures do not get a saving throw against this effect.

The glow only extends a couple of inches around the magical object, so if it is in a container or behind another object then some or all of the glow may not be visible.
dmJrEhTf0lVrjFu6.name: Detect Magic

gSB289OPag2EEci0.description:
This spell transforms [[/r 2d8 #sticks into snakes]] sticks into snakes, which may be poisonous (50% chance per snake). The snakes obey the caster's commands but will revert to sticks when slain or when the spell's duration ends.

Snake Stats: AC 6; HD 1; AT 1 bite; Dmg 1d4; MV 90' (30'); Save F1; ML 12; AL Neutral; SA poison (50% chance per snake to be poisonous).

Non-poisonous snakes grant 10 XP each, while poisonous ones grant 13 XP each.
gSB289OPag2EEci0.name: Sticks to Snakes
gSB289OPag2EEci0.spellEffect: Turns up to 16 sticks into snakes

gXpAKWhoUDgVJsCT.description: This spell doubles the size of one normal or giant animal, increasing its strength, damage, and carrying capacity accordingly. The animal’s behavior, armor class, and hit points remain unchanged, and the spell has no effect on intelligent or fantastic creatures.
gXpAKWhoUDgVJsCT.name: Growth of Animal
gXpAKWhoUDgVJsCT.spellEffect: Doubles the size of one animal

i1ra0P1lUXVoDnmD.description: A female Archon can breathe a 10' cone of fire, causing 4d6 points of damage.
i1ra0P1lUXVoDnmD.name: Fire Breath

jGEe1btp4p3UIcw8.description: The Archon's feathers provide extreme protection, representing an Armor Class of -6.
jGEe1btp4p3UIcw8.name: Golden Feathers

jrjhsIyqwKUDHtcT.description:
This spell destroys other spell effects within a 20' x 20' x 20' area. It does not affect magical items but can cancel temporary effects they produce.

Effect: Automatically dispels spells from casters of equal or lower level. For higher-level casters, there is a 5% chance of failure per level difference.

Examples: A 7th-level caster trying to dispel a spell from a 9th-level caster has a 10% chance of failure.
jrjhsIyqwKUDHtcT.name: Dispel Magic

nn4ELMlQZwu6ytLK.description:
This spell affects all undead and enchanted monsters within 30'. Each affected creature must make a saving throw vs. spells or be destroyed. If cast on a single creature, it takes a -2 penalty to its saving throw.

Effect: Banishes creatures from other planes if they fail their saving throw. Those that save must flee and stay away as long as the caster concentrates, remaining stationary.

The spell can also remove a curse from one item or dispel a magical charm effect on a creature.
nn4ELMlQZwu6ytLK.name: Dispel Evil
nn4ELMlQZwu6ytLK.spellEffect: Affects undead, enchanted creatures, or one curse or charm

nuMJ6PxQWrn1t9aL.description:
This spell allows the cleric to ask three yes-or-no questions of the greater powers (such as forces of nature, greater spirits, or Immortals).

Usage: May only be used once per week. The DM may restrict this to once a month if overused. Once a year, the cleric may ask six questions, usually on a day significant to the powers questioned.
nuMJ6PxQWrn1t9aL.name: Commune

oQ3k6C9QErar3SH6.description:
This spell instantly destroys one magical barrier created by a cleric. It can also dispel certain barriers created by a magic-user.

Effects: *Remove Barrier* will destroy a cleric's *Barrier* spell and can also dispel the following magic-user spells:

  • Wall of Ice
  • Wall of Fire
  • Clothform
  • Woodform
  • Wall of Stone

Limitations: This spell does not affect the following spells: *Wall of Iron*, *Stoneform*, *Ironform*, or *Steelform*.
oQ3k6C9QErar3SH6.name: Remove Barrier*

p2FwudS8djPB652r.description:
This spell cures one living (not undead or non-living) creature of [[/r 1d6+1 #Cure Light Wounds]] points of damage. The caster can cure themselves with this spell.

Alternately, the spell can be used to cure paralysis (except that caused by a Hold Person or Hold Monster spell), although if it does so then no damage will be cured at the same time.

The spell will not increase the target's maximum hit points.

When reversed, this spell, cause light wounds, causes [[/r 1d6+1 #Cause Light Wounds]] points of damage to the target. No saving throw is allowed, but the caster must make a normal attack roll to inflict this damage.
p2FwudS8djPB652r.name: Cause Light Wounds*

rBae2IHWaW4Ptxxu.description:
This spell allows the cleric to raise any human, dwarf, halfling, or elf from the dead. The body must be present, and any missing parts will cause corresponding disabilities in the raised character.

Effect: An 8th-level cleric can raise a body that has been dead up to four days. Each level above 8th extends this limit by four additional days (e.g., a 10th-level cleric can raise bodies dead for up to twelve days).

The character is raised with 1 hit point and is weakened: unable to fight, cast spells, or move faster than half speed. These penalties last for two weeks of complete bed rest, which cannot be hastened by magical healing.

Undead Effect: When cast on an undead creature within range, the target must make a saving throw vs. spells with a -2 penalty or be destroyed. Vampires that fail the save retreat to their coffins in gaseous form. Against undead creatures stronger than vampires, the spell deals 3d10 damage (saving throw for half).
rBae2IHWaW4Ptxxu.name: Raise Dead*
rBae2IHWaW4Ptxxu.spellEffect: Raises one dead human or demihuman, or damages undead

smPgkgAHoAHJGuDh.description: A female Archon's bull head gore attack, dealing 3d10 damage.
smPgkgAHoAHJGuDh.name: Gore Attack

tLyzaQ6k1brTSBiy.description:
This spell allows the cleric to create normal animals out of thin air. The animals appear at a chosen point within 30' and will obey the cleric at all times. They can be commanded to fight, carry items, guard areas, or perform other tasks within their natural abilities.

Once created, the animals can be sent up to 240' away but will continue to follow the cleric's commands. However, if instructions are not carefully worded, they may act according to their natural instincts.

Number and Size of Animals: The cleric chooses the number of animals, but not their exact type. The DM determines the specific creatures, which may include:

  • 1 large animal (e.g., elephant, hippopotamus)
  • 3 medium-sized animals (e.g., bear, great cat)
  • 6 small animals (e.g., wolf, rock baboon)

The spell cannot create giant animals. The animals disappear when slain or when the spell duration ends.
tLyzaQ6k1brTSBiy.name: Create Normal Animals

weXC3NZxQEF5CWej.description:
This spell allows the spellcaster to charm a number of Hit Dice of snakes equal to their level, with no saving throw allowed. For example, a 5th-level spellcaster could charm one 5 HD snake, five 1 HD snakes, or any combination of snakes totaling 5 Hit Dice or less. The charmed snakes will rise up and sway, but will not attack unless provoked.

If the spell is cast on snakes that are attacking the spellcaster, the duration is [[/r 1d4 + 1 #Snake Charm duration in rounds]]. Otherwise, the spell lasts for [[/r 1d4 + 1 #Snake Charm duration in turns]]. Once the spell ends, the snakes return to their normal behavior, but they will not automatically be hostile unless provoked.
weXC3NZxQEF5CWej.name: Snake Charm
weXC3NZxQEF5CWej.spellEffect: Charms 1 HD of snakes per level of the caster

xXcYC6JGVl4QuTfG.description: This spell creates an area of total silence within a 15' radius, making it impossible to converse or cast spells inside the affected area for the duration of the spell. Those within the sphere can still hear sounds from outside. If the spell is cast on a creature, the target must make a saving throw vs. spells. If the saving throw fails, the effect moves with the creature. If successful, the silence remains stationary, and the creature can leave the affected area.
xXcYC6JGVl4QuTfG.name: Silence 15' Radius

zKLpTgPAFJFiNOMx.description:
By means of this spell, a caster may ask three questions of a deceased spirit if the body is within range.

A caster of 6th or 7th level can contact recently deceased spirits (those dead up to 4 days). Casters of levels 8-14 have slightly more power (contacting spirits up to 4 months dead), and casters of levels 15-20 have even more (speaking with corpses up to 4 years dead). No time limits apply to casters of 21st level or greater.

The spirit will always reply in a tongue known to the caster, but can only offer knowledge of things up to the time of its death. If the spirit's alignment is the same as the caster's, it will provide clear and brief answers; however, if the alignments differ, the spirit may reply in riddles.
zKLpTgPAFJFiNOMx.name: Speak with the Dead

zNg8gj8z4XZficAy.description:
This spell cures one living (not undead or non-living) creature of [[/r 1d6+1 #Cure Light Wounds]] points of damage. The caster can cure themselves with this spell.

Alternately, the spell can be used to cure paralysis (except that caused by a Hold Person or Hold Monster spell), although if it does so then no damage will be cured at the same time.

The spell will not increase the target's maximum hit points.

When reversed, this spell, cause light wounds, causes [[/r 1d6+1 #Cause Light Wounds]] points of damage to the target. No saving throw is allowed, but the caster must make a normal attack roll to inflict this damage.
zNg8gj8z4XZficAy.name: Cure Light Wounds*

Archon (Female).name: Archon (Female)

Archon (Male).biography:
Archons are incredibly powerful beings of law and good, existing to oppose chaos and evil. They work both directly and indirectly, assisting adventurers in their quests against evil forces. Archons have the bodies of giant eagles with golden-feathered wings. Male archons possess the head, arms, and torso of a giant, muscular man, while females have a dragonlike neck and three heads: two bull's heads and a central human-like head.

In combat, the male archon can wield any human weapon, often using enchanted ones, while the female can either gore with her bull heads for 3d10 damage or breathe a 10' cone of fire for 4d6 damage. They are immune to fire, poison, and 1st-4th level spells of all types.

Archons can cast spells as 12th level clerics and teleport at will. Once per day, they may use a "bolt of purity" to make victims become Lawful and peaceful for 2d6 turns, or create a "sword of flame" that inflicts 4d8 damage. They live in small family units of one mated pair and 1d3 young, and are rarely encountered with their offspring.

Terrain: Any, any Planar.

Load Capacity: 5,000 cn at full speed; 10,000 cn at half speed.

0B3YsrdGmoqe7BwJ.description:
This spell removes one curse from a character, item, or area. Some curses, especially those on magical items, may only be lifted temporarily. For permanent removal, a dispel evil spell or a remove curse cast by a higher-level caster may be required (at the DM's discretion).

The reverse of this spell, curse, imposes a penalty or misfortune on the target, with effects limited only by the caster's imagination. If the curse is too powerful, it may rebound on the caster (DM's discretion). Typical curses include a -4 penalty to attack rolls, a -2 penalty to saving throws, halving of a prime requisite, or a -4 penalty on others' reaction rolls. The victim may make a saving throw vs. spells to avoid the curse.
0B3YsrdGmoqe7BwJ.name: Remove Curse*

0fcDXgEqN5rnrStV.description: Once per day, the Archon can use a bolt of purity, which causes all victims to become Lawful and peaceful for [[/r 2d6 #lawful and peaceful for this many turns]] turns. It does not cause damage and removes all evil thoughts (no saving throw).
0fcDXgEqN5rnrStV.gmNotes: Bolt of Purity causing Lawful and peaceful behavior.
0fcDXgEqN5rnrStV.name: Bolt of Purity

1mg9BUAToUwFvn7x.description:
The reversed form of the quest spell, *Remove Quest* dispels an unwanted quest or removes a quest-related curse. The base chance of successfully removing the quest is 50%, modified by ±5% for each level difference between the caster of *Remove Quest* and the original caster of the quest.

For example, an 11th-level cleric attempting to remove a quest imposed by a 13th-level caster has a 40% chance of success, while a 36th-level cleric removing a quest cast by a 20th-level cleric has a 99% chance of success (capped to prevent automatic success).
1mg9BUAToUwFvn7x.name: Remove Quest*
1mg9BUAToUwFvn7x.spellEffect: Removes an unwanted quest or curse

2cqXD6t9njT7XocP.description: This spell inflicts 3d6 + 3 points of damage on a creature touched by the caster. A successful melee attack roll is required.
2cqXD6t9njT7XocP.name: Cause Critical Wounds*
2cqXD6t9njT7XocP.spellEffect: Inflicts critical damage on one creature

2xdarj8kdgBslI2U.description:
By casting this spell, the cleric gains the ability to navigate toward a specific place, even if they have never been there before. For the duration of the spell, the cleric instinctively knows the direction to their destination.

Special Knowledge: In addition to knowing the correct path, the cleric gains magical awareness of any special knowledge needed to reach the location. This may include:

  • The location of secret doors
  • Hidden or obscured passages
  • Passwords required to gain entry

Duration Effects: When the spell ends, the cleric retains only a general sense of the direction to the destination; all other special knowledge is forgotten.

Restriction: If the cleric attempts to record or disclose the special knowledge to others in any way, the spell is instantly negated.

This spell is often used to find fast escape routes or to navigate unknown terrain.
2xdarj8kdgBslI2U.name: Find the Path
2xdarj8kdgBslI2U.spellDuration: 6 turns + 1 turn per level of the caster
2xdarj8kdgBslI2U.spellEffect: Shows the path to an area

3U6igm8d8wt50Z44.description:
This spell creates an invisible barrier around the caster, extending 10' in all directions. It grants each creature within the barrier a +1 bonus to all saving throws, while attacks against those inside suffer a -1 penalty on attack rolls.

Effect: Enchanted creatures (such as magically summoned or controlled beings) cannot engage in melee with anyone inside the barrier. However, if a protected creature attacks an enchanted one, the barrier no longer prevents melee attacks, though saving throw bonuses and attack roll penalties remain active.

Missile and magical attacks from outside the barrier still suffer the -1 attack penalty but are otherwise unaffected.
3U6igm8d8wt50Z44.name: Protection from Evil 10' Radius

4SGsfoRHtw1yD81j.description: The reversed form of the spell, cause fear, will make any one creature flee for two turns. The victim may make a saving throw vs. spells to avoid the effect. This reversed spell has a range of 120'.
4SGsfoRHtw1yD81j.name: Cause Fear*

4rLIJh1kZJk5vy5H.description: This spell doubles the size of one normal or giant animal, increasing its strength, damage, and carrying capacity accordingly. The animal’s behavior, armor class, and hit points remain unchanged, and the spell has no effect on intelligent or fantastic creatures.
4rLIJh1kZJk5vy5H.name: Growth of Animal
4rLIJh1kZJk5vy5H.spellEffect: Doubles the size of one animal

57Hrp5QDGxyGL96N.description: Archons can teleport at will to any location within their sight or to known places.
57Hrp5QDGxyGL96N.name: Teleport

5YRMPqyYryXybQSj.description: The saving throw against "Stone or Paralysis" protects a character from attacks or effects that could freeze them in place (paralysis) or turn them into stone. If the saving throw is failed, the character becomes immobilized or petrified, depending on the effect. Paralysis leaves a character aware but unable to act, while petrification turns the character and their carried equipment into a stone statue. The duration or permanence of these effects is specified by the source, and successful saving throws avoid them entirely​​​.
5YRMPqyYryXybQSj.name: Turn to Stone or Paralysis

5gp2MJ6awBVkgvbz.description: Continual darkness, creates a similarly-sized area of total darkness, unaffected by normal light sources and infravision. A continual light spell can cancel it. If cast on a creature’s eyes, the target must make a saving throw vs. spells or be blinded.
5gp2MJ6awBVkgvbz.name: Continual Darkness*

80TcIGKznKpXDDxB.description:
By means of this spell, a caster may ask three questions of a deceased spirit if the body is within range.

A caster of 6th or 7th level can contact recently deceased spirits (those dead up to 4 days). Casters of levels 8-14 have slightly more power (contacting spirits up to 4 months dead), and casters of levels 15-20 have even more (speaking with corpses up to 4 years dead). No time limits apply to casters of 21st level or greater.

The spirit will always reply in a tongue known to the caster, but can only offer knowledge of things up to the time of its death. If the spirit's alignment is the same as the caster's, it will provide clear and brief answers; however, if the alignments differ, the spirit may reply in riddles.
80TcIGKznKpXDDxB.name: Speak with the Dead

9eQxUUhrluL6Lxxi.description:
Blight, imposes a -1 penalty to morale, attack rolls, and damage rolls of enemies. Each affected creature may make a saving throw vs. spells to avoid these penalties.

It affects only those within a 20' x 20' area and only those who are not yet engaged in melee combat.
9eQxUUhrluL6Lxxi.name: Blight*

9fArqNl4AkPoSUVt.description:
This spell allows the spellcaster to determine the alignment (Lawful, Neutral, or Chaotic) of any one creature within 10'. It can also reveal the alignment of an enchanted item or area, if applicable.

The reversed form, confuse alignment, lasts for one turn per level of the spellcaster and can be cast on a creature by touch. No saving throw is allowed. For the duration of the spell, any attempt to discern the recipient's alignment will yield a false result. This false alignment will remain consistent for all subsequent detection attempts during the spell's duration.
9fArqNl4AkPoSUVt.name: Know Alignment*

9nv1kz6H2AGJHajI.description:
When the spellcaster casts this spell and then touches any living creature, it will calm the creature and remove any fear. If the creature has been affected by a fear spell or effect that normally does not allow a saving throw, the remove fear spell can still be effective. If the spellcaster uses the spell on someone afflicted by a magical fear effect, the victim gets to make a saving throw vs. spells, with a bonus to the roll equal to the spellcaster's level of experience (up to a maximum bonus of +6). If the saving throw is successful, the victim's fear is dispelled. Regardless of the spellcaster's level or any bonuses, a roll of 1 will always fail.

The reversed form of the spell, cause fear, will make any one creature flee for two turns. The victim may make a saving throw vs. spells to avoid the effect. This reversed spell has a range of 120'.
9nv1kz6H2AGJHajI.name: Remove Fear*

A2y2E3HScGlmyRWQ.description:
This spell creates light as bright as daylight in a spherical volume with a 30' radius. It lasts until dispelled or countered by a continual darkness spell. Creatures that suffer penalties in bright daylight also suffer them within the area of effect.

If cast on a creature’s eyes, the target must make a saving throw vs. spells or be blinded until the effect is removed. This spell can be cast in an area, on an object, or directly on a creature's eyes to cause blindness.

The reverse, continual darkness, creates a similarly-sized area of total darkness, unaffected by normal light sources and infravision. A continual light spell can cancel it. If cast on a creature’s eyes, the target must make a saving throw vs. spells or be blinded.
A2y2E3HScGlmyRWQ.name: Continual Light*

BYg6CpfE4yoEUVoT.description:
Free person, lifts the paralysis from up to four victims affected by the normal form of the spell (including *hold person* cast by a magic-user or an elf). It has no effect on other forms of paralysis, such as that caused by a ghoul.

This spell paralyzes up to four creatures, affecting any human, demihuman, or human-like beings such as bugbears, dryads, gnolls, hobgoblins, kobolds, lizard men, ogres, orcs, nixies, pixies, or sprites. It does not affect undead or creatures larger than ogres. Each target must make a saving throw vs. spells or be paralyzed for nine turns. If the spell is cast at a single target, that creature receives a -2 penalty to their saving throw. If cast at a group, up to four creatures of the spellcaster's choice can be affected, but without any penalty to their saving throws. The paralysis can only be removed by the reversed form of this spell or a dispel magic spell.
BYg6CpfE4yoEUVoT.name: Free Person*

BhV0CE314AnKXftZ.description:
The reversed form of *Raise Dead*, this spell creates a death ray that kills a single living creature within 60' unless the target succeeds on a saving throw vs. death ray.

Undead Effect: If cast on an undead creature with 10 or more Hit Dice (such as a phantom, haunt, spirit, nightshade, or special), it restores 3d10 hit points instead of dealing damage.

A Lawful cleric will typically only use *Finger of Death* in life-or-death situations.
BhV0CE314AnKXftZ.name: Finger of Death*
BhV0CE314AnKXftZ.spellEffect: Kills one living creature or heals high-HD undead

DeDuo4HPGOpU5rq8.description:
This spell creates and invisible magical barrier all around the caster's body (less than an inch away). Here’s the revised text with all references to "cleric" changed to "caster":

While the spell is in effect, characters and monsters attacking the caster suffer a -1 penalty to their attack rolls, and the caster gains a +1 bonus to all saving throws.

Additionally, enchanted creatures are unable to touch the caster! (An enchanted creature is one that normal weapons cannot affect, only magical weapons can hit. A creature that can only be hit by a silver weapon—like a werewolf—is not considered enchanted. Any creature that is magically summoned or controlled, such as a charmed character, is also considered enchanted.) This barrier completely protects the caster from all melee or hand-to-hand attacks from such creatures; however, it does not prevent attacks from missile weapons. Enchanted creatures using missile weapons still suffer the -1 penalty to attack rolls but can still hit the caster.

This spell does not affect a magic missile spell used by magic-users.

If the caster attacks an enchanted creature during the spell's duration, the spell’s effect changes slightly. Enchanted creatures are then able to touch the caster, but still suffer the attack roll penalty; the penalty and the caster's saving throw adjustments remain until the spell's duration ends.
DeDuo4HPGOpU5rq8.name: Protection from Evil

E0vYGW3avZ8aY7IQ.description: Archons can cast spells as 12th level clerics. They are immune to fire, poison, and 1st through 4th level spells of all types.
E0vYGW3avZ8aY7IQ.name: Spellcasting/Immunity

Eaj9iTO8HOJ2JY9U.description:
This spell instantly teleports the cleric and all equipment they are carrying to their designated sanctuary, regardless of distance.

Sanctuary Requirement: The cleric must have a permanent home (such as a castle) that includes a meditation room. This room serves as the spell’s destination.

Initiative Advantage: During the round this spell is cast, the cleric automatically gains initiative unless surprised.

Restrictions:

  • The spell affects only the cleric and their carried equipment.
  • Other creatures cannot be transported.
Eaj9iTO8HOJ2JY9U.name: Word of Recall

EmADFPMP9t6oxlrW.description: The Magic Wand saving throw is used to avoid the effects of attacks or abilities activated through magical wands, such as paralysis rays or damage-dealing beams. A successful save, rolled on a d20, indicates that the character avoids or mitigates the harmful effects. The target number to save is determined by the character's class and level, as found on the saving throw table​​.
EmADFPMP9t6oxlrW.name: Magic Wand

Fpt9U8delHP6gPrU.description:
This spell allows the cleric to raise any human, dwarf, halfling, or elf from the dead. The body must be present, and any missing parts will cause corresponding disabilities in the raised character.

Effect: An 8th-level cleric can raise a body that has been dead up to four days. Each level above 8th extends this limit by four additional days (e.g., a 10th-level cleric can raise bodies dead for up to twelve days).

The character is raised with 1 hit point and is weakened: unable to fight, cast spells, or move faster than half speed. These penalties last for two weeks of complete bed rest, which cannot be hastened by magical healing.

Undead Effect: When cast on an undead creature within range, the target must make a saving throw vs. spells with a -2 penalty or be destroyed. Vampires that fail the save retreat to their coffins in gaseous form. Against undead creatures stronger than vampires, the spell deals 3d10 damage (saving throw for half).
Fpt9U8delHP6gPrU.name: Raise Dead*
Fpt9U8delHP6gPrU.spellEffect: Raises one dead human or demihuman, or damages undead

GxXCrGkPTaHRBrN1.description: The Death Ray or Poison saving throw is a roll made by a character to resist deadly effects like instant death or paralysis from poisons, spells, or traps. The player rolls a d20 and compares it to their class- and level-specific target number on the saving throw table; success means avoiding or mitigating the harm. A failed roll often results in death (for poison) or other severe consequences, though optional rules may instead inflict substantial damage​​​.
GxXCrGkPTaHRBrN1.name: Death Ray or Poison

H5gPGvZbBiWOXbVq.description:
This spell creates a sphere of light, as if cast by a bright torch or lamp. If the spell is cast on an object (such as a weapon), the light moves with the object.

If the spell is cast at a creature's eyes, the victim makes a saving throw vs. spell. If the saving throw fails, the victim is blinded by the light for the duration of the spell, or until the spell effect is canceled.

When reversed, this spell, darkness, creates a sphere of darkness instead. It will block all sight except infravision. Darkness cancels a light spell if cast upon it, but may itself be canceled by another light spell. If cast at an opponent's eyes, darkness causes blindness for the duration of the spell or until canceled. If the victim makes a successful saving throw vs. spell, the spell has no effect.
H5gPGvZbBiWOXbVq.name: Light*

HDfyr2lSK4yogTKy.description:
This spell summons a vast swarm of insects in a 30' radius, obscuring vision and driving off creatures with less than 3 Hit Dice (no saving throw). The caster can direct the swarm to move up to 20' per round within a range of 480' but must remain still and concentrate.

If the caster is disturbed, the insects scatter and the spell ends. This spell can only be cast outdoors and above ground.
HDfyr2lSK4yogTKy.name: Insect Plague

JNVdUgpufjHyxmgU.description:
This spell compels the target to undertake a specific task or quest as commanded by the caster. The target may attempt a saving throw vs. spells to resist; if successful, the spell has no effect.

Typical Tasks: The task might include slaying a particular monster, rescuing a prisoner, retrieving a magical item, or embarking on a pilgrimage. If the task is impossible or suicidal, the spell fails automatically.

Duration: The spell remains in effect until the specified task is completed. This spell compels the target to fulfill the task but does not compel them to do so willingly. Once completed, the target may hold a grudge against the caster, potentially seeking revenge depending on the circumstances of the quest.

Curse: A target who refuses to undertake the quest is cursed until they resume the task. The nature of this curse is determined by the GM and may be twice the usual strength of a standard curse.
JNVdUgpufjHyxmgU.name: Quest*
JNVdUgpufjHyxmgU.spellEffect: Compels one creature to perform a task

JRHIQj98lFjqRK9g.description:
This spell creates enough food to feed up to 12 men and their mounts for one day. For every level above 8th, it creates enough for 12 more people and mounts.

Note: Created food spoils after 24 hours and cannot be stored for future use.
JRHIQj98lFjqRK9g.name: Create Food

KerdQtd5si8dFVXy.description:
This spell grants the cleric the ability to communicate with any living or undead creatures within 30'. Even unintelligent monsters will understand and respond.

Effects:

  • Creatures spoken to will not attack the cleric while in conversation.
  • However, if attacked, they may defend themselves or flee.
  • The cleric may ask only one question per round.

The spell lasts for one round per level of the cleric.
KerdQtd5si8dFVXy.name: Speak with Monsters*
KerdQtd5si8dFVXy.spellDuration: 1 round per level of the cleric

KtxV4y7MNGtGkkAP.description: The saving throw for Spells or Magic Staff includes resistance against magical effects cast by rods, staves, wands, or through spells. A successful save, rolled on a d20, often reduces or negates the spell's effects entirely. This saving throw is applicable to numerous magical attacks, such as charm spells, fireballs, or paralysis effects, and covers damage, control, or debilitating conditions caused by magical devices or spellcasters. The target number for success is based on the character's class and level.
KtxV4y7MNGtGkkAP.name: Spells or Magic Staff

OFj7uZOjnJLeCYIu.description: This spell renders any poison harmless in a creature, container, or on an object. It can revive a creature poisoned within the last 10 rounds but does not heal any other damage.
OFj7uZOjnJLeCYIu.name: Neutralize Poison*

P7vzLaCT4uzyk1sL.description: The saving throw against Breath Weapons is used to resist or mitigate the effects of a wide range of powerful exhaled attacks, not limited to dragons. This includes attacks like a dragon’s fiery or icy breath, a gorgon's petrifying breath, or a chimera's elemental breath. Each creature’s breath weapon has specific effects, such as damage, paralysis, or petrification. A successful saving throw generally halves the damage or avoids the secondary effect (such as paralysis or petrification), while failure applies the full consequences. The target number for the saving throw is determined by the character’s class and level.
P7vzLaCT4uzyk1sL.name: Dragon Breath

PPH1oDRZAjXPaH2v.description:
This spell instantly destroys one magical barrier created by a cleric. It can also dispel certain barriers created by a magic-user.

Effects: *Remove Barrier* will destroy a cleric's *Barrier* spell and can also dispel the following magic-user spells:

  • Wall of Ice
  • Wall of Fire
  • Clothform
  • Woodform
  • Wall of Stone

Limitations: This spell does not affect the following spells: *Wall of Iron*, *Stoneform*, *Ironform*, or *Steelform*.
PPH1oDRZAjXPaH2v.name: Remove Barrier*

PnOatLzqlNMh12zZ.description: Curse imposes a penalty or misfortune on the target, with effects limited only by the caster's imagination. If the curse is too powerful, it may rebound on the caster (DM's discretion). Typical curses include a -4 penalty to attack rolls, a -2 penalty to saving throws, halving of a prime requisite, or a -4 penalty on others' reaction rolls. The victim may make a saving throw vs. spells to avoid the curse.
PnOatLzqlNMh12zZ.name: Curse*

QECoP5C8fyiRWVst.description:
When casting this spell, the spellcaster must name one type of animal (such as wolves). For the duration of the spell, the spellcaster can communicate with all animals of that type within 30'; the effect moves with the caster.

The spell allows the caster to speak to any normal or giant forms of the named animal type, but only to one type at a time. The spell cannot be used to communicate with intelligent animals or fantastic creatures.

The animals typically react favorably (with a +2 bonus to reaction rolls) and may be persuaded to perform a favor for the spellcaster if the reaction roll is high enough. The animal must be capable of understanding and carrying out the request.
QECoP5C8fyiRWVst.name: Speak with Animals

QRRqBWrNOG1XitgF.description: This spell causes all mechanical and magical traps within 30' of the spellcaster to emit a faint blue glow. While it reveals the presence of traps, it does not provide information on their type or how to disarm them. Ambushes or natural hazards like quicksand are not considered traps and will not be revealed by this spell.
QRRqBWrNOG1XitgF.name: Find Traps

TayLFAJuCvv4xy9E.description:
This spell creates poison in a creature or container upon touch. A creature must succeed on a saving throw vs. poison or die instantly. When cast on a container, the poison affects its contents with no save.

Notes: Poisoning is usually considered a Chaotic act.
TayLFAJuCvv4xy9E.name: Create Poison*
TayLFAJuCvv4xy9E.spellEffect: Creates poison in a creature or container

UYjYu3UPCPjHx9Lc.description: Darkness, creates a sphere of darkness instead. It will block all sight except infravision. Darkness cancels a light spell if cast upon it, but may itself be canceled by another light spell. If cast at an opponent's eyes, darkness causes blindness for the duration of the spell or until canceled. If the victim makes a successful saving throw vs. spell, the spell has no effect.
UYjYu3UPCPjHx9Lc.name: Darkness*

Ukv1m9PQnyhET7ov.description:
This spell allows the caster to communicate with plants within a 30' radius, treating them as if they have intelligence. The caster may ask simple favors, such as making a path through dense undergrowth, which the plants will grant if able.

Effect: Enables communication with plant creatures, including plantlike monsters such as treants.
Ukv1m9PQnyhET7ov.name: Speak with Plants

WcX83aRD9MDGGVRQ.description:
This spell animates normal skeletons or dead bodies within range, transforming them into enchanted skeletons or zombies. These undead obey the caster until destroyed by a dispel magic spell or another cleric.

Effect: For each experience level, the caster can animate 1 HD of undead. Skeletons retain the HD of the original creature, while zombies have +1 HD.
