Humans and demihumans are treated as 1 HD for this spell. A human’s corpse would be animated as a 1 HD skeleton or a 2 HD zombie.

Notes: Animated undead are immune to sleep, charm, and poison effects. Using this spell for good is advised for lawful casters, as animating the dead is often seen as a Chaotic act.
WcX83aRD9MDGGVRQ.name: Animate Dead

WuoCyDzuR72E2SXY.description: This spell allows the caster to sense the direction of a known object within range, but not its distance. It can detect a common object with a partial description, such as "stairs leading up," but will only indicate the direction of the nearest such object. To find a specific object, the caster must know exactly what the object looks like (size, shape, color, etc.). The spell will not locate a creature.
WuoCyDzuR72E2SXY.name: Locate Object

YyVzk08hBIuLamq3.description:
This spell enhances the morale of friendly creatures by +1 and grants them a +1 bonus to all attack and damage rolls. It affects only those within a 20' x 20' area and only those who are not yet engaged in melee combat.

The reversed form, blight, imposes a -1 penalty to morale, attack rolls, and damage rolls of enemies. Each affected creature may make a saving throw vs. spells to avoid these penalties.
YyVzk08hBIuLamq3.name: Bless*

ZFakRShP8soEs7dk.description:
This spell creates a magical barrier up to 30' in diameter and 30' high, consisting of whirling and dancing hammers. The barrier is obviously dangerous to any who pass through it.

Damage: Any creature passing through the barrier takes [[/r 7d10 #points of damage]] (7-70) points of damage. No saving throw is allowed.

This spell is commonly used to block entrances, corridors, or other key passages.
ZFakRShP8soEs7dk.name: Barrier*

a43SNUn55F07FD0F.description:
Confuse alignment, lasts for one turn per level of the spellcaster and can be cast on a creature by touch. No saving throw is allowed. For the duration of the spell, any attempt to discern the recipient's alignment will yield a false result. This false alignment will remain consistent for all subsequent detection attempts during the spell's duration.

This spell allows the spellcaster to determine the alignment (Lawful, Neutral, or Chaotic) of any one creature within 10'. It can also reveal the alignment of an enchanted item or area, if applicable.
a43SNUn55F07FD0F.name: Confuse Alignment*

bjbZ8aquRhls9RRR.description: A normal sword is a one-handed sword with a straight or curved blade 2’ to 3’ long. This category of sword encompasses a variety of different styles of sword, ranging from scimitars to broadswords and even rapiers.
bjbZ8aquRhls9RRR.name: Sword, Normal

cwJpHBfHxRdOxjBw.description: This spell heals 2d6 + 2 points of damage on one living creature when touched by the caster.
cwJpHBfHxRdOxjBw.name: Cure Serious Wounds*

fQblyLGEy0TTohom.description:
This spell cures one living (not undead or non-living) creature of [[/r 1d6+1 #Cure Light Wounds]] points of damage. The caster can cure themselves with this spell.

Alternately, the spell can be used to cure paralysis (except that caused by a Hold Person or Hold Monster spell), although if it does so then no damage will be cured at the same time.

The spell will not increase the target's maximum hit points.

When reversed, this spell, cause light wounds, causes [[/r 1d6+1 #Cause Light Wounds]] points of damage to the target. No saving throw is allowed, but the caster must make a normal attack roll to inflict this damage.
fQblyLGEy0TTohom.name: Cure Light Wounds*

fxgYO2aQJCd5aNCs.description:
This spell summons an enchanted spring from the ground or a wall, flowing for 6 turns and producing enough water for 12 men and their mounts (about 50 gallons).

Each level above 8th allows the cleric to create water for an additional 12 men and mounts. The caster can control the amount of water produced, up to the spell’s maximum.
fxgYO2aQJCd5aNCs.name: Create Water

gjhDbdwQojLgY0PH.description:
This spell allows the cleric to create normal animals out of thin air. The animals appear at a chosen point within 30' and will obey the cleric at all times. They can be commanded to fight, carry items, guard areas, or perform other tasks within their natural abilities.

Once created, the animals can be sent up to 240' away but will continue to follow the cleric's commands. However, if instructions are not carefully worded, they may act according to their natural instincts.

Number and Size of Animals: The cleric chooses the number of animals, but not their exact type. The DM determines the specific creatures, which may include:

  • 1 large animal (e.g., elephant, hippopotamus)
  • 3 medium-sized animals (e.g., bear, great cat)
  • 6 small animals (e.g., wolf, rock baboon)

The spell cannot create giant animals. The animals disappear when slain or when the spell duration ends.
gjhDbdwQojLgY0PH.name: Create Normal Animals

gspzgTFzGIpD0j2l.description: This spell makes spoiled or poisoned food and water safe for consumption. It can purify one ration of preserved food (either iron or standard rations), six waterskins of water, or enough regular food to feed twelve people. If cast on mud, the spell causes the dirt to settle, leaving behind a pool of pure, clear water. The spell does not affect any living creatures.
gspzgTFzGIpD0j2l.name: Purify Food and Water

h82SvwJEsitrDpT3.description:
This spell allows the spellcaster to charm a number of Hit Dice of snakes equal to their level, with no saving throw allowed. For example, a 5th-level spellcaster could charm one 5 HD snake, five 1 HD snakes, or any combination of snakes totaling 5 Hit Dice or less. The charmed snakes will rise up and sway, but will not attack unless provoked.

If the spell is cast on snakes that are attacking the spellcaster, the duration is [[/r 1d4 + 1 #Snake Charm duration in rounds]]. Otherwise, the spell lasts for [[/r 1d4 + 1 #Snake Charm duration in turns]]. Once the spell ends, the snakes return to their normal behavior, but they will not automatically be hostile unless provoked.
h82SvwJEsitrDpT3.name: Snake Charm
h82SvwJEsitrDpT3.spellEffect: Charms 1 HD of snakes per level of the caster

hkgOtliHYaFBUlN0.description:
This spell allows the cleric to animate non-living, non-magical objects, causing them to move and attack. Magical objects are unaffected.

The spell can animate either:

  • One object up to 400 lbs (4,000 cn), roughly the size of two men.
  • Multiple smaller objects, as long as their total weight does not exceed 400 lbs.

Combat Abilities: The DM determines the movement rate, number of attacks, damage, and armor class of animated objects. As a guideline:

  • A man-sized statue might move at 30' per round, attack once per round for [[/r 2d8 #points of damage]] damage, and have AC 1.
  • A chair might move at 180' per round, attack twice per round for [[/r 1d4 #points of damage]] damage per attack, and have AC 6.

All animated objects use the cleric’s chance to hit in combat.
hkgOtliHYaFBUlN0.name: Animate Objects

icU2BNvB7OIM68G3.description:
This spell paralyzes up to four creatures, affecting any human, demihuman, or human-like beings such as bugbears, dryads, gnolls, hobgoblins, kobolds, lizard men, ogres, orcs, nixies, pixies, or sprites. It does not affect undead or creatures larger than ogres. Each target must make a saving throw vs. spells or be paralyzed for nine turns. If the spell is cast at a single target, that creature receives a -2 penalty to their saving throw. If cast at a group, up to four creatures of the spellcaster's choice can be affected, but without any penalty to their saving throws. The paralysis can only be removed by the reversed form of this spell or a dispel magic spell.

The reversed spell, free person, lifts the paralysis from up to four victims affected by the normal form of the spell (including *hold person* cast by a magic-user or an elf). It has no effect on other forms of paralysis, such as that caused by a ghoul.
icU2BNvB7OIM68G3.name: Hold Person*

ijWmIE0SrcCPGbCf.description:
This spell cures any disease, including those caused by mummies or green slime. At 11th level or higher, it can also cure lycanthropy.

The reverse, cause disease, infects the target with a wasting disease. The target must make a saving throw vs. spells or suffer a -2 penalty on attack rolls and hindered healing. The disease is fatal within [[/r 2d12 #Cure Disease duration in days]] days unless removed by a cure disease spell.
ijWmIE0SrcCPGbCf.name: Cure Disease*

jGEe1btp4p3UIcw8.description: The Archon's feathers provide extreme protection, representing an Armor Class of -6.
jGEe1btp4p3UIcw8.name: Golden Feathers

jHrSJqH2hofl4gf7.description: For the duration of this spell, the recipient is immune to damage from normal fire and heat. They also receive a +2 bonus to all saving throws against magical fire (such as dragon breath or fireball). Additionally, any damage taken from such magical fire is reduced by 1 point per die of damage, with each die dealing at least 1 point of damage. For red dragon breath, the damage is reduced by 1 point per Hit Die of the dragon, but never below 1 point per Hit Die.
jHrSJqH2hofl4gf7.name: Resist Fire

jotNz7YD7iKk49gq.description:
This spell transforms [[/r 2d8 #sticks into snakes]] sticks into snakes, which may be poisonous (50% chance per snake). The snakes obey the caster's commands but will revert to sticks when slain or when the spell's duration ends.

Snake Stats: AC 6; HD 1; AT 1 bite; Dmg 1d4; MV 90' (30'); Save F1; ML 12; AL Neutral; SA poison (50% chance per snake to be poisonous).

Non-poisonous snakes grant 10 XP each, while poisonous ones grant 13 XP each.
jotNz7YD7iKk49gq.name: Sticks to Snakes
jotNz7YD7iKk49gq.spellEffect: Turns up to 16 sticks into snakes

jseQb05IzfyLO8if.description: This spell inflicts 2d6 + 2 points of damage on a creature touched by the caster. A successful melee attack roll is required to deliver the spell.
jseQb05IzfyLO8if.name: Cause Serious Wounds*

lAO8Zq3J4GIcAOu6.description:
This spell affects all undead and enchanted monsters within 30'. Each affected creature must make a saving throw vs. spells or be destroyed. If cast on a single creature, it takes a -2 penalty to its saving throw.

Effect: Banishes creatures from other planes if they fail their saving throw. Those that save must flee and stay away as long as the caster concentrates, remaining stationary.

The spell can also remove a curse from one item or dispel a magical charm effect on a creature.
lAO8Zq3J4GIcAOu6.name: Dispel Evil
lAO8Zq3J4GIcAOu6.spellEffect: Affects undead, enchanted creatures, or one curse or charm

lSEKAKIAMB5GUH3O.description: This spell cures almost any form of blindness, including those caused by light or darkness spells. It will not affect blindness caused by a curse.
lSEKAKIAMB5GUH3O.name: Cure Blindness

mw7JEPK1FHFDhTdm.description: When this spell is cast, all creatures within 30' of the spellcaster are protected from freezing temperatures without harm. Those affected also receive a +2 bonus to all saving throws against cold-based attacks. Additionally, any cold damage dealt to them is reduced by 1 point per die, with a minimum of 1 point of damage per die. The effect moves with the spellcaster.
mw7JEPK1FHFDhTdm.name: Resist Cold

n03jfLVZ4e2u8BdY.description:
This spell summons an intelligent elemental being called an Aerial Servant to retrieve a specified item or creature and return it to the caster. The servant appears immediately, and the cleric must describe the target and its location, or the servant will depart.

The aerial servant is ethereal at will, allowing it to bypass most barriers, but it cannot pass through a Protection from Evil effect.

Task and Duration: The servant will attempt to find and bring back the target within the spell's duration (1 day per caster level). If the spell ends before the task is completed—whether the servant is still searching or already returning—it is considered a failure.

Strength and Carrying Capacity: The aerial servant has 18 Strength and can carry up to 500 lbs (5,000 cn).

Failure Consequences: If the aerial servant cannot complete its task within the spell duration, it goes insane and immediately returns to attack the caster.
n03jfLVZ4e2u8BdY.name: Aerial Servant
n03jfLVZ4e2u8BdY.spellEffect: Servant fetches one item or creature

ntrk6wlyLwyfaWk2.description: This spell heals one living creature of 3d6 + 3 points of damage.
ntrk6wlyLwyfaWk2.name: Cure Critical Wounds*

ptUnkZ1Gr17ifqZx.description: When the spell is cast, the caster will see evilly enchanted objects within 120' glow dark red. It also causes creates that intent to harm the caster to glow when they are within the area of effect. Not all Chaotic alignment creatures will have evil intentions, but many do. Traps and poisons are neither good nor evil, merely dangerous; this spell does not reveal them.
ptUnkZ1Gr17ifqZx.name: Detect Evil

qGJH3hPoP7uK09LJ.description: Once per day, the Archon may create a sword of flame, which lasts for three turns. It deals 4d8 damage on a successful hit.
qGJH3hPoP7uK09LJ.name: Sword of Flame

rhVZfEXCxMK9guZK.description:
This spell allows the caster to see a glow around any magical creature, object and place within range. Magical creatures do not get a saving throw against this effect.

The glow only extends a couple of inches around the magical object, so if it is in a container or behind another object then some or all of the glow may not be visible.
rhVZfEXCxMK9guZK.name: Detect Magic

s2Fbr79bcFlVq4Uu.description:
This spell allows the cleric to ask three yes-or-no questions of the greater powers (such as forces of nature, greater spirits, or Immortals).

Usage: May only be used once per week. The DM may restrict this to once a month if overused. Once a year, the cleric may ask six questions, usually on a day significant to the powers questioned.
s2Fbr79bcFlVq4Uu.name: Commune

sOajVLnaoGD8q4TG.description:
This is the most powerful healing spell available. When used to cure wounds, it restores nearly all damage, leaving the recipient with only [[/r 1d6 #damage remains]] points of damage remaining.

Healing Process: Restore the target to full starting hit points, then roll 1d6 and subtract that amount from their total.

Alternative Uses: Instead of healing damage, Cureall may be used to cure one of the following conditions:

  • Remove a curse
  • Neutralize poison
  • Cure paralysis
  • Cure disease
  • Cure blindness
  • Remove a Feeblemind effect

If the recipient is suffering from multiple afflictions (such as wounds and a curse), the cleric must specify which one the spell is curing.

Effect on Recently Raised Creatures: If cast on someone who has just been affected by Raise Dead, Cureall eliminates the need for two weeks of bed rest, allowing the target to function normally immediately. This is the only magical healing that works on a newly raised creature.
sOajVLnaoGD8q4TG.name: Cureall

sxFoojSVpKOl4j8R.description:
The reverse of *Speak with Monsters*, this spell prevents one creature from communicating in any way.

Effects:

  • The target may attempt a saving throw vs. spells, but with a -2 penalty.
  • If the save fails, the victim is unable to communicate for the spell’s duration.
  • This includes all forms of communication: speech, hand gestures, writing, telepathy, etc.
  • The victim can still cast spells but cannot use magic items requiring command words, as the words turn into gibberish.

Duration: 1 turn per level of the caster.
sxFoojSVpKOl4j8R.name: Babble*
sxFoojSVpKOl4j8R.spellDuration: 1 turn per level of the caster

uOlNhMnz4opesMy0.description:
With *Truesight*, the cleric gains the ability to see all things as they truly are within a 120' radius. The spell reveals all hidden, invisible, and ethereal objects or creatures, functioning as the *detect invisible* spell.

Additionally, the cleric perceives any secret doors, and can see through any form of disguise, polymorph, or other alterations. Deception is impossible. The spell also reveals creatures' alignments, experience, and power levels.
uOlNhMnz4opesMy0.name: Truesight
uOlNhMnz4opesMy0.spellEffect: Reveals true forms of all things within 120'

uuwIXtEGF53M3TQR.description:
This spell cures one living (not undead or non-living) creature of [[/r 1d6+1 #Cure Light Wounds]] points of damage. The caster can cure themselves with this spell.

Alternately, the spell can be used to cure paralysis (except that caused by a Hold Person or Hold Monster spell), although if it does so then no damage will be cured at the same time.

The spell will not increase the target's maximum hit points.

When reversed, this spell, cause light wounds, causes [[/r 1d6+1 #Cause Light Wounds]] points of damage to the target. No saving throw is allowed, but the caster must make a normal attack roll to inflict this damage.
uuwIXtEGF53M3TQR.name: Cause Light Wounds*

vBx8BeAQ39K9Lcco.description: Cause disease, infects the target with a wasting disease. The target must make a saving throw vs. spells or suffer a -2 penalty on attack rolls and hindered healing. The disease is fatal within [[/r 2d12 #Cure Disease duration in days]] days unless removed by a cure disease spell.
vBx8BeAQ39K9Lcco.name: Cause Disease*

vkVqLG73sufNHLFy.description:
This spell allows any one weapon to inflict 1d6 additional points of damage per attack (similar to a magical staff of striking). The weapon will inflict this extra damage with every successful blow for as long as the spell lasts. This bonus does not apply to attack rolls, but only to damage rolls.

If the caster casts this spell on a normal weapon, the weapon may then damage creatures which are normally affected only by magic weapons; the weapon will do 1d6 points of damage per strike (regardless of the normal damage of the weapon).
vkVqLG73sufNHLFy.name: Striking

w34BaXLsiW6kHt2v.description: This spell creates an area of total silence within a 15' radius, making it impossible to converse or cast spells inside the affected area for the duration of the spell. Those within the sphere can still hear sounds from outside. If the spell is cast on a creature, the target must make a saving throw vs. spells. If the saving throw fails, the effect moves with the creature. If successful, the silence remains stationary, and the creature can leave the affected area.
w34BaXLsiW6kHt2v.name: Silence 15' Radius

x0oDFsgZ8YwPYVOP.description:
This spell destroys other spell effects within a 20' x 20' x 20' area. It does not affect magical items but can cancel temporary effects they produce.

Effect: Automatically dispels spells from casters of equal or lower level. For higher-level casters, there is a 5% chance of failure per level difference.

Examples: A 7th-level caster trying to dispel a spell from a 9th-level caster has a 10% chance of failure.
x0oDFsgZ8YwPYVOP.name: Dispel Magic

Archon (Male).name: Archon (Male)

Athach.biography:
Athachs are gigantic humanoid monsters, standing 18 feet tall with a malformed body and a hideous appearance. Their most distinctive feature is a third arm located in the center of their chest, which they use to attack foes.

These creatures are extremely aggressive and unintelligent, often attacking anything they perceive as food. They inhabit hilly, mountainous, or wooded areas, living in small family units. When not hunting, they fight among themselves.

In combat, they bash opponents with heavy objects like tree stumps or stones, and their bite carries a potent poison. Victims of the bite must make a saving throw vs. poison with a -4 penalty or be rendered helpless for 1d6 turns. Although they are aggressive, athachs have a weakness for gems and jewelry and may accept bribes to avoid conflict.

Terrain: Hill, Mountain, Woods.

8EVG646mlpHDAsRH.description: The saving throw against Breath Weapons is used to resist or mitigate the effects of a wide range of powerful exhaled attacks, not limited to dragons. This includes attacks like a dragon’s fiery or icy breath, a gorgon's petrifying breath, or a chimera's elemental breath. Each creature’s breath weapon has specific effects, such as damage, paralysis, or petrification. A successful saving throw generally halves the damage or avoids the secondary effect (such as paralysis or petrification), while failure applies the full consequences. The target number for the saving throw is determined by the character’s class and level.
8EVG646mlpHDAsRH.name: Dragon Breath

CFgHyxQTSAEOWLCj.description: The athach attacks by bashing its opponents with heavy objects such as tree stumps or stones.
CFgHyxQTSAEOWLCj.name: Bash Attack

PCOL6QQBfprIVb4n.description: The saving throw for Spells or Magic Staff includes resistance against magical effects cast by rods, staves, wands, or through spells. A successful save, rolled on a d20, often reduces or negates the spell's effects entirely. This saving throw is applicable to numerous magical attacks, such as charm spells, fireballs, or paralysis effects, and covers damage, control, or debilitating conditions caused by magical devices or spellcasters. The target number for success is based on the character's class and level.
PCOL6QQBfprIVb4n.name: Spells or Magic Staff

Upv8O8nxYzuayqxH.description: The saving throw against "Stone or Paralysis" protects a character from attacks or effects that could freeze them in place (paralysis) or turn them into stone. If the saving throw is failed, the character becomes immobilized or petrified, depending on the effect. Paralysis leaves a character aware but unable to act, while petrification turns the character and their carried equipment into a stone statue. The duration or permanence of these effects is specified by the source, and successful saving throws avoid them entirely​​​.
Upv8O8nxYzuayqxH.name: Turn to Stone or Paralysis

bEOEc4qlbWQMgRJG.description: The athach's thick, tough hide provides protection equivalent to Armor Class 0.
bEOEc4qlbWQMgRJG.name: Thick Hide

nBf675R9uyJgomgf.description: The Death Ray or Poison saving throw is a roll made by a character to resist deadly effects like instant death or paralysis from poisons, spells, or traps. The player rolls a d20 and compares it to their class- and level-specific target number on the saving throw table; success means avoiding or mitigating the harm. A failed roll often results in death (for poison) or other severe consequences, though optional rules may instead inflict substantial damage​​​.
nBf675R9uyJgomgf.name: Death Ray or Poison

nHsJasjeZ1A59ZNV.description: The athach bites with its poisonous tusklike teeth, dealing 2d10 damage. The victim must make a saving throw vs. poison with a -4 penalty or be helpless for 1d6 turns.
nHsJasjeZ1A59ZNV.name: Poisonous Bite

t1HHg8EybnIqkgpj.description: The Magic Wand saving throw is used to avoid the effects of attacks or abilities activated through magical wands, such as paralysis rays or damage-dealing beams. A successful save, rolled on a d20, indicates that the character avoids or mitigates the harmful effects. The target number to save is determined by the character's class and level, as found on the saving throw table​​.
t1HHg8EybnIqkgpj.name: Magic Wand

Athach.name: Athach

Baboon, Rock.biography:
Rock baboons are larger and more intelligent versions of normal baboons. They are omnivorous but have a preference for meat, often hunting small herd animals. Although they do not make tools or weapons, they will pick up bones or branches to use as clubs when attacking.

Rock baboons live in packs of up to 30 members, led by a dominant male. They are known for their ferocious nature and aggressive behavior. While they do not go out of their way to attack travelers, they will aggressively defend their territory and attempt to drive away intruders with loud screams and displays of aggression.

These baboons communicate with simple screams to convey warnings and express needs. Although not interested in humans as food, they will defend their hunting grounds if they feel threatened.

Terrain: Hill, Mountain, Open.

DUaQ7HU6CaxPLfNA.gmNotes: Pack Tactics: +1 to attack rolls with at least 2 allies.
DUaQ7HU6CaxPLfNA.name: Pack Tactics

pXdCFUoGMYAWEjPq.description: The rock baboon bites its target with sharp teeth, causing 1d3 damage.

rH7iMMOAHfFicGwu.description: The rock baboon's thick fur provides protection equivalent to Armor Class 6.

Bandit.biography:
Bandits are NPC thieves who have come together to rob others. They typically operate in small groups or larger communities of 3-30 members. Often they send out raiding parties of 2-4 bandits to target travelers.

Bandits use deception, pretending to be ordinary people to surprise their victims. They are also known to set up ambushes, blocking roads with obstacles like fallen trees to force travelers to stop. Once stopped, the bandits attack from hiding, using ranged weapons to rob their victims.

In a bandit's lair, Treasure Type A can be found, but this is not carried by individual bandits. Bandits may be led by an NPC of any human character class, who is one or more levels higher than the bandits. This leader might have greater ambitions beyond robbery, such as organizing a network of bandit gangs for a more nefarious purpose or seeking revenge for an injustice.

Terrain: Any, usually wilderness along main roads.

9rcxbGMvTHk1Y82I.description: Fletched arrows in a quiver. Can be used with a long bow or short bow.
9rcxbGMvTHk1Y82I.name: Arrows

BBvw1LtUXc89lZK8.description: A short bow is a 3’-4’ bow, either made from a single piece of wood or a composite of different woods. A short bow requires both hands to fire. Bows require the use of arrows as ammunition.

Bandit (3HD).biography:
Bandits are NPC thieves who have come together to rob others. They typically operate in small groups or larger communities of 3-30 members. Often they send out raiding parties of 2-4 bandits to target travelers.

Bandits use deception, pretending to be ordinary people to surprise their victims. They are also known to set up ambushes, blocking roads with obstacles like fallen trees to force travelers to stop. Once stopped, the bandits attack from hiding, using ranged weapons to rob their victims.

In a bandit's lair, Treasure Type A can be found, but this is not carried by individual bandits. Bandits may be led by an NPC of any human character class, who is one or more levels higher than the bandits. This leader might have greater ambitions beyond robbery, such as organizing a network of bandit gangs for a more nefarious purpose or seeking revenge for an injustice.

Terrain: Any, usually wilderness along main roads.

Basilisk.biography:
A basilisk is a magical, nonintelligent creature resembling a 10-foot-long lizard with four legs and a crown-like growth on its head. Often referred to as the "king of snakes," it can be of various colors but is usually bright and distinctive.

Basilisks inhabit underground caverns or dense, wild thickets. They have the unique and dangerous ability to petrify any creature they bite or gaze upon, turning them and all their equipment to stone unless a successful saving throw vs. turn to stone is made. If surprised, a character automatically meets the basilisk’s gaze but still gets a saving throw.

Characters fighting a basilisk in melee combat must choose to either avoid its gaze, which imposes a -4 penalty to their attack rolls while granting the basilisk a +2 bonus, or meet its gaze and attack normally but risk petrification each round.

A mirror can be used to avoid direct eye contact, reducing the penalty to attack rolls to -2. If the basilisk sees its own reflection, it must make a saving throw vs. turn to stone or petrify itself!

Basilisks are native to both the Prime Plane and the elemental plane of Earth. On the Plane of Earth, they are creatures made of rock, with their gaze slowing earth-based creatures for 1d6 rounds and burrowing through rock at impressive speeds.

Terrain: Cavern, Woods; Plane of Earth.

Normal bats are very small nocturnal mammals, weighing only a few ounces. They live in caves or abandoned buildings and use echolocation to navigate. Due to their weak eyesight, spells affecting sight, such as light, have no effect on them. However, a silence 15' radius spell will blind them.

These bats do not attack people but may confuse them by flying around their heads. It takes at least ten bats to confuse one character, imposing a -2 penalty on attack rolls and saving throws and preventing spellcasting. Normal bats must check morale each round unless controlled or summoned.

Bee, Giant.biography:
Giant bees, also known as "killer bees," are foot-long aggressive insects with a nasty temperament. They will attack anyone within 30 feet of their hive. If a giant bee hits with its sting, the bee dies, but the victim must make a saving throw vs. poison or die.

If the saving throw is successful, the stinger still inflicts 1 point of damage per round as it works its way into the victim unless removed by spending one round pulling it out.

Giant bees prefer building their hives in small caves or underground areas near the surface. There will always be at least 10 bees and a queen in or near the hive. Some bees in the hive may have 1 Hit Die each (XP 13), and the queen bee has 2 Hit Dice (XP 35) and can sting repeatedly without dying.

Giant bees produce magical honey that, if consumed in large quantities (about two pints), has a half-strength potion of healing effect, curing 1d4 points of damage.

Terrain: Plain, Woods, Mountain, Hill.

ww7BVXXa06pVdNWl.gmNotes: Oil Squirt causes a -2 penalty on attack rolls until cured or after 24 hours.
ww7BVXXa06pVdNWl.name: Oil Squirt

Beetle, Giant Oil.name: Beetle, Giant Oil

Beetle, Giant Tiger.biography:
Tiger beetles are 4-foot-long giant beetles with a striped carapace resembling a tiger's skin. They are carnivores, preying on other insects and small animals, and can move quickly to catch their prey. These beetles are aggressive hunters, especially when disturbed.

Terrain: Cavern, Plain, Ruins, Woods.

0mM2fQKB1ieZMQLL.description: The saving throw for Spells or Magic Staff includes resistance against magical effects cast by rods, staves, wands, or through spells. A successful save, rolled on a d20, often reduces or negates the spell's effects entirely. This saving throw is applicable to numerous magical attacks, such as charm spells, fireballs, or paralysis effects, and covers damage, control, or debilitating conditions caused by magical devices or spellcasters. The target number for success is based on the character's class and level.
0mM2fQKB1ieZMQLL.name: Spells or Magic Staff

19XDP8oTW0ns4qOc.description: The tiger beetle bites with its powerful mandibles, dealing 2d6 damage.
19XDP8oTW0ns4qOc.name: Bite

PPSHALxyoDY7bHjU.description: The tiger beetle can move swiftly, running at speeds of 150' per turn (50' per round).
PPSHALxyoDY7bHjU.gmNotes: Fast movement of the tiger beetle.
PPSHALxyoDY7bHjU.name: Fast Movement

VLgeBmd0iEK3In7U.description: The Death Ray or Poison saving throw is a roll made by a character to resist deadly effects like instant death or paralysis from poisons, spells, or traps. The player rolls a d20 and compares it to their class- and level-specific target number on the saving throw table; success means avoiding or mitigating the harm. A failed roll often results in death (for poison) or other severe consequences, though optional rules may instead inflict substantial damage​​​.
VLgeBmd0iEK3In7U.name: Death Ray or Poison

WstfpShAkY3UMIq6.description: The saving throw against Breath Weapons is used to resist or mitigate the effects of a wide range of powerful exhaled attacks, not limited to dragons. This includes attacks like a dragon’s fiery or icy breath, a gorgon's petrifying breath, or a chimera's elemental breath. Each creature’s breath weapon has specific effects, such as damage, paralysis, or petrification. A successful saving throw generally halves the damage or avoids the secondary effect (such as paralysis or petrification), while failure applies the full consequences. The target number for the saving throw is determined by the character’s class and level.
WstfpShAkY3UMIq6.name: Dragon Breath

gZe5RBn8FMqJPjFl.description: The hard shell of the tiger beetle provides natural protection, equivalent to Armor Class 3.
gZe5RBn8FMqJPjFl.name: Carapace

o7104efljcfOcxst.description: The saving throw against "Stone or Paralysis" protects a character from attacks or effects that could freeze them in place (paralysis) or turn them into stone. If the saving throw is failed, the character becomes immobilized or petrified, depending on the effect. Paralysis leaves a character aware but unable to act, while petrification turns the character and their carried equipment into a stone statue. The duration or permanence of these effects is specified by the source, and successful saving throws avoid them entirely​​​.
o7104efljcfOcxst.name: Turn to Stone or Paralysis

rP3C2PeBf1FjgLSn.description: The Magic Wand saving throw is used to avoid the effects of attacks or abilities activated through magical wands, such as paralysis rays or damage-dealing beams. A successful save, rolled on a d20, indicates that the character avoids or mitigates the harmful effects. The target number to save is determined by the character's class and level, as found on the saving throw table​​.
rP3C2PeBf1FjgLSn.name: Magic Wand

Beetle, Giant Tiger.name: Beetle, Giant Tiger

Berserker.biography:
Berserkers are fierce fighters who enter a state of mad rage during battle. Hailing from barbarian cultures, typically northern seafaring communities, they are known for their ferocity in combat. When in battle, berserkers add +2 to their attack rolls against humans or humanoid creatures like kobolds, goblins, and orcs.

Berserkers fight to the death and may even turn on their comrades in their rage. They never retreat, surrender, or take prisoners. In a village of their culture, 10% of all fighters will be berserkers, and some societies may have entire warrior classes consisting of berserkers.

Terrain: Any.

YYnDazcAsh6m1lay.description: Berserkers wear basic armor, providing protection equivalent to Armor Class 7.
YYnDazcAsh6m1lay.name: Berserker Armor

ZSCxW2JKvwv4P9rr.description: A short sword is a sword with a straight 18” to 2’ blade. Primarily used as a stabbing rather than slashing weapon, this small blade can be used in one hand.
ZSCxW2JKvwv4P9rr.name: Sword, Short

pvpksxPTMy2jO5Lf.description: Berserkers enter a mad rage in combat, gaining +2 to attack rolls against humans and humanoid creatures like kobolds, goblins, and orcs. They fight to the death and may attack comrades in their rage. They never retreat, surrender, or take prisoners.
pvpksxPTMy2jO5Lf.gmNotes: Gains +2 to attack rolls against human or humanoid opponents in battle.
pvpksxPTMy2jO5Lf.name: Berserker Rage

Berserker.name: Berserker

Black Hag (11 HD).biography:
The Black Hag is a terrifying, hideous creature with black hair and warty blue-black skin. Unlike normal spellcasters, it revels in destruction and controls undead as if it were undead itself.

Undead Control: The black hag can control undead as if it had 22 HD, making it an extremely dangerous necromantic force.

Poisonous Claws: The hag attacks with poison-coated iron claws. Any creature hit must save vs. poison at -4 or die instantly.

Spellcasting: The black hag is a natural spellcaster, casting spells as a 7th-level cleric. (Spells not preloaded.)

Dark Lairs & Evil Minions: Black hags live in dark caves or deep forests, usually accompanied by 3d6 evil creatures (often undead).

Companions: They often keep slimes, oozes, and puddings as allies.

Terrain: Woods.

11vizBvSFYfTpz1Y.description:
By means of this spell, a caster may ask three questions of a deceased spirit if the body is within range.

A caster of 6th or 7th level can contact recently deceased spirits (those dead up to 4 days). Casters of levels 8-14 have slightly more power (contacting spirits up to 4 months dead), and casters of levels 15-20 have even more (speaking with corpses up to 4 years dead). No time limits apply to casters of 21st level or greater.

The spirit will always reply in a tongue known to the caster, but can only offer knowledge of things up to the time of its death. If the spirit's alignment is the same as the caster's, it will provide clear and brief answers; however, if the alignments differ, the spirit may reply in riddles.
11vizBvSFYfTpz1Y.name: Speak with the Dead

1dYVxK7xRt1o3OTG.description:
This spell allows the caster to communicate with plants within a 30' radius, treating them as if they have intelligence. The caster may ask simple favors, such as making a path through dense undergrowth, which the plants will grant if able.

Effect: Enables communication with plant creatures, including plantlike monsters such as treants.
1dYVxK7xRt1o3OTG.name: Speak with Plants

2Pc3imgUiRuvj0VY.description: This spell inflicts 3d6 + 3 points of damage on a creature touched by the caster. A successful melee attack roll is required.
2Pc3imgUiRuvj0VY.name: Cause Critical Wounds*
2Pc3imgUiRuvj0VY.spellEffect: Inflicts critical damage on one creature

5P8BczvwZPJLfAks.description: The saving throw against Breath Weapons is used to resist or mitigate the effects of a wide range of powerful exhaled attacks, not limited to dragons. This includes attacks like a dragon’s fiery or icy breath, a gorgon's petrifying breath, or a chimera's elemental breath. Each creature’s breath weapon has specific effects, such as damage, paralysis, or petrification. A successful saving throw generally halves the damage or avoids the secondary effect (such as paralysis or petrification), while failure applies the full consequences. The target number for the saving throw is determined by the character’s class and level.
5P8BczvwZPJLfAks.name: Dragon Breath

775K5TyNNKDurXa9.description:
Confuse alignment, lasts for one turn per level of the spellcaster and can be cast on a creature by touch. No saving throw is allowed. For the duration of the spell, any attempt to discern the recipient's alignment will yield a false result. This false alignment will remain consistent for all subsequent detection attempts during the spell's duration.

This spell allows the spellcaster to determine the alignment (Lawful, Neutral, or Chaotic) of any one creature within 10'. It can also reveal the alignment of an enchanted item or area, if applicable.
775K5TyNNKDurXa9.name: Confuse Alignment*

7cW9bscV2u925cbV.description: This spell doubles the size of one normal or giant animal, increasing its strength, damage, and carrying capacity accordingly. The animal’s behavior, armor class, and hit points remain unchanged, and the spell has no effect on intelligent or fantastic creatures.
7cW9bscV2u925cbV.name: Growth of Animal
7cW9bscV2u925cbV.spellEffect: Doubles the size of one animal

8TBjqjZ5JvxhHxeJ.description: This spell causes all mechanical and magical traps within 30' of the spellcaster to emit a faint blue glow. While it reveals the presence of traps, it does not provide information on their type or how to disarm them. Ambushes or natural hazards like quicksand are not considered traps and will not be revealed by this spell.
8TBjqjZ5JvxhHxeJ.name: Find Traps

97Rue9kZvYPZPAHI.description: This spell renders any poison harmless in a creature, container, or on an object. It can revive a creature poisoned within the last 10 rounds but does not heal any other damage.
97Rue9kZvYPZPAHI.name: Neutralize Poison*

BKGck37RM8nDM2sF.description:
This spell allows the spellcaster to charm a number of Hit Dice of snakes equal to their level, with no saving throw allowed. For example, a 5th-level spellcaster could charm one 5 HD snake, five 1 HD snakes, or any combination of snakes totaling 5 Hit Dice or less. The charmed snakes will rise up and sway, but will not attack unless provoked.

If the spell is cast on snakes that are attacking the spellcaster, the duration is [[/r 1d4 + 1 #Snake Charm duration in rounds]]. Otherwise, the spell lasts for [[/r 1d4 + 1 #Snake Charm duration in turns]]. Once the spell ends, the snakes return to their normal behavior, but they will not automatically be hostile unless provoked.
BKGck37RM8nDM2sF.name: Snake Charm
BKGck37RM8nDM2sF.spellEffect: Charms 1 HD of snakes per level of the caster

CDKZdKY1T2Uc9EnS.description:
This spell cures any disease, including those caused by mummies or green slime. At 11th level or higher, it can also cure lycanthropy.

The reverse, cause disease, infects the target with a wasting disease. The target must make a saving throw vs. spells or suffer a -2 penalty on attack rolls and hindered healing. The disease is fatal within [[/r 2d12 #Cure Disease duration in days]] days unless removed by a cure disease spell.
CDKZdKY1T2Uc9EnS.name: Cure Disease*

DLa49EKKZFGvCevO.description:
This spell creates an invisible barrier around the caster, extending 10' in all directions. It grants each creature within the barrier a +1 bonus to all saving throws, while attacks against those inside suffer a -1 penalty on attack rolls.

Effect: Enchanted creatures (such as magically summoned or controlled beings) cannot engage in melee with anyone inside the barrier. However, if a protected creature attacks an enchanted one, the barrier no longer prevents melee attacks, though saving throw bonuses and attack roll penalties remain active.

Missile and magical attacks from outside the barrier still suffer the -1 attack penalty but are otherwise unaffected.
DLa49EKKZFGvCevO.name: Protection from Evil 10' Radius

DmWi1Y9b9F3hO5ep.description:
The reversed form of *Raise Dead*, this spell creates a death ray that kills a single living creature within 60' unless the target succeeds on a saving throw vs. death ray.

Undead Effect: If cast on an undead creature with 10 or more Hit Dice (such as a phantom, haunt, spirit, nightshade, or special), it restores 3d10 hit points instead of dealing damage.

A Lawful cleric will typically only use *Finger of Death* in life-or-death situations.
DmWi1Y9b9F3hO5ep.name: Finger of Death*
DmWi1Y9b9F3hO5ep.spellEffect: Kills one living creature or heals high-HD undead

EgZ7JXB1xtkytAyf.description:
Blight, imposes a -1 penalty to morale, attack rolls, and damage rolls of enemies. Each affected creature may make a saving throw vs. spells to avoid these penalties.

It affects only those within a 20' x 20' area and only those who are not yet engaged in melee combat.
EgZ7JXB1xtkytAyf.name: Blight*

F4Xla4VuC3mifZT3.description:
This spell transforms [[/r 2d8 #sticks into snakes]] sticks into snakes, which may be poisonous (50% chance per snake). The snakes obey the caster's commands but will revert to sticks when slain or when the spell's duration ends.

Snake Stats: AC 6; HD 1; AT 1 bite; Dmg 1d4; MV 90' (30'); Save F1; ML 12; AL Neutral; SA poison (50% chance per snake to be poisonous).

Non-poisonous snakes grant 10 XP each, while poisonous ones grant 13 XP each.
F4Xla4VuC3mifZT3.name: Sticks to Snakes
F4Xla4VuC3mifZT3.spellEffect: Turns up to 16 sticks into snakes

FYNBDH5gHqW1tiYv.description: Darkness, creates a sphere of darkness instead. It will block all sight except infravision. Darkness cancels a light spell if cast upon it, but may itself be canceled by another light spell. If cast at an opponent's eyes, darkness causes blindness for the duration of the spell or until canceled. If the victim makes a successful saving throw vs. spell, the spell has no effect.
FYNBDH5gHqW1tiYv.name: Darkness*

FZGcX2ddymeA23v4.description:
This spell summons an enchanted spring from the ground or a wall, flowing for 6 turns and producing enough water for 12 men and their mounts (about 50 gallons).

Each level above 8th allows the cleric to create water for an additional 12 men and mounts. The caster can control the amount of water produced, up to the spell’s maximum.
FZGcX2ddymeA23v4.name: Create Water

HDuNqfpjvQoSL3O2.description:
This spell allows the spellcaster to determine the alignment (Lawful, Neutral, or Chaotic) of any one creature within 10'. It can also reveal the alignment of an enchanted item or area, if applicable.

The reversed form, confuse alignment, lasts for one turn per level of the spellcaster and can be cast on a creature by touch. No saving throw is allowed. For the duration of the spell, any attempt to discern the recipient's alignment will yield a false result. This false alignment will remain consistent for all subsequent detection attempts during the spell's duration.
HDuNqfpjvQoSL3O2.name: Know Alignment*

K1wJfIWV9CIz3ocC.description: Continual darkness, creates a similarly-sized area of total darkness, unaffected by normal light sources and infravision. A continual light spell can cancel it. If cast on a creature’s eyes, the target must make a saving throw vs. spells or be blinded.
K1wJfIWV9CIz3ocC.name: Continual Darkness*

MY5uarVRlTconTXm.description:
This spell compels the target to undertake a specific task or quest as commanded by the caster. The target may attempt a saving throw vs. spells to resist; if successful, the spell has no effect.

Typical Tasks: The task might include slaying a particular monster, rescuing a prisoner, retrieving a magical item, or embarking on a pilgrimage. If the task is impossible or suicidal, the spell fails automatically.

Duration: The spell remains in effect until the specified task is completed. This spell compels the target to fulfill the task but does not compel them to do so willingly. Once completed, the target may hold a grudge against the caster, potentially seeking revenge depending on the circumstances of the quest.

Curse: A target who refuses to undertake the quest is cursed until they resume the task. The nature of this curse is determined by the GM and may be twice the usual strength of a standard curse.
MY5uarVRlTconTXm.name: Quest*
MY5uarVRlTconTXm.spellEffect: Compels one creature to perform a task

MZ74dK767q2mzTwO.description: This spell heals 2d6 + 2 points of damage on one living creature when touched by the caster.
MZ74dK767q2mzTwO.name: Cure Serious Wounds*

NQe5icEul4SWk0hy.description:
This spell creates light as bright as daylight in a spherical volume with a 30' radius. It lasts until dispelled or countered by a continual darkness spell. Creatures that suffer penalties in bright daylight also suffer them within the area of effect.

If cast on a creature’s eyes, the target must make a saving throw vs. spells or be blinded until the effect is removed. This spell can be cast in an area, on an object, or directly on a creature's eyes to cause blindness.

The reverse, continual darkness, creates a similarly-sized area of total darkness, unaffected by normal light sources and infravision. A continual light spell can cancel it. If cast on a creature’s eyes, the target must make a saving throw vs. spells or be blinded.
NQe5icEul4SWk0hy.name: Continual Light*

ORg4lx4h2qi8AQmQ.description:
This spell creates a sphere of light, as if cast by a bright torch or lamp. If the spell is cast on an object (such as a weapon), the light moves with the object.

If the spell is cast at a creature's eyes, the victim makes a saving throw vs. spell. If the saving throw fails, the victim is blinded by the light for the duration of the spell, or until the spell effect is canceled.

When reversed, this spell, darkness, creates a sphere of darkness instead. It will block all sight except infravision. Darkness cancels a light spell if cast upon it, but may itself be canceled by another light spell. If cast at an opponent's eyes, darkness causes blindness for the duration of the spell or until canceled. If the victim makes a successful saving throw vs. spell, the spell has no effect.
ORg4lx4h2qi8AQmQ.name: Light*

QSsRsgLRGXP8ZTW9.description: The reversed form of the spell, cause fear, will make any one creature flee for two turns. The victim may make a saving throw vs. spells to avoid the effect. This reversed spell has a range of 120'.
QSsRsgLRGXP8ZTW9.name: Cause Fear*

A successful save, rolled on a d20, often reduces or negates the spell's effects entirely. This saving throw is applicable to numerous magical attacks, such as charm spells, fireballs, or paralysis effects, and covers damage, control, or debilitating conditions caused by magical devices or spellcasters. The target number for success is based on the character's class and level.

A failed roll often results in death (for poison) or other severe consequences, though optional rules may instead inflict substantial damage​​​.
UA93SmyFHrEvh32d.name: Death Ray or Poison

ULDXSY2ruOnWzlev.description: This spell inflicts 2d6 + 2 points of damage on a creature touched by the caster. A successful melee attack roll is required to deliver the spell.
ULDXSY2ruOnWzlev.name: Cause Serious Wounds*

UU8GULUVsbqocifB.description: This spell cures almost any form of blindness, including those caused by light or darkness spells. It will not affect blindness caused by a curse.
UU8GULUVsbqocifB.name: Cure Blindness

V7SZVaqWNFdlZDNi.description:
Free person, lifts the paralysis from up to four victims affected by the normal form of the spell (including *hold person* cast by a magic-user or an elf). It has no effect on other forms of paralysis, such as that caused by a ghoul.

This spell paralyzes up to four creatures, affecting any human, demihuman, or human-like beings such as bugbears, dryads, gnolls, hobgoblins, kobolds, lizard men, ogres, orcs, nixies, pixies, or sprites. It does not affect undead or creatures larger than ogres. Each target must make a saving throw vs. spells or be paralyzed for nine turns. If the spell is cast at a single target, that creature receives a -2 penalty to their saving throw. If cast at a group, up to four creatures of the spellcaster's choice can be affected, but without any penalty to their saving throws. The paralysis can only be removed by the reversed form of this spell or a dispel magic spell.
V7SZVaqWNFdlZDNi.name: Free Person*

W4sbPGj2uS7d6VqE.description:
This spell paralyzes up to four creatures, affecting any human, demihuman, or human-like beings such as bugbears, dryads, gnolls, hobgoblins, kobolds, lizard men, ogres, orcs, nixies, pixies, or sprites. It does not affect undead or creatures larger than ogres. Each target must make a saving throw vs. spells or be paralyzed for nine turns. If the spell is cast at a single target, that creature receives a -2 penalty to their saving throw. If cast at a group, up to four creatures of the spellcaster's choice can be affected, but without any penalty to their saving throws. The paralysis can only be removed by the reversed form of this spell or a dispel magic spell.

The reversed spell, free person, lifts the paralysis from up to four victims affected by the normal form of the spell (including *hold person* cast by a magic-user or an elf). It has no effect on other forms of paralysis, such as that caused by a ghoul.
W4sbPGj2uS7d6VqE.name: Hold Person*

X0oMUdMG1IxA0fC8.description:
This spell animates normal skeletons or dead bodies within range, transforming them into enchanted skeletons or zombies. These undead obey the caster until destroyed by a dispel magic spell or another cleric.

Effect: For each experience level, the caster can animate 1 HD of undead. Skeletons retain the HD of the original creature, while zombies have +1 HD.

Humans and demihumans are treated as 1 HD for this spell. A human’s corpse would be animated as a 1 HD skeleton or a 2 HD zombie.

Notes: Animated undead are immune to sleep, charm, and poison effects. Using this spell for good is advised for lawful casters, as animating the dead is often seen as a Chaotic act.
X0oMUdMG1IxA0fC8.name: Animate Dead

Yu3zdKenSITWUnWH.description:
This spell creates and invisible magical barrier all around the caster's body (less than an inch away). Here’s the revised text with all references to "cleric" changed to "caster":

While the spell is in effect, characters and monsters attacking the caster suffer a -1 penalty to their attack rolls, and the caster gains a +1 bonus to all saving throws.

Additionally, enchanted creatures are unable to touch the caster! (An enchanted creature is one that normal weapons cannot affect, only magical weapons can hit. A creature that can only be hit by a silver weapon—like a werewolf—is not considered enchanted. Any creature that is magically summoned or controlled, such as a charmed character, is also considered enchanted.) This barrier completely protects the caster from all melee or hand-to-hand attacks from such creatures; however, it does not prevent attacks from missile weapons. Enchanted creatures using missile weapons still suffer the -1 penalty to attack rolls but can still hit the caster.

This spell does not affect a magic missile spell used by magic-users.

If the caster attacks an enchanted creature during the spell's duration, the spell’s effect changes slightly. Enchanted creatures are then able to touch the caster, but still suffer the attack roll penalty; the penalty and the caster's saving throw adjustments remain until the spell's duration ends.
Yu3zdKenSITWUnWH.name: Protection from Evil

Z9o6h5tCchSkpmYT.description:
This spell cures one living (not undead or non-living) creature of [[/r 1d6+1 #Cure Light Wounds]] points of damage. The caster can cure themselves with this spell.

Alternately, the spell can be used to cure paralysis (except that caused by a Hold Person or Hold Monster spell), although if it does so then no damage will be cured at the same time.

The spell will not increase the target's maximum hit points.

When reversed, this spell, cause light wounds, causes [[/r 1d6+1 #Cause Light Wounds]] points of damage to the target. No saving throw is allowed, but the caster must make a normal attack roll to inflict this damage.
Z9o6h5tCchSkpmYT.name: Cause Light Wounds*

ZuYHz3dXIEKAob1i.description:
This spell cures one living (not undead or non-living) creature of [[/r 1d6+1 #Cure Light Wounds]] points of damage. The caster can cure themselves with this spell.

Alternately, the spell can be used to cure paralysis (except that caused by a Hold Person or Hold Monster spell), although if it does so then no damage will be cured at the same time.

The spell will not increase the target's maximum hit points.

When reversed, this spell, cause light wounds, causes [[/r 1d6+1 #Cause Light Wounds]] points of damage to the target. No saving throw is allowed, but the caster must make a normal attack roll to inflict this damage.
ZuYHz3dXIEKAob1i.name: Cure Light Wounds*

atScgN89OIsaYBhw.description:
This spell enhances the morale of friendly creatures by +1 and grants them a +1 bonus to all attack and damage rolls. It affects only those within a 20' x 20' area and only those who are not yet engaged in melee combat.

The reversed form, blight, imposes a -1 penalty to morale, attack rolls, and damage rolls of enemies. Each affected creature may make a saving throw vs. spells to avoid these penalties.
atScgN89OIsaYBhw.name: Bless*

bA7UpcIzgNnP7BEV.description: This spell makes spoiled or poisoned food and water safe for consumption. It can purify one ration of preserved food (either iron or standard rations), six waterskins of water, or enough regular food to feed twelve people. If cast on mud, the spell causes the dirt to settle, leaving behind a pool of pure, clear water. The spell does not affect any living creatures.
bA7UpcIzgNnP7BEV.name: Purify Food and Water

fV65E4zUzQfEnKOW.description:
The reversed form of the quest spell, *Remove Quest* dispels an unwanted quest or removes a quest-related curse. The base chance of successfully removing the quest is 50%, modified by ±5% for each level difference between the caster of *Remove Quest* and the original caster of the quest.

For example, an 11th-level cleric attempting to remove a quest imposed by a 13th-level caster has a 40% chance of success, while a 36th-level cleric removing a quest cast by a 20th-level cleric has a 99% chance of success (capped to prevent automatic success).
fV65E4zUzQfEnKOW.name: Remove Quest*
fV65E4zUzQfEnKOW.spellEffect: Removes an unwanted quest or curse

feiwg1AiOTQpedrt.description:
This spell allows any one weapon to inflict 1d6 additional points of damage per attack (similar to a magical staff of striking). The weapon will inflict this extra damage with every successful blow for as long as the spell lasts. This bonus does not apply to attack rolls, but only to damage rolls.

If the caster casts this spell on a normal weapon, the weapon may then damage creatures which are normally affected only by magic weapons; the weapon will do 1d6 points of damage per strike (regardless of the normal damage of the weapon).
feiwg1AiOTQpedrt.name: Striking

fpUqWVgy9Gt153t3.description: The saving throw against "Stone or Paralysis" protects a character from attacks or effects that could freeze them in place (paralysis) or turn them into stone. If the saving throw is failed, the character becomes immobilized or petrified, depending on the effect. Paralysis leaves a character aware but unable to act, while petrification turns the character and their carried equipment into a stone statue. The duration or permanence of these effects is specified by the source, and successful saving throws avoid them entirely​​​.
fpUqWVgy9Gt153t3.name: Turn to Stone or Paralysis

hO4D6N2rdPwG5USu.description:
This spell creates enough food to feed up to 12 men and their mounts for one day. For every level above 8th, it creates enough for 12 more people and mounts.

Note: Created food spoils after 24 hours and cannot be stored for future use.
hO4D6N2rdPwG5USu.name: Create Food

hw23XP0e6hll5aik.description:
This spell allows the cleric to raise any human, dwarf, halfling, or elf from the dead. The body must be present, and any missing parts will cause corresponding disabilities in the raised character.

Effect: An 8th-level cleric can raise a body that has been dead up to four days. Each level above 8th extends this limit by four additional days (e.g., a 10th-level cleric can raise bodies dead for up to twelve days).

The character is raised with 1 hit point and is weakened: unable to fight, cast spells, or move faster than half speed. These penalties last for two weeks of complete bed rest, which cannot be hastened by magical healing.

Undead Effect: When cast on an undead creature within range, the target must make a saving throw vs. spells with a -2 penalty or be destroyed. Vampires that fail the save retreat to their coffins in gaseous form. Against undead creatures stronger than vampires, the spell deals 3d10 damage (saving throw for half).
hw23XP0e6hll5aik.name: Raise Dead*
hw23XP0e6hll5aik.spellEffect: Raises one dead human or demihuman, or damages undead

i0SwdqWPRManfR9K.description: The Black Hag can control undead as if it had 22 HD, making it an extremely dangerous necromantic force.
i0SwdqWPRManfR9K.name: Undead Control

iMyY3MRTDeBldr3s.description:
This spell removes one curse from a character, item, or area. Some curses, especially those on magical items, may only be lifted temporarily. For permanent removal, a dispel evil spell or a remove curse cast by a higher-level caster may be required (at the DM's discretion).

The reverse of this spell, curse, imposes a penalty or misfortune on the target, with effects limited only by the caster's imagination. If the curse is too powerful, it may rebound on the caster (DM's discretion). Typical curses include a -4 penalty to attack rolls, a -2 penalty to saving throws, halving of a prime requisite, or a -4 penalty on others' reaction rolls. The victim may make a saving throw vs. spells to avoid the curse.
iMyY3MRTDeBldr3s.name: Remove Curse*

k3mAmOlVF7rXvW4c.description:
This spell affects all undead and enchanted monsters within 30'. Each affected creature must make a saving throw vs. spells or be destroyed. If cast on a single creature, it takes a -2 penalty to its saving throw.

Effect: Banishes creatures from other planes if they fail their saving throw. Those that save must flee and stay away as long as the caster concentrates, remaining stationary.

The spell can also remove a curse from one item or dispel a magical charm effect on a creature.
k3mAmOlVF7rXvW4c.name: Dispel Evil
k3mAmOlVF7rXvW4c.spellEffect: Affects undead, enchanted creatures, or one curse or charm

kDkp46qLE5Wachtx.description: Curse imposes a penalty or misfortune on the target, with effects limited only by the caster's imagination. If the curse is too powerful, it may rebound on the caster (DM's discretion). Typical curses include a -4 penalty to attack rolls, a -2 penalty to saving throws, halving of a prime requisite, or a -4 penalty on others' reaction rolls. The victim may make a saving throw vs. spells to avoid the curse.
kDkp46qLE5Wachtx.name: Curse*

nRL7Rb2bMoa8qRHu.description: When the spell is cast, the caster will see evilly enchanted objects within 120' glow dark red. It also causes creates that intent to harm the caster to glow when they are within the area of effect. Not all Chaotic alignment creatures will have evil intentions, but many do. Traps and poisons are neither good nor evil, merely dangerous; this spell does not reveal them.
nRL7Rb2bMoa8qRHu.name: Detect Evil

nysiGBDn6MZyD9lb.description: This spell heals one living creature of 3d6 + 3 points of damage.
nysiGBDn6MZyD9lb.name: Cure Critical Wounds*

oJQIuEJmdWcnNWwj.description:
This spell destroys other spell effects within a 20' x 20' x 20' area. It does not affect magical items but can cancel temporary effects they produce.

Effect: Automatically dispels spells from casters of equal or lower level. For higher-level casters, there is a 5% chance of failure per level difference.

Examples: A 7th-level caster trying to dispel a spell from a 9th-level caster has a 10% chance of failure.
oJQIuEJmdWcnNWwj.name: Dispel Magic

oMOiIYPV98TAQDlj.description: For the duration of this spell, the recipient is immune to damage from normal fire and heat. They also receive a +2 bonus to all saving throws against magical fire (such as dragon breath or fireball). Additionally, any damage taken from such magical fire is reduced by 1 point per die of damage, with each die dealing at least 1 point of damage. For red dragon breath, the damage is reduced by 1 point per Hit Die of the dragon, but never below 1 point per Hit Die.
oMOiIYPV98TAQDlj.name: Resist Fire

ojj22QXjuFqPyENO.description:
When the spellcaster casts this spell and then touches any living creature, it will calm the creature and remove any fear. If the creature has been affected by a fear spell or effect that normally does not allow a saving throw, the remove fear spell can still be effective. If the spellcaster uses the spell on someone afflicted by a magical fear effect, the victim gets to make a saving throw vs. spells, with a bonus to the roll equal to the spellcaster's level of experience (up to a maximum bonus of +6). If the saving throw is successful, the victim's fear is dispelled. Regardless of the spellcaster's level or any bonuses, a roll of 1 will always fail.

The reversed form of the spell, cause fear, will make any one creature flee for two turns. The victim may make a saving throw vs. spells to avoid the effect. This reversed spell has a range of 120'.
ojj22QXjuFqPyENO.name: Remove Fear*

puw9MT8hti0HuJ2Z.description:
With *Truesight*, the cleric gains the ability to see all things as they truly are within a 120' radius. The spell reveals all hidden, invisible, and ethereal objects or creatures, functioning as the *detect invisible* spell.

Additionally, the cleric perceives any secret doors, and can see through any form of disguise, polymorph, or other alterations. Deception is impossible. The spell also reveals creatures' alignments, experience, and power levels.
puw9MT8hti0HuJ2Z.name: Truesight
puw9MT8hti0HuJ2Z.spellEffect: Reveals true forms of all things within 120'

sOIxeT2vrlavW4LW.description: This spell allows the caster to sense the direction of a known object within range, but not its distance. It can detect a common object with a partial description, such as "stairs leading up," but will only indicate the direction of the nearest such object. To find a specific object, the caster must know exactly what the object looks like (size, shape, color, etc.). The spell will not locate a creature.
sOIxeT2vrlavW4LW.name: Locate Object

sVz0LnRt5ZDdTYKG.description:
This spell summons a vast swarm of insects in a 30' radius, obscuring vision and driving off creatures with less than 3 Hit Dice (no saving throw). The caster can direct the swarm to move up to 20' per round within a range of 480' but must remain still and concentrate.

If the caster is disturbed, the insects scatter and the spell ends. This spell can only be cast outdoors and above ground.
sVz0LnRt5ZDdTYKG.name: Insect Plague

tCP7usRUMlY6daDZ.description:
This spell allows the caster to see a glow around any magical creature, object and place within range. Magical creatures do not get a saving throw against this effect.

The glow only extends a couple of inches around the magical object, so if it is in a container or behind another object then some or all of the glow may not be visible.
tCP7usRUMlY6daDZ.name: Detect Magic

tscZcvQEdF4G4Bpl.description:
When casting this spell, the spellcaster must name one type of animal (such as wolves). For the duration of the spell, the spellcaster can communicate with all animals of that type within 30'; the effect moves with the caster.

The spell allows the caster to speak to any normal or giant forms of the named animal type, but only to one type at a time. The spell cannot be used to communicate with intelligent animals or fantastic creatures.

The animals typically react favorably (with a +2 bonus to reaction rolls) and may be persuaded to perform a favor for the spellcaster if the reaction roll is high enough. The animal must be capable of understanding and carrying out the request.
tscZcvQEdF4G4Bpl.name: Speak with Animals

x7U6QdklLlTJnGtl.description:
This spell creates poison in a creature or container upon touch. A creature must succeed on a saving throw vs. poison or die instantly. When cast on a container, the poison affects its contents with no save.

Notes: Poisoning is usually considered a Chaotic act.
x7U6QdklLlTJnGtl.name: Create Poison*
x7U6QdklLlTJnGtl.spellEffect: Creates poison in a creature or container

xdi5G8TarHU2PlbE.description: The Black Hag attacks with poison-coated iron claws. Any creature hit must save vs. poison at -4 or die instantly.
xdi5G8TarHU2PlbE.name: Iron Claws (Poisoned)

yJQL5sWuFcwZKbgy.description: Cause disease, infects the target with a wasting disease. The target must make a saving throw vs. spells or suffer a -2 penalty on attack rolls and hindered healing. The disease is fatal within [[/r 2d12 #Cure Disease duration in days]] days unless removed by a cure disease spell.
yJQL5sWuFcwZKbgy.name: Cause Disease*

yu0F2o1eEnaaI6em.description: This spell creates an area of total silence within a 15' radius, making it impossible to converse or cast spells inside the affected area for the duration of the spell. Those within the sphere can still hear sounds from outside. If the spell is cast on a creature, the target must make a saving throw vs. spells. If the saving throw fails, the effect moves with the creature. If successful, the silence remains stationary, and the creature can leave the affected area.
yu0F2o1eEnaaI6em.name: Silence 15' Radius

zD049zhdyQjAc55e.description: When this spell is cast, all creatures within 30' of the spellcaster are protected from freezing temperatures without harm. Those affected also receive a +2 bonus to all saving throws against cold-based attacks. Additionally, any cold damage dealt to them is reduced by 1 point per die, with a minimum of 1 point of damage per die. The effect moves with the spellcaster.
zD049zhdyQjAc55e.name: Resist Cold

zgUBNml0u4wnz2Ka.description: The Magic Wand saving throw is used to avoid the effects of attacks or abilities activated through magical wands, such as paralysis rays or damage-dealing beams. A successful save, rolled on a d20, indicates that the character avoids or mitigates the harmful effects. The target number to save is determined by the character's class and level, as found on the saving throw table​​.
zgUBNml0u4wnz2Ka.name: Magic Wand

znnIFj7YHeRxTIDh.description:
This spell allows the cleric to ask three yes-or-no questions of the greater powers (such as forces of nature, greater spirits, or Immortals).

Usage: May only be used once per week. The DM may restrict this to once a month if overused. Once a year, the cleric may ask six questions, usually on a day significant to the powers questioned.
znnIFj7YHeRxTIDh.name: Commune

Black Hag (11 HD).name: Black Hag (11 HD)

Black Hag (12 HD).biography:
The Black Hag is a terrifying, hideous creature with black hair and warty blue-black skin. Unlike normal spellcasters, it revels in destruction and controls undead as if it were undead itself.

Undead Control: The black hag can control undead as if it had 24 HD, making it an extremely dangerous necromantic force.

Poisonous Claws: The hag attacks with poison-coated iron claws. Any creature hit must save vs. poison at -4 or die instantly.

Spellcasting: The black hag is a natural spellcaster, casting spells as a 7th-level cleric. (Spells not preloaded.)

Dark Lairs & Evil Minions: Black hags live in dark caves or deep forests, usually accompanied by 3d6 evil creatures (often undead).

Companions: They often keep slimes, oozes, and puddings as allies.

Terrain: Woods.

1dmB9MP83VJNOOJM.description:
With *Truesight*, the cleric gains the ability to see all things as they truly are within a 120' radius. The spell reveals all hidden, invisible, and ethereal objects or creatures, functioning as the *detect invisible* spell.

Additionally, the cleric perceives any secret doors, and can see through any form of disguise, polymorph, or other alterations. Deception is impossible. The spell also reveals creatures' alignments, experience, and power levels.
1dmB9MP83VJNOOJM.name: Truesight
1dmB9MP83VJNOOJM.spellEffect: Reveals true forms of all things within 120'

1fBJR0t6rhx1uqPO.description:
This spell transforms [[/r 2d8 #sticks into snakes]] sticks into snakes, which may be poisonous (50% chance per snake). The snakes obey the caster's commands but will revert to sticks when slain or when the spell's duration ends.

Snake Stats: AC 6; HD 1; AT 1 bite; Dmg 1d4; MV 90' (30'); Save F1; ML 12; AL Neutral; SA poison (50% chance per snake to be poisonous).

Non-poisonous snakes grant 10 XP each, while poisonous ones grant 13 XP each.
1fBJR0t6rhx1uqPO.name: Sticks to Snakes
1fBJR0t6rhx1uqPO.spellEffect: Turns up to 16 sticks into snakes

1zUsSk1FpmvfdEeg.description: The Death Ray or Poison saving throw is a roll made by a character to resist deadly effects like instant death or paralysis from poisons, spells, or traps. The player rolls a d20 and compares it to their class- and level-specific target number on the saving throw table; success means avoiding or mitigating the harm. A failed roll often results in death (for poison) or other severe consequences, though optional rules may instead inflict substantial damage​​​.
1zUsSk1FpmvfdEeg.name: Death Ray or Poison

2d6uL6dwy4S7T9tQ.description: Continual darkness, creates a similarly-sized area of total darkness, unaffected by normal light sources and infravision. A continual light spell can cancel it. If cast on a creature’s eyes, the target must make a saving throw vs. spells or be blinded.
2d6uL6dwy4S7T9tQ.name: Continual Darkness*

3N9oYco8BRf6YhCu.description:
This spell allows the cleric to animate non-living, non-magical objects, causing them to move and attack. Magical objects are unaffected.

The spell can animate either:

  • One object up to 400 lbs (4,000 cn), roughly the size of two men.
  • Multiple smaller objects, as long as their total weight does not exceed 400 lbs.

Combat Abilities: The DM determines the movement rate, number of attacks, damage, and armor class of animated objects. As a guideline:

  • A man-sized statue might move at 30' per round, attack once per round for [[/r 2d8 #points of damage]] damage, and have AC 1.
  • A chair might move at 180' per round, attack twice per round for [[/r 1d4 #points of damage]] damage per attack, and have AC 6.

All animated objects use the cleric’s chance to hit in combat.
3N9oYco8BRf6YhCu.name: Animate Objects

5IFcP1P3mvcqMiIP.description:
This spell animates normal skeletons or dead bodies within range, transforming them into enchanted skeletons or zombies. These undead obey the caster until destroyed by a dispel magic spell or another cleric.

Effect: For each experience level, the caster can animate 1 HD of undead. Skeletons retain the HD of the original creature, while zombies have +1 HD.

Humans and demihumans are treated as 1 HD for this spell. A human’s corpse would be animated as a 1 HD skeleton or a 2 HD zombie.

Notes: Animated undead are immune to sleep, charm, and poison effects. Using this spell for good is advised for lawful casters, as animating the dead is often seen as a Chaotic act.
5IFcP1P3mvcqMiIP.name: Animate Dead

6J23hhPM7UsWLwuT.description: This spell creates an area of total silence within a 15' radius, making it impossible to converse or cast spells inside the affected area for the duration of the spell. Those within the sphere can still hear sounds from outside. If the spell is cast on a creature, the target must make a saving throw vs. spells. If the saving throw fails, the effect moves with the creature. If successful, the silence remains stationary, and the creature can leave the affected area.
6J23hhPM7UsWLwuT.name: Silence 15' Radius

6TcoI7SSGlKxjLXu.description: Darkness, creates a sphere of darkness instead. It will block all sight except infravision. Darkness cancels a light spell if cast upon it, but may itself be canceled by another light spell. If cast at an opponent's eyes, darkness causes blindness for the duration of the spell or until canceled. If the victim makes a successful saving throw vs. spell, the spell has no effect.
6TcoI7SSGlKxjLXu.name: Darkness*

For example, an 11th-level cleric attempting to remove a quest imposed by a 13th-level caster has a 40% chance of success, while a 36th-level cleric removing a quest cast by a 20th-level cleric has a 99% chance of success (capped to prevent automatic success).
6Y2mlppMYBmckDOS.name: Remove Quest*
6Y2mlppMYBmckDOS.spellEffect: Removes an unwanted quest or curse

If the caster casts this spell on a normal weapon, the weapon may then damage creatures which are normally affected only by magic weapons; the weapon will do 1d6 points of damage per strike (regardless of the normal damage of the weapon).
7D6id91vW9PtOXm8.name: Striking

7VFbCWUuAhpi3dya.description: This spell inflicts 2d6 + 2 points of damage on a creature touched by the caster. A successful melee attack roll is required to deliver the spell.
7VFbCWUuAhpi3dya.name: Cause Serious Wounds*

7WS7ZsTqt74YvtdF.description:
This spell enhances the morale of friendly creatures by +1 and grants them a +1 bonus to all attack and damage rolls. It affects only those within a 20' x 20' area and only those who are not yet engaged in melee combat.

The reversed form, blight, imposes a -1 penalty to morale, attack rolls, and damage rolls of enemies. Each affected creature may make a saving throw vs. spells to avoid these penalties.
7WS7ZsTqt74YvtdF.name: Bless*

99PBq8KuFAau5G3k.description: Curse imposes a penalty or misfortune on the target, with effects limited only by the caster's imagination. If the curse is too powerful, it may rebound on the caster (DM's discretion). Typical curses include a -4 penalty to attack rolls, a -2 penalty to saving throws, halving of a prime requisite, or a -4 penalty on others' reaction rolls. The victim may make a saving throw vs. spells to avoid the curse.
99PBq8KuFAau5G3k.name: Curse*

9dd3qnxRL8UfGfMH.description:
This spell creates a sphere of light, as if cast by a bright torch or lamp. If the spell is cast on an object (such as a weapon), the light moves with the object.

If the spell is cast at a creature's eyes, the victim makes a saving throw vs. spell. If the saving throw fails, the victim is blinded by the light for the duration of the spell, or until the spell effect is canceled.

When reversed, this spell, darkness, creates a sphere of darkness instead. It will block all sight except infravision. Darkness cancels a light spell if cast upon it, but may itself be canceled by another light spell. If cast at an opponent's eyes, darkness causes blindness for the duration of the spell or until canceled. If the victim makes a successful saving throw vs. spell, the spell has no effect.
9dd3qnxRL8UfGfMH.name: Light*

AeDa9DifPW4Imeyz.description:
This spell summons an intelligent elemental being called an Aerial Servant to retrieve a specified item or creature and return it to the caster. The servant appears immediately, and the cleric must describe the target and its location, or the servant will depart.

The aerial servant is ethereal at will, allowing it to bypass most barriers, but it cannot pass through a Protection from Evil effect.

Task and Duration: The servant will attempt to find and bring back the target within the spell's duration (1 day per caster level). If the spell ends before the task is completed—whether the servant is still searching or already returning—it is considered a failure.

Strength and Carrying Capacity: The aerial servant has 18 Strength and can carry up to 500 lbs (5,000 cn).

Failure Consequences: If the aerial servant cannot complete its task within the spell duration, it goes insane and immediately returns to attack the caster.
AeDa9DifPW4Imeyz.name: Aerial Servant
AeDa9DifPW4Imeyz.spellEffect: Servant fetches one item or creature

Apc9gc51iuJJ1SxU.description:
This spell destroys other spell effects within a 20' x 20' x 20' area. It does not affect magical items but can cancel temporary effects they produce.

Effect: Automatically dispels spells from casters of equal or lower level. For higher-level casters, there is a 5% chance of failure per level difference.

Examples: A 7th-level caster trying to dispel a spell from a 9th-level caster has a 10% chance of failure.
Apc9gc51iuJJ1SxU.name: Dispel Magic

ApfvZdmZWeabBwqZ.description:
This spell cures one living (not undead or non-living) creature of [[/r 1d6+1 #Cure Light Wounds]] points of damage. The caster can cure themselves with this spell.

Alternately, the spell can be used to cure paralysis (except that caused by a Hold Person or Hold Monster spell), although if it does so then no damage will be cured at the same time.

The spell will not increase the target's maximum hit points.

When reversed, this spell, cause light wounds, causes [[/r 1d6+1 #Cause Light Wounds]] points of damage to the target. No saving throw is allowed, but the caster must make a normal attack roll to inflict this damage.
ApfvZdmZWeabBwqZ.name: Cure Light Wounds*

DEgQ5CRLV4nfiGZo.description: This spell allows the caster to sense the direction of a known object within range, but not its distance. It can detect a common object with a partial description, such as "stairs leading up," but will only indicate the direction of the nearest such object. To find a specific object, the caster must know exactly what the object looks like (size, shape, color, etc.). The spell will not locate a creature.
DEgQ5CRLV4nfiGZo.name: Locate Object

GfW73KHkE63rj35j.description:
