If the spell is cast at a single target, that creature receives a -2 penalty to their saving throw. If cast at a group, up to four creatures of the spellcaster's choice can be affected, but without any penalty to their saving throws. The paralysis can only be removed by the reversed form of this spell or a dispel magic spell.
19BG3ABA3LXbriio.name: Free Person*

2EifT00Oy2UXSHES.description:
When casting this spell, the spellcaster must name one type of animal (such as wolves). For the duration of the spell, the spellcaster can communicate with all animals of that type within 30'; the effect moves with the caster.

The spell allows the caster to speak to any normal or giant forms of the named animal type, but only to one type at a time. The spell cannot be used to communicate with intelligent animals or fantastic creatures.

The animals typically react favorably (with a +2 bonus to reaction rolls) and may be persuaded to perform a favor for the spellcaster if the reaction roll is high enough. The animal must be capable of understanding and carrying out the request.
2EifT00Oy2UXSHES.name: Speak with Animals

2Iqq9DCF6be8nzKw.description:
The reversed form of the quest spell, *Remove Quest* dispels an unwanted quest or removes a quest-related curse. The base chance of successfully removing the quest is 50%, modified by ±5% for each level difference between the caster of *Remove Quest* and the original caster of the quest.

For example, an 11th-level cleric attempting to remove a quest imposed by a 13th-level caster has a 40% chance of success, while a 36th-level cleric removing a quest cast by a 20th-level cleric has a 99% chance of success (capped to prevent automatic success).
2Iqq9DCF6be8nzKw.name: Remove Quest*
2Iqq9DCF6be8nzKw.spellEffect: Removes an unwanted quest or curse

3sYQn1GBbgvIQ9Qt.description:
This spell creates an invisible barrier around the caster, extending 10' in all directions. It grants each creature within the barrier a +1 bonus to all saving throws, while attacks against those inside suffer a -1 penalty on attack rolls.

Effect: Enchanted creatures (such as magically summoned or controlled beings) cannot engage in melee with anyone inside the barrier. However, if a protected creature attacks an enchanted one, the barrier no longer prevents melee attacks, though saving throw bonuses and attack roll penalties remain active.

Missile and magical attacks from outside the barrier still suffer the -1 attack penalty but are otherwise unaffected.
3sYQn1GBbgvIQ9Qt.name: Protection from Evil 10' Radius

4Yn93tEax1UZertQ.description:
This spell allows the caster to communicate with plants within a 30' radius, treating them as if they have intelligence. The caster may ask simple favors, such as making a path through dense undergrowth, which the plants will grant if able.

Effect: Enables communication with plant creatures, including plantlike monsters such as treants.
4Yn93tEax1UZertQ.name: Speak with Plants

4wMUKb1xFgWiNSlA.description:
This spell creates a magical barrier up to 30' in diameter and 30' high, consisting of whirling and dancing hammers. The barrier is obviously dangerous to any who pass through it.

Damage: Any creature passing through the barrier takes [[/r 7d10 #points of damage]] (7-70) points of damage. No saving throw is allowed.

This spell is commonly used to block entrances, corridors, or other key passages.
4wMUKb1xFgWiNSlA.name: Barrier*

4xyeOVRU85KHGVBC.description:
This spell transforms [[/r 2d8 #sticks into snakes]] sticks into snakes, which may be poisonous (50% chance per snake). The snakes obey the caster's commands but will revert to sticks when slain or when the spell's duration ends.

Snake Stats: AC 6; HD 1; AT 1 bite; Dmg 1d4; MV 90' (30'); Save F1; ML 12; AL Neutral; SA poison (50% chance per snake to be poisonous).

Non-poisonous snakes grant 10 XP each, while poisonous ones grant 13 XP each.
4xyeOVRU85KHGVBC.name: Sticks to Snakes
4xyeOVRU85KHGVBC.spellEffect: Turns up to 16 sticks into snakes

5ISdCdyBwLheKdEt.description: The Death Ray or Poison saving throw is a roll made by a character to resist deadly effects like instant death or paralysis from poisons, spells, or traps. The player rolls a d20 and compares it to their class- and level-specific target number on the saving throw table; success means avoiding or mitigating the harm. A failed roll often results in death (for poison) or other severe consequences, though optional rules may instead inflict substantial damage​​​.
5ISdCdyBwLheKdEt.name: Death Ray or Poison

7Ev5fbfxyBxn6Lbw.description: The saving throw for Spells or Magic Staff includes resistance against magical effects cast by rods, staves, wands, or through spells. A successful save, rolled on a d20, often reduces or negates the spell's effects entirely. This saving throw is applicable to numerous magical attacks, such as charm spells, fireballs, or paralysis effects, and covers damage, control, or debilitating conditions caused by magical devices or spellcasters. The target number for success is based on the character's class and level.
7Ev5fbfxyBxn6Lbw.name: Spells or Magic Staff

AoVFVpiVHLo0KrlD.description: When the spell is cast, the caster will see evilly enchanted objects within 120' glow dark red. It also causes creates that intent to harm the caster to glow when they are within the area of effect. Not all Chaotic alignment creatures will have evil intentions, but many do. Traps and poisons are neither good nor evil, merely dangerous; this spell does not reveal them.
AoVFVpiVHLo0KrlD.name: Detect Evil

Cj02kWuZzQBPfPuO.description: The Black Hag can control undead as if it had 36 HD, making it an extremely dangerous necromantic force.
Cj02kWuZzQBPfPuO.name: Undead Control

DAEsYUElN64j20Lk.description: The Magic Wand saving throw is used to avoid the effects of attacks or abilities activated through magical wands, such as paralysis rays or damage-dealing beams. A successful save, rolled on a d20, indicates that the character avoids or mitigates the harmful effects. The target number to save is determined by the character's class and level, as found on the saving throw table​​.
DAEsYUElN64j20Lk.name: Magic Wand

DKjukbQY6QuTiQNp.description:
This spell summons a vast swarm of insects in a 30' radius, obscuring vision and driving off creatures with less than 3 Hit Dice (no saving throw). The caster can direct the swarm to move up to 20' per round within a range of 480' but must remain still and concentrate.

If the caster is disturbed, the insects scatter and the spell ends. This spell can only be cast outdoors and above ground.
DKjukbQY6QuTiQNp.name: Insect Plague

DRFDPFcP7iAbY2Ka.description:
This spell cures one living (not undead or non-living) creature of [[/r 1d6+1 #Cure Light Wounds]] points of damage. The caster can cure themselves with this spell.

Alternately, the spell can be used to cure paralysis (except that caused by a Hold Person or Hold Monster spell), although if it does so then no damage will be cured at the same time.

The spell will not increase the target's maximum hit points.

When reversed, this spell, cause light wounds, causes [[/r 1d6+1 #Cause Light Wounds]] points of damage to the target. No saving throw is allowed, but the caster must make a normal attack roll to inflict this damage.
DRFDPFcP7iAbY2Ka.name: Cure Light Wounds*

DkO31RFPLNQnKk1c.description: This spell makes spoiled or poisoned food and water safe for consumption. It can purify one ration of preserved food (either iron or standard rations), six waterskins of water, or enough regular food to feed twelve people. If cast on mud, the spell causes the dirt to settle, leaving behind a pool of pure, clear water. The spell does not affect any living creatures.
DkO31RFPLNQnKk1c.name: Purify Food and Water

Ealaro5qs0nyfUNQ.description:
Wish is the most powerful spell available to a cleric, capable of altering reality itself. However, its effects are subject to strict interpretation by the DM.

Requirements

  • Only clerics of 36th level with 18+ Wisdom may cast this spell.
  • Wishes are never found on scrolls but may exist in rare items such as rings.

Wording the Wish

The caster must clearly state their wish. The exact wording is crucial, as the spell follows the literal meaning rather than the intent. The DM may interpret the wish strictly, generously, or even maliciously.

  • If a wish is made with greed or malice, the DM should distort its results.
  • The DM may disallow unreasonable wishes, causing the spell to fail.
  • After a misinterpreted wish, the DM should explain the flaw in the phrasing.

Examples of badly phrased wishes:

  • "I wish to know everything about this dungeon." → The character knows all but forgets it in a second.
  • "I wish for a million gold pieces." → The gold lands on the character, crushing them, then disappears.
  • "I wish for permanent basilisk gaze powers." → The caster grows an extra basilisk head.

Allowed Effects

Spell Substitution: A wish can replicate:

  • Any 8th-level or lower magic-user spell
  • Any 6th-level or lower cleric/druid spell
  • This use of a wish is least likely to be distorted.

Harming Others

If a wish directly harms a creature:

  • The victim gets a saving throw vs. spells.
  • If they succeed, half of the effect rebounds onto the caster, who also saves (at -4 penalty).
  • If the wish only inconveniences (e.g., teleporting them into a prison), no saving throw is allowed.

Gaining Treasure

A wish can conjure up to 50,000 gp, but:

  • The caster loses 1 XP per gold piece gained.
  • This XP loss cannot be restored by any means.

Ability Score Changes

  • A wish can temporarily raise an ability score to a maximum of 18 for 6 turns.
  • A wish can permanently raise an ability score by 1 point per number of wishes used:
    • Raising Strength from 15 to 16 requires 16 wishes.
    • Raising it from 16 to 17 requires 17 more wishes.
    • All wishes must be cast within 1 week.
    • Wishes cannot permanently lower ability scores.

Maximum Experience Levels

  • A wish cannot exceed the 36th-level cap for human characters.
  • However, a wish can grant demihumans +1 Hit Die (new max: 9 for halflings, 11 for elves, 13 for dwarves).

Race Changes

A wish can permanently change a character's race:

  • Demihumans become human fighters of the same level.
  • Elves become magic-users or fighters (chosen by the wish caster).
  • Humans become demihumans, but never above their racial level cap.
  • If unwilling, the target gains a +5 bonus to their saving throw vs. spells to resist the change.

Rewriting Past Events

A wish may alter one event from the previous day:

  • Turning a lost battle into a victory (if feasible).
  • Changing a death to a near-death survival.
  • Changing a permanent loss to a temporary one.

The DM may warn players if their wish exceeds the spell's limits.

Important Restrictions

  • Effects labeled as "unchangeable even by a wish" cannot be altered.
  • Wishes cannot alter game mechanics (e.g., "dragons cannot breathe fire anymore").
  • Unreasonable or greedy wishes are less likely to succeed.
Ealaro5qs0nyfUNQ.name: Wish

GOdezzKGO2oajSeG.description: This spell heals 2d6 + 2 points of damage on one living creature when touched by the caster.
GOdezzKGO2oajSeG.name: Cure Serious Wounds*

ISzYkzwVL1ecnbWW.description: Darkness, creates a sphere of darkness instead. It will block all sight except infravision. Darkness cancels a light spell if cast upon it, but may itself be canceled by another light spell. If cast at an opponent's eyes, darkness causes blindness for the duration of the spell or until canceled. If the victim makes a successful saving throw vs. spell, the spell has no effect.
ISzYkzwVL1ecnbWW.name: Darkness*

Ib4hTm0WTzQ3eSNn.description:
This spell grants the caster incredible mobility, allowing flight, planar travel, and even transformation into gaseous form.

Effects:

  • The caster can fly at a rate of 360' (120'), similar to the Fly spell.
  • Once per turn, the caster may shift into a nearby plane by concentrating for one round.
  • The cleric may bring one additional creature per 5 levels (rounded down), provided they are touching at the moment of planar travel.
  • Unwilling creatures may make a saving throw vs. spells to resist being taken.

Gaseous Form:

  • In this form, the caster is immune to non-magical damage but cannot pass through a Protection from Evil spell or Anti-Magic Shell.
Ib4hTm0WTzQ3eSNn.name: Travel

JGfZZPMq3sk4YGKF.name: Neutralize Poison*

JRUVhgvUlK2PJc0e.description:
This spell cures one living (not undead or non-living) creature of [[/r 1d6+1 #Cure Light Wounds]] points of damage. The caster can cure themselves with this spell.

Alternately, the spell can be used to cure paralysis (except that caused by a Hold Person or Hold Monster spell), although if it does so then no damage will be cured at the same time.

The spell will not increase the target's maximum hit points.

When reversed, this spell, cause light wounds, causes [[/r 1d6+1 #Cause Light Wounds]] points of damage to the target. No saving throw is allowed, but the caster must make a normal attack roll to inflict this damage.
JRUVhgvUlK2PJc0e.name: Cause Light Wounds*

K0F8uKPh1J3IwXdl.description: The Black Hag has thick, warty skin that provides natural protection, giving it AC 4.
K0F8uKPh1J3IwXdl.name: Hag Skin

KWlSE6clWV5i6MSk.description:
The reverse of Raise Dead Fully, this spell destroys living creatures the same way the normal version destroys undead.

Effects on Living Creatures:

  • 7 HD or less: The target is immediately slain (no saving throw).
  • 7-12 HD: The target must make a saving throw vs. spells at -4 penalty; failure results in instant death.
  • 12+ HD: The target takes [[/r 6d10 #damage]] damage; a successful saving throw vs. spells reduces damage by half.

Effects on Undead: This spell has the same effect as Cureall would on a living creature:

  • Heals the undead to full hit points, leaving only [[/r 1d6 #damage]] remaining.
  • Can remove afflictions such as blindness, disease, feeblemind, or paralysis.
KWlSE6clWV5i6MSk.name: Obliterate*

LNcbZHOSoD2VW9Pt.description: This spell inflicts 2d6 + 2 points of damage on a creature touched by the caster. A successful melee attack roll is required to deliver the spell.
LNcbZHOSoD2VW9Pt.name: Cause Serious Wounds*

LPGvKorikS06MEwu.description: The saving throw against Breath Weapons is used to resist or mitigate the effects of a wide range of powerful exhaled attacks, not limited to dragons. This includes attacks like a dragon’s fiery or icy breath, a gorgon's petrifying breath, or a chimera's elemental breath. Each creature’s breath weapon has specific effects, such as damage, paralysis, or petrification. A successful saving throw generally halves the damage or avoids the secondary effect (such as paralysis or petrification), while failure applies the full consequences. The target number for the saving throw is determined by the character’s class and level.
LPGvKorikS06MEwu.name: Dragon Breath

LURZDF5vPPzNnhmV.description:
This spell allows the cleric to ask three yes-or-no questions of the greater powers (such as forces of nature, greater spirits, or Immortals).

Usage: May only be used once per week. The DM may restrict this to once a month if overused. Once a year, the cleric may ask six questions, usually on a day significant to the powers questioned.
LURZDF5vPPzNnhmV.name: Commune

M1pGKFRGgXtTK9hW.description: For the duration of this spell, the recipient is immune to damage from normal fire and heat. They also receive a +2 bonus to all saving throws against magical fire (such as dragon breath or fireball). Additionally, any damage taken from such magical fire is reduced by 1 point per die of damage, with each die dealing at least 1 point of damage. For red dragon breath, the damage is reduced by 1 point per Hit Die of the dragon, but never below 1 point per Hit Die.
M1pGKFRGgXtTK9hW.name: Resist Fire

MVhHiyZ4V8RFdxKo.description:
Blight, imposes a -1 penalty to morale, attack rolls, and damage rolls of enemies. Each affected creature may make a saving throw vs. spells to avoid these penalties.

It affects only those within a 20' x 20' area and only those who are not yet engaged in melee combat.
MVhHiyZ4V8RFdxKo.name: Blight*

Mbx3XzcI8SDwOW7C.description: This spell heals one living creature of 3d6 + 3 points of damage.
Mbx3XzcI8SDwOW7C.name: Cure Critical Wounds*

MdspDClzMJmQXYgc.description:
This spell animates normal skeletons or dead bodies within range, transforming them into enchanted skeletons or zombies. These undead obey the caster until destroyed by a dispel magic spell or another cleric.

Effect: For each experience level, the caster can animate 1 HD of undead. Skeletons retain the HD of the original creature, while zombies have +1 HD.

Humans and demihumans are treated as 1 HD for this spell. A human’s corpse would be animated as a 1 HD skeleton or a 2 HD zombie.

Notes: Animated undead are immune to sleep, charm, and poison effects. Using this spell for good is advised for lawful casters, as animating the dead is often seen as a Chaotic act.
MdspDClzMJmQXYgc.name: Animate Dead

N4CaR1FGi5cs5Sr0.description:
This spell allows the spellcaster to charm a number of Hit Dice of snakes equal to their level, with no saving throw allowed. For example, a 5th-level spellcaster could charm one 5 HD snake, five 1 HD snakes, or any combination of snakes totaling 5 Hit Dice or less. The charmed snakes will rise up and sway, but will not attack unless provoked.

If the spell is cast on snakes that are attacking the spellcaster, the duration is [[/r 1d4 + 1 #Snake Charm duration in rounds]]. Otherwise, the spell lasts for [[/r 1d4 + 1 #Snake Charm duration in turns]]. Once the spell ends, the snakes return to their normal behavior, but they will not automatically be hostile unless provoked.
N4CaR1FGi5cs5Sr0.name: Snake Charm
N4CaR1FGi5cs5Sr0.spellEffect: Charms 1 HD of snakes per level of the caster

Ntx0XEhh8rSAnqBU.description:
This spell grants the recipient complete protection against all non-magical environmental hazards. While the spell is in effect, the recipient does not need air, food, water, or sleep.

Protection Includes:

  • Survival in extreme heat or cold (such as deserts or blizzards).
  • Breathing in airless environments (underground, underwater, space, etc.).
  • Survival in vacuum or toxic natural atmospheres.
  • Immunity to environmental damage from other planes (such as the Elemental Plane of Fire).

Limitations:

  • Does not protect against magical damage, including spells.
  • Does not prevent attack damage, poisons, breath weapons, or physical blows.
Ntx0XEhh8rSAnqBU.name: Survival
Ntx0XEhh8rSAnqBU.spellEffect: Protects one creature against all non-magical damage from the environment

OuQdlTED03ESnFA5.description:
This spell removes one curse from a character, item, or area. Some curses, especially those on magical items, may only be lifted temporarily. For permanent removal, a dispel evil spell or a remove curse cast by a higher-level caster may be required (at the DM's discretion).

The reverse of this spell, curse, imposes a penalty or misfortune on the target, with effects limited only by the caster's imagination. If the curse is too powerful, it may rebound on the caster (DM's discretion). Typical curses include a -4 penalty to attack rolls, a -2 penalty to saving throws, halving of a prime requisite, or a -4 penalty on others' reaction rolls. The victim may make a saving throw vs. spells to avoid the curse.
OuQdlTED03ESnFA5.name: Remove Curse*

PiCyCtPW99rAdyDW.description: This spell allows the caster to sense the direction of a known object within range, but not its distance. It can detect a common object with a partial description, such as "stairs leading up," but will only indicate the direction of the nearest such object. To find a specific object, the caster must know exactly what the object looks like (size, shape, color, etc.). The spell will not locate a creature.
PiCyCtPW99rAdyDW.name: Locate Object

R3ZbW0DsxOpx54gZ.description:
This spell instantly destroys one magical barrier created by a cleric. It can also dispel certain barriers created by a magic-user.

Effects: *Remove Barrier* will destroy a cleric's *Barrier* spell and can also dispel the following magic-user spells:

  • Wall of Ice
  • Wall of Fire
  • Clothform
  • Woodform
  • Wall of Stone

Limitations: This spell does not affect the following spells: *Wall of Iron*, *Stoneform*, *Ironform*, or *Steelform*.
R3ZbW0DsxOpx54gZ.name: Remove Barrier*

TWEBKAnEi2OA2HWc.description:
The reverse of *Speak with Monsters*, this spell prevents one creature from communicating in any way.

Effects:

  • The target may attempt a saving throw vs. spells, but with a -2 penalty.
  • If the save fails, the victim is unable to communicate for the spell’s duration.
  • This includes all forms of communication: speech, hand gestures, writing, telepathy, etc.
  • The victim can still cast spells but cannot use magic items requiring command words, as the words turn into gibberish.

Duration: 1 turn per level of the caster.
TWEBKAnEi2OA2HWc.name: Babble*
TWEBKAnEi2OA2HWc.spellDuration: 1 turn per level of the caster

U8DlBFdHdysdg3K5.description:
This spell is an improved version of Raise Dead, capable of restoring any living creature—not just humans and demihumans—to life.

Effects on Humans & Demihumans:

  • The recipient awakens immediately, fully healed.
  • They can fight, use abilities, and cast spells without penalty.
  • Any afflictions they had at death (curses, diseases, etc.) remain.

Effects on Other Creatures: All restrictions from Raise Dead apply, including time limits and required rest.

Time Limit: A 17th-level cleric can raise a body that has been dead for up to 4 months. For each level beyond 17th, the limit increases by 4 months.

  • 17th level: 4 months
  • 18th level: 8 months
  • 19th level: 12 months
  • +4 months per level beyond 17th

Effects on Undead: If cast on an undead creature, the spell has the following results:

  • 7 HD or less: The undead is immediately destroyed (no saving throw).
  • 7-12 HD: The undead must make a saving throw vs. spells at -4 penalty; failure results in destruction.
  • 12+ HD: The undead takes [[/r 6d10 #damage]] damage; a saving throw vs. spells reduces the damage by half.
U8DlBFdHdysdg3K5.name: Raise Dead Fully*

UWlE939X0khl6hYd.description:
This spell allows the spellcaster to determine the alignment (Lawful, Neutral, or Chaotic) of any one creature within 10'. It can also reveal the alignment of an enchanted item or area, if applicable.

The reversed form, confuse alignment, lasts for one turn per level of the spellcaster and can be cast on a creature by touch. No saving throw is allowed. For the duration of the spell, any attempt to discern the recipient's alignment will yield a false result. This false alignment will remain consistent for all subsequent detection attempts during the spell's duration.
UWlE939X0khl6hYd.name: Know Alignment*

VVGX6DrLePb6EH2Z.description: Continual darkness, creates a similarly-sized area of total darkness, unaffected by normal light sources and infravision. A continual light spell can cancel it. If cast on a creature’s eyes, the target must make a saving throw vs. spells or be blinded.
VVGX6DrLePb6EH2Z.name: Continual Darkness*

Xw8x08yWioX55VWf.description:
This spell compels the target to undertake a specific task or quest as commanded by the caster. The target may attempt a saving throw vs. spells to resist; if successful, the spell has no effect.

Typical Tasks: The task might include slaying a particular monster, rescuing a prisoner, retrieving a magical item, or embarking on a pilgrimage. If the task is impossible or suicidal, the spell fails automatically.

Duration: The spell remains in effect until the specified task is completed. This spell compels the target to fulfill the task but does not compel them to do so willingly. Once completed, the target may hold a grudge against the caster, potentially seeking revenge depending on the circumstances of the quest.

Curse: A target who refuses to undertake the quest is cursed until they resume the task. The nature of this curse is determined by the GM and may be twice the usual strength of a standard curse.
Xw8x08yWioX55VWf.name: Quest*
Xw8x08yWioX55VWf.spellEffect: Compels one creature to perform a task

YRRqHA2BV4gaCAtE.description: Curse imposes a penalty or misfortune on the target, with effects limited only by the caster's imagination. If the curse is too powerful, it may rebound on the caster (DM's discretion). Typical curses include a -4 penalty to attack rolls, a -2 penalty to saving throws, halving of a prime requisite, or a -4 penalty on others' reaction rolls. The victim may make a saving throw vs. spells to avoid the curse.
YRRqHA2BV4gaCAtE.name: Curse*

aJqCU1tGQ6al1d03.description:
By means of this spell, a caster may ask three questions of a deceased spirit if the body is within range.

A caster of 6th or 7th level can contact recently deceased spirits (those dead up to 4 days). Casters of levels 8-14 have slightly more power (contacting spirits up to 4 months dead), and casters of levels 15-20 have even more (speaking with corpses up to 4 years dead). No time limits apply to casters of 21st level or greater.

The spirit will always reply in a tongue known to the caster, but can only offer knowledge of things up to the time of its death. If the spirit's alignment is the same as the caster's, it will provide clear and brief answers; however, if the alignments differ, the spirit may reply in riddles.
aJqCU1tGQ6al1d03.name: Speak with the Dead

cEPgte9ur7la8Biq.description:
This spell restores one full level of experience lost due to energy drain (such as from a vampire's attack). It does not provide additional levels if no level has been lost.

Limitations:

  • Only one level is restored per casting.
  • It cannot restore more than one level, nor increase a level beyond what was originally lost.

Cost to the Cleric:

  • Upon casting, the cleric temporarily loses one experience level, as if struck by a wight.
  • The cleric’s loss is not permanent—it is recovered after resting for [[/r 2d10 #days]].
cEPgte9ur7la8Biq.name: Restore*
cEPgte9ur7la8Biq.spellEffect: Restores 1 level lost to energy drain

dJX4s7VeY3nCQxk0.description: This spell creates an area of total silence within a 15' radius, making it impossible to converse or cast spells inside the affected area for the duration of the spell. Those within the sphere can still hear sounds from outside. If the spell is cast on a creature, the target must make a saving throw vs. spells. If the saving throw fails, the effect moves with the creature. If successful, the silence remains stationary, and the creature can leave the affected area.
dJX4s7VeY3nCQxk0.name: Silence 15' Radius

eUmNC7gcr8sfjgIt.description: This spell inflicts 3d6 + 3 points of damage on a creature touched by the caster. A successful melee attack roll is required.
eUmNC7gcr8sfjgIt.name: Cause Critical Wounds*
eUmNC7gcr8sfjgIt.spellEffect: Inflicts critical damage on one creature

efQy9r3WNgf8wc1h.description: Cause disease, infects the target with a wasting disease. The target must make a saving throw vs. spells or suffer a -2 penalty on attack rolls and hindered healing. The disease is fatal within [[/r 2d12 #Cure Disease duration in days]] days unless removed by a cure disease spell.
efQy9r3WNgf8wc1h.name: Cause Disease*

fz08bi1u17suxcHV.description:
This spell summons an enchanted spring from the ground or a wall, flowing for 6 turns and producing enough water for 12 men and their mounts (about 50 gallons).

Each level above 8th allows the cleric to create water for an additional 12 men and mounts. The caster can control the amount of water produced, up to the spell’s maximum.
fz08bi1u17suxcHV.name: Create Water

g1cp26MWAKsCPMj8.description: This spell cures almost any form of blindness, including those caused by light or darkness spells. It will not affect blindness caused by a curse.
g1cp26MWAKsCPMj8.name: Cure Blindness

ghFgFJmF0lbxWXyM.description:
This spell summons an intelligent elemental being called an Aerial Servant to retrieve a specified item or creature and return it to the caster. The servant appears immediately, and the cleric must describe the target and its location, or the servant will depart.

The aerial servant is ethereal at will, allowing it to bypass most barriers, but it cannot pass through a Protection from Evil effect.

Task and Duration: The servant will attempt to find and bring back the target within the spell's duration (1 day per caster level). If the spell ends before the task is completed—whether the servant is still searching or already returning—it is considered a failure.

Strength and Carrying Capacity: The aerial servant has 18 Strength and can carry up to 500 lbs (5,000 cn).

Failure Consequences: If the aerial servant cannot complete its task within the spell duration, it goes insane and immediately returns to attack the caster.
ghFgFJmF0lbxWXyM.name: Aerial Servant
ghFgFJmF0lbxWXyM.spellEffect: Servant fetches one item or creature

hQe47i6zHSMNH1xM.description:
This spell allows the cleric to raise any human, dwarf, halfling, or elf from the dead. The body must be present, and any missing parts will cause corresponding disabilities in the raised character.

Effect: An 8th-level cleric can raise a body that has been dead up to four days. Each level above 8th extends this limit by four additional days (e.g., a 10th-level cleric can raise bodies dead for up to twelve days).

The character is raised with 1 hit point and is weakened: unable to fight, cast spells, or move faster than half speed. These penalties last for two weeks of complete bed rest, which cannot be hastened by magical healing.

Undead Effect: When cast on an undead creature within range, the target must make a saving throw vs. spells with a -2 penalty or be destroyed. Vampires that fail the save retreat to their coffins in gaseous form. Against undead creatures stronger than vampires, the spell deals 3d10 damage (saving throw for half).
hQe47i6zHSMNH1xM.name: Raise Dead*
hQe47i6zHSMNH1xM.spellEffect: Raises one dead human or demihuman, or damages undead

if5rojWqRK8SO9oq.description:
This spell enhances the morale of friendly creatures by +1 and grants them a +1 bonus to all attack and damage rolls. It affects only those within a 20' x 20' area and only those who are not yet engaged in melee combat.

The reversed form, blight, imposes a -1 penalty to morale, attack rolls, and damage rolls of enemies. Each affected creature may make a saving throw vs. spells to avoid these penalties.
if5rojWqRK8SO9oq.name: Bless*

iyGtwIwUFDjPwJAp.description:
With *Truesight*, the cleric gains the ability to see all things as they truly are within a 120' radius. The spell reveals all hidden, invisible, and ethereal objects or creatures, functioning as the *detect invisible* spell.

Additionally, the cleric perceives any secret doors, and can see through any form of disguise, polymorph, or other alterations. Deception is impossible. The spell also reveals creatures' alignments, experience, and power levels.
iyGtwIwUFDjPwJAp.name: Truesight
iyGtwIwUFDjPwJAp.spellEffect: Reveals true forms of all things within 120'

jveXzCkefdHoNG5Z.description: The Black Hag attacks with poison-coated iron claws. Any creature hit must save vs. poison at -4 or die instantly.
jveXzCkefdHoNG5Z.name: Iron Claws (Poisoned)

kbMbv1IYvXPXS36k.description: This spell causes all mechanical and magical traps within 30' of the spellcaster to emit a faint blue glow. While it reveals the presence of traps, it does not provide information on their type or how to disarm them. Ambushes or natural hazards like quicksand are not considered traps and will not be revealed by this spell.
kbMbv1IYvXPXS36k.name: Find Traps

kh3F5LTAN6TudWl7.description:
This is the most powerful healing spell available. When used to cure wounds, it restores nearly all damage, leaving the recipient with only [[/r 1d6 #damage remains]] points of damage remaining.

Healing Process: Restore the target to full starting hit points, then roll 1d6 and subtract that amount from their total.

Alternative Uses: Instead of healing damage, Cureall may be used to cure one of the following conditions:

  • Remove a curse
  • Neutralize poison
  • Cure paralysis
  • Cure disease
  • Cure blindness
  • Remove a Feeblemind effect

If the recipient is suffering from multiple afflictions (such as wounds and a curse), the cleric must specify which one the spell is curing.

Effect on Recently Raised Creatures: If cast on someone who has just been affected by Raise Dead, Cureall eliminates the need for two weeks of bed rest, allowing the target to function normally immediately. This is the only magical healing that works on a newly raised creature.
kh3F5LTAN6TudWl7.name: Cureall

l6Qu35ZJ8bO1gABR.description:
This spell cures any disease, including those caused by mummies or green slime. At 11th level or higher, it can also cure lycanthropy.

The reverse, cause disease, infects the target with a wasting disease. The target must make a saving throw vs. spells or suffer a -2 penalty on attack rolls and hindered healing. The disease is fatal within [[/r 2d12 #Cure Disease duration in days]] days unless removed by a cure disease spell.
l6Qu35ZJ8bO1gABR.name: Cure Disease*

lCHshKrE1UG8LzQl.description:
Confuse alignment, lasts for one turn per level of the spellcaster and can be cast on a creature by touch. No saving throw is allowed. For the duration of the spell, any attempt to discern the recipient's alignment will yield a false result. This false alignment will remain consistent for all subsequent detection attempts during the spell's duration.

This spell allows the spellcaster to determine the alignment (Lawful, Neutral, or Chaotic) of any one creature within 10'. It can also reveal the alignment of an enchanted item or area, if applicable.
lCHshKrE1UG8LzQl.name: Confuse Alignment*

ltGZ6oQ18anVroeD.description:
This spell grants the cleric the ability to communicate with any living or undead creatures within 30'. Even unintelligent monsters will understand and respond.

Effects:

  • Creatures spoken to will not attack the cleric while in conversation.
  • However, if attacked, they may defend themselves or flee.
  • The cleric may ask only one question per round.

The spell lasts for one round per level of the cleric.
ltGZ6oQ18anVroeD.name: Speak with Monsters*
ltGZ6oQ18anVroeD.spellDuration: 1 round per level of the cleric

m1FvkU1BRVNIEwk0.description:
This spell instantly teleports the cleric and all equipment they are carrying to their designated sanctuary, regardless of distance.

Sanctuary Requirement: The cleric must have a permanent home (such as a castle) that includes a meditation room. This room serves as the spell’s destination.

Initiative Advantage: During the round this spell is cast, the cleric automatically gains initiative unless surprised.

Restrictions:

  • The spell affects only the cleric and their carried equipment.
  • Other creatures cannot be transported.
m1FvkU1BRVNIEwk0.name: Word of Recall

m1tYiOTB8EjVcyV3.description:
This spell allows the caster to see a glow around any magical creature, object and place within range. Magical creatures do not get a saving throw against this effect.

The glow only extends a couple of inches around the magical object, so if it is in a container or behind another object then some or all of the glow may not be visible.
m1tYiOTB8EjVcyV3.name: Detect Magic

mwZDtJH3vWGtKkoa.description:
This spell creates poison in a creature or container upon touch. A creature must succeed on a saving throw vs. poison or die instantly. When cast on a container, the poison affects its contents with no save.

Notes: Poisoning is usually considered a Chaotic act.
mwZDtJH3vWGtKkoa.name: Create Poison*
mwZDtJH3vWGtKkoa.spellEffect: Creates poison in a creature or container

n7dV3mJugAuwp2Uo.description:
This spell allows any one weapon to inflict 1d6 additional points of damage per attack (similar to a magical staff of striking). The weapon will inflict this extra damage with every successful blow for as long as the spell lasts. This bonus does not apply to attack rolls, but only to damage rolls.

If the caster casts this spell on a normal weapon, the weapon may then damage creatures which are normally affected only by magic weapons; the weapon will do 1d6 points of damage per strike (regardless of the normal damage of the weapon).
n7dV3mJugAuwp2Uo.name: Striking

nc9WShqev4GE0c86.description:
This spell allows the cleric to animate non-living, non-magical objects, causing them to move and attack. Magical objects are unaffected.

The spell can animate either:

  • One object up to 400 lbs (4,000 cn), roughly the size of two men.
  • Multiple smaller objects, as long as their total weight does not exceed 400 lbs.

Combat Abilities: The DM determines the movement rate, number of attacks, damage, and armor class of animated objects. As a guideline:

  • A man-sized statue might move at 30' per round, attack once per round for [[/r 2d8 #points of damage]] damage, and have AC 1.
  • A chair might move at 180' per round, attack twice per round for [[/r 1d4 #points of damage]] damage per attack, and have AC 6.

All animated objects use the cleric’s chance to hit in combat.
nc9WShqev4GE0c86.name: Animate Objects

o5V8RSHGDTrRFXdG.description:
This spell destroys other spell effects within a 20' x 20' x 20' area. It does not affect magical items but can cancel temporary effects they produce.

Effect: Automatically dispels spells from casters of equal or lower level. For higher-level casters, there is a 5% chance of failure per level difference.

Examples: A 7th-level caster trying to dispel a spell from a 9th-level caster has a 10% chance of failure.
o5V8RSHGDTrRFXdG.name: Dispel Magic

oJc4IbHP8UeZsbBz.description:
This spell creates light as bright as daylight in a spherical volume with a 30' radius. It lasts until dispelled or countered by a continual darkness spell. Creatures that suffer penalties in bright daylight also suffer them within the area of effect.

If cast on a creature’s eyes, the target must make a saving throw vs. spells or be blinded until the effect is removed. This spell can be cast in an area, on an object, or directly on a creature's eyes to cause blindness.

The reverse, continual darkness, creates a similarly-sized area of total darkness, unaffected by normal light sources and infravision. A continual light spell can cancel it. If cast on a creature’s eyes, the target must make a saving throw vs. spells or be blinded.
oJc4IbHP8UeZsbBz.name: Continual Light*

oSsoUp6uyMWT5wuo.description:
This spell allows the cleric to temporarily wield the magical powers of a magic-user, enabling the use of certain restricted items.

Effects:

  • The cleric may use one magic-user-only item, choosing between:
    • A magic-user device (such as a wand, staff, or rod).
    • A magic-user scroll containing a 1st or 2nd level spell.
  • Spell Level Restriction: The cleric cannot use spells of 3rd level or higher, even if present on the scroll.

Duration:

  • The spell lasts for one turn (10 minutes) or until the cleric uses the item.

Temporary Knowledge:

  • During the spell’s duration, the cleric magically understands how to operate the selected item.
  • For a scroll spell, the cleric is treated as the minimum level required to cast the spell.
oSsoUp6uyMWT5wuo.name: Wizardry
oSsoUp6uyMWT5wuo.spellEffect: Allows the use of one magic-user device or scroll spell

q97xgckJUlNregWM.description:
This spell creates and invisible magical barrier all around the caster's body (less than an inch away). Here’s the revised text with all references to "cleric" changed to "caster":

While the spell is in effect, characters and monsters attacking the caster suffer a -1 penalty to their attack rolls, and the caster gains a +1 bonus to all saving throws.

Additionally, enchanted creatures are unable to touch the caster! (An enchanted creature is one that normal weapons cannot affect, only magical weapons can hit. A creature that can only be hit by a silver weapon—like a werewolf—is not considered enchanted. Any creature that is magically summoned or controlled, such as a charmed character, is also considered enchanted.) This barrier completely protects the caster from all melee or hand-to-hand attacks from such creatures; however, it does not prevent attacks from missile weapons. Enchanted creatures using missile weapons still suffer the -1 penalty to attack rolls but can still hit the caster.

This spell does not affect a magic missile spell used by magic-users.

If the caster attacks an enchanted creature during the spell's duration, the spell’s effect changes slightly. Enchanted creatures are then able to touch the caster, but still suffer the attack roll penalty; the penalty and the caster's saving throw adjustments remain until the spell's duration ends.
q97xgckJUlNregWM.name: Protection from Evil

qOYqNCXD21r8zSkK.description:
When the spellcaster casts this spell and then touches any living creature, it will calm the creature and remove any fear. If the creature has been affected by a fear spell or effect that normally does not allow a saving throw, the remove fear spell can still be effective. If the spellcaster uses the spell on someone afflicted by a magical fear effect, the victim gets to make a saving throw vs. spells, with a bonus to the roll equal to the spellcaster's level of experience (up to a maximum bonus of +6). If the saving throw is successful, the victim's fear is dispelled. Regardless of the spellcaster's level or any bonuses, a roll of 1 will always fail.

The reversed form of the spell, cause fear, will make any one creature flee for two turns. The victim may make a saving throw vs. spells to avoid the effect. This reversed spell has a range of 120'.
qOYqNCXD21r8zSkK.name: Remove Fear*

qOdBpdnMtgi6ZNRo.description:
This powerful spell affects all creatures, friend or foe, within a 40' radius of the caster. Creatures of alignments other than the cleric's suffer the following effects, with no saving throw allowed:

Creature Level / HDEffect
Up to 5th Level / HDKilled instantly
6th - 8th Level / HDStunned for [[/r 2d10 #turns]] turns
9th - 12th Level / HDDeafened for [[/r 1d6 #turns]] turns
13+ Level / HDStunned for [[/r 1d10 #rounds]] rounds

Saving Throw: Any creature of 13th level / HD or higher, or one that shares the cleric’s alignment, may attempt a saving throw vs. spells to negate all effects.

Obstructions: *Holy Word* is not blocked by stone or solid materials, except for lead. It is also stopped by an *Anti-Magic Shell*.
qOdBpdnMtgi6ZNRo.name: Holy Word

qq8YQ6MScZ1oNXCQ.description:
This powerful spell causes the ground to shake violently, creating cracks and destruction in an area up to 60' square. The affected area increases by 5' per caster level above 17th.

Area of Effect:

  • 17th level cleric: 60' square
  • 18th level cleric: 65' square
  • 19th level cleric: 70' square
  • +5' to each dimension per additional level

Effects:

  • Small dwellings collapse into rubble.
  • Larger structures suffer severe cracks.
  • Hills, cliffs, and earthen formations trigger rockslides.
  • Cracks may open in the ground, randomly engulfing 1 in 6 creatures.

A creature in danger of falling into a crack may attempt a saving throw vs. death to avoid being crushed.
qq8YQ6MScZ1oNXCQ.name: Earthquake

qyzYV5n6mU4aqG1S.description: The reversed form of the spell, cause fear, will make any one creature flee for two turns. The victim may make a saving throw vs. spells to avoid the effect. This reversed spell has a range of 120'.
qyzYV5n6mU4aqG1S.name: Cause Fear*

ubiaTpsOJCReogeE.description:
This spell creates enough food to feed up to 12 men and their mounts for one day. For every level above 8th, it creates enough for 12 more people and mounts.

Note: Created food spoils after 24 hours and cannot be stored for future use.
ubiaTpsOJCReogeE.name: Create Food

udIWxEXNqiYUdSJj.description:
This spell creates a sphere of light, as if cast by a bright torch or lamp. If the spell is cast on an object (such as a weapon), the light moves with the object.

If the spell is cast at a creature's eyes, the victim makes a saving throw vs. spell. If the saving throw fails, the victim is blinded by the light for the duration of the spell, or until the spell effect is canceled.

When reversed, this spell, darkness, creates a sphere of darkness instead. It will block all sight except infravision. Darkness cancels a light spell if cast upon it, but may itself be canceled by another light spell. If cast at an opponent's eyes, darkness causes blindness for the duration of the spell or until canceled. If the victim makes a successful saving throw vs. spell, the spell has no effect.
udIWxEXNqiYUdSJj.name: Light*

vpt0w6u117rGirmw.description:
This spell allows the cleric to create normal animals out of thin air. The animals appear at a chosen point within 30' and will obey the cleric at all times. They can be commanded to fight, carry items, guard areas, or perform other tasks within their natural abilities.

Once created, the animals can be sent up to 240' away but will continue to follow the cleric's commands. However, if instructions are not carefully worded, they may act according to their natural instincts.

Number and Size of Animals: The cleric chooses the number of animals, but not their exact type. The DM determines the specific creatures, which may include:

  • 1 large animal (e.g., elephant, hippopotamus)
  • 3 medium-sized animals (e.g., bear, great cat)
  • 6 small animals (e.g., wolf, rock baboon)

The spell cannot create giant animals. The animals disappear when slain or when the spell duration ends.
vpt0w6u117rGirmw.name: Create Normal Animals

w3pi61O5kob0wA8F.description:
This spell paralyzes up to four creatures, affecting any human, demihuman, or human-like beings such as bugbears, dryads, gnolls, hobgoblins, kobolds, lizard men, ogres, orcs, nixies, pixies, or sprites. It does not affect undead or creatures larger than ogres. Each target must make a saving throw vs. spells or be paralyzed for nine turns. If the spell is cast at a single target, that creature receives a -2 penalty to their saving throw. If cast at a group, up to four creatures of the spellcaster's choice can be affected, but without any penalty to their saving throws. The paralysis can only be removed by the reversed form of this spell or a dispel magic spell.

The reversed spell, free person, lifts the paralysis from up to four victims affected by the normal form of the spell (including *hold person* cast by a magic-user or an elf). It has no effect on other forms of paralysis, such as that caused by a ghoul.
w3pi61O5kob0wA8F.name: Hold Person*

wFs8c7RTtgLSPWMH.description:
The reversed form of *Raise Dead*, this spell creates a death ray that kills a single living creature within 60' unless the target succeeds on a saving throw vs. death ray.

Undead Effect: If cast on an undead creature with 10 or more Hit Dice (such as a phantom, haunt, spirit, nightshade, or special), it restores 3d10 hit points instead of dealing damage.

A Lawful cleric will typically only use *Finger of Death* in life-or-death situations.
wFs8c7RTtgLSPWMH.name: Finger of Death*
wFs8c7RTtgLSPWMH.spellEffect: Kills one living creature or heals high-HD undead

wq8sW0rAg0p6Uh7I.description: When this spell is cast, all creatures within 30' of the spellcaster are protected from freezing temperatures without harm. Those affected also receive a +2 bonus to all saving throws against cold-based attacks. Additionally, any cold damage dealt to them is reduced by 1 point per die, with a minimum of 1 point of damage per die. The effect moves with the spellcaster.
wq8sW0rAg0p6Uh7I.name: Resist Cold

yl9xEfAgXnj0KYtE.description:
By casting this spell, the cleric gains the ability to navigate toward a specific place, even if they have never been there before. For the duration of the spell, the cleric instinctively knows the direction to their destination.

Special Knowledge: In addition to knowing the correct path, the cleric gains magical awareness of any special knowledge needed to reach the location. This may include:

  • The location of secret doors
  • Hidden or obscured passages
  • Passwords required to gain entry

Duration Effects: When the spell ends, the cleric retains only a general sense of the direction to the destination; all other special knowledge is forgotten.

Restriction: If the cleric attempts to record or disclose the special knowledge to others in any way, the spell is instantly negated.

This spell is often used to find fast escape routes or to navigate unknown terrain.
yl9xEfAgXnj0KYtE.name: Find the Path
yl9xEfAgXnj0KYtE.spellDuration: 6 turns + 1 turn per level of the caster
yl9xEfAgXnj0KYtE.spellEffect: Shows the path to an area

zHU1WiUsOqW0gGqK.description:
This spell affects all undead and enchanted monsters within 30'. Each affected creature must make a saving throw vs. spells or be destroyed. If cast on a single creature, it takes a -2 penalty to its saving throw.

Effect: Banishes creatures from other planes if they fail their saving throw. Those that save must flee and stay away as long as the caster concentrates, remaining stationary.

The spell can also remove a curse from one item or dispel a magical charm effect on a creature.
zHU1WiUsOqW0gGqK.name: Dispel Evil
zHU1WiUsOqW0gGqK.spellEffect: Affects undead, enchanted creatures, or one curse or charm

zip9p91Zq4J7MxpO.description: This spell doubles the size of one normal or giant animal, increasing its strength, damage, and carrying capacity accordingly. The animal’s behavior, armor class, and hit points remain unchanged, and the spell has no effect on intelligent or fantastic creatures.
zip9p91Zq4J7MxpO.name: Growth of Animal
zip9p91Zq4J7MxpO.spellEffect: Doubles the size of one animal

Black Hag (18 HD).name: Black Hag (18 HD)

Black Hag (19 HD).biography:
The Black Hag is a terrifying, hideous creature with black hair and warty blue-black skin. Unlike normal spellcasters, it revels in destruction and controls undead as if it were undead itself.

Undead Control: The black hag can control undead as if it had 38 HD, making it an extremely dangerous necromantic force.

Poisonous Claws: The hag attacks with poison-coated iron claws. Any creature hit must save vs. poison at -4 or die instantly.

Spellcasting: The black hag is a natural spellcaster, casting spells as a 7th-level cleric. (Spells not preloaded.)

Dark Lairs & Evil Minions: Black hags live in dark caves or deep forests, usually accompanied by 3d6 evil creatures (often undead).

Companions: They often keep slimes, oozes, and puddings as allies.

Terrain: Woods.

1EoPs5AWiHzTX6r2.description:
The reversed form of *Raise Dead*, this spell creates a death ray that kills a single living creature within 60' unless the target succeeds on a saving throw vs. death ray.

Undead Effect: If cast on an undead creature with 10 or more Hit Dice (such as a phantom, haunt, spirit, nightshade, or special), it restores 3d10 hit points instead of dealing damage.

A Lawful cleric will typically only use *Finger of Death* in life-or-death situations.
1EoPs5AWiHzTX6r2.name: Finger of Death*
1EoPs5AWiHzTX6r2.spellEffect: Kills one living creature or heals high-HD undead

2hwi7grquMGGsKQm.description: This spell creates an area of total silence within a 15' radius, making it impossible to converse or cast spells inside the affected area for the duration of the spell. Those within the sphere can still hear sounds from outside. If the spell is cast on a creature, the target must make a saving throw vs. spells. If the saving throw fails, the effect moves with the creature. If successful, the silence remains stationary, and the creature can leave the affected area.
2hwi7grquMGGsKQm.name: Silence 15' Radius

32tVCzsdDd5HET5K.description: This spell renders any poison harmless in a creature, container, or on an object. It can revive a creature poisoned within the last 10 rounds but does not heal any other damage.
32tVCzsdDd5HET5K.name: Neutralize Poison*

3zTP2ziwhwQqiY4m.description: Curse imposes a penalty or misfortune on the target, with effects limited only by the caster's imagination. If the curse is too powerful, it may rebound on the caster (DM's discretion). Typical curses include a -4 penalty to attack rolls, a -2 penalty to saving throws, halving of a prime requisite, or a -4 penalty on others' reaction rolls. The victim may make a saving throw vs. spells to avoid the curse.
3zTP2ziwhwQqiY4m.name: Curse*

4utuhT5Tk06ymiRm.description:
This spell summons a vast swarm of insects in a 30' radius, obscuring vision and driving off creatures with less than 3 Hit Dice (no saving throw). The caster can direct the swarm to move up to 20' per round within a range of 480' but must remain still and concentrate.

If the caster is disturbed, the insects scatter and the spell ends. This spell can only be cast outdoors and above ground.
4utuhT5Tk06ymiRm.name: Insect Plague

53rCbMfhAI7yF9d3.description:
This spell enhances the morale of friendly creatures by +1 and grants them a +1 bonus to all attack and damage rolls. It affects only those within a 20' x 20' area and only those who are not yet engaged in melee combat.

The reversed form, blight, imposes a -1 penalty to morale, attack rolls, and damage rolls of enemies. Each affected creature may make a saving throw vs. spells to avoid these penalties.
53rCbMfhAI7yF9d3.name: Bless*

5J2YCGBWdbrI1TY7.description:
This spell creates a magical barrier up to 30' in diameter and 30' high, consisting of whirling and dancing hammers. The barrier is obviously dangerous to any who pass through it.

Damage: Any creature passing through the barrier takes [[/r 7d10 #points of damage]] (7-70) points of damage. No saving throw is allowed.

This spell is commonly used to block entrances, corridors, or other key passages.
5J2YCGBWdbrI1TY7.name: Barrier*

5fUTiMsyVpgFjbaO.description:
This powerful spell affects all creatures, friend or foe, within a 40' radius of the caster. Creatures of alignments other than the cleric's suffer the following effects, with no saving throw allowed:

Creature Level / HDEffect
Up to 5th Level / HDKilled instantly
6th - 8th Level / HDStunned for [[/r 2d10 #turns]] turns
9th - 12th Level / HDDeafened for [[/r 1d6 #turns]] turns
13+ Level / HDStunned for [[/r 1d10 #rounds]] rounds

Saving Throw: Any creature of 13th level / HD or higher, or one that shares the cleric’s alignment, may attempt a saving throw vs. spells to negate all effects.

Obstructions: *Holy Word* is not blocked by stone or solid materials, except for lead. It is also stopped by an *Anti-Magic Shell*.
5fUTiMsyVpgFjbaO.name: Holy Word

9Jcnbzi7tXSeg4HJ.description: The reversed form of the spell, cause fear, will make any one creature flee for two turns. The victim may make a saving throw vs. spells to avoid the effect. This reversed spell has a range of 120'.
9Jcnbzi7tXSeg4HJ.name: Cause Fear*

9QAxmRo4LCKrb71w.description:
Confuse alignment, lasts for one turn per level of the spellcaster and can be cast on a creature by touch. No saving throw is allowed. For the duration of the spell, any attempt to discern the recipient's alignment will yield a false result. This false alignment will remain consistent for all subsequent detection attempts during the spell's duration.

This spell allows the spellcaster to determine the alignment (Lawful, Neutral, or Chaotic) of any one creature within 10'. It can also reveal the alignment of an enchanted item or area, if applicable.
9QAxmRo4LCKrb71w.name: Confuse Alignment*

Ac85mJhT2ZKp3XZu.description: The Magic Wand saving throw is used to avoid the effects of attacks or abilities activated through magical wands, such as paralysis rays or damage-dealing beams. A successful save, rolled on a d20, indicates that the character avoids or mitigates the harmful effects. The target number to save is determined by the character's class and level, as found on the saving throw table​​.
Ac85mJhT2ZKp3XZu.name: Magic Wand

AtRHd5QJ4FTDfxas.description:
This spell allows the spellcaster to determine the alignment (Lawful, Neutral, or Chaotic) of any one creature within 10'. It can also reveal the alignment of an enchanted item or area, if applicable.

The reversed form, confuse alignment, lasts for one turn per level of the spellcaster and can be cast on a creature by touch. No saving throw is allowed. For the duration of the spell, any attempt to discern the recipient's alignment will yield a false result. This false alignment will remain consistent for all subsequent detection attempts during the spell's duration.
AtRHd5QJ4FTDfxas.name: Know Alignment*

BgjnmuEaHM9i04FH.description:
Wish is the most powerful spell available to a cleric, capable of altering reality itself. However, its effects are subject to strict interpretation by the DM.

Requirements

  • Only clerics of 36th level with 18+ Wisdom may cast this spell.
  • Wishes are never found on scrolls but may exist in rare items such as rings.

Wording the Wish

The caster must clearly state their wish. The exact wording is crucial, as the spell follows the literal meaning rather than the intent. The DM may interpret the wish strictly, generously, or even maliciously.

  • If a wish is made with greed or malice, the DM should distort its results.
  • The DM may disallow unreasonable wishes, causing the spell to fail.
  • After a misinterpreted wish, the DM should explain the flaw in the phrasing.

Examples of badly phrased wishes:

  • "I wish to know everything about this dungeon." → The character knows all but forgets it in a second.
  • "I wish for a million gold pieces." → The gold lands on the character, crushing them, then disappears.
  • "I wish for permanent basilisk gaze powers." → The caster grows an extra basilisk head.

Allowed Effects

Spell Substitution: A wish can replicate:

  • Any 8th-level or lower magic-user spell
  • Any 6th-level or lower cleric/druid spell
  • This use of a wish is least likely to be distorted.

Harming Others

If a wish directly harms a creature:

  • The victim gets a saving throw vs. spells.
  • If they succeed, half of the effect rebounds onto the caster, who also saves (at -4 penalty).
  • If the wish only inconveniences (e.g., teleporting them into a prison), no saving throw is allowed.

Gaining Treasure

A wish can conjure up to 50,000 gp, but:

  • The caster loses 1 XP per gold piece gained.
  • This XP loss cannot be restored by any means.

Ability Score Changes

  • A wish can temporarily raise an ability score to a maximum of 18 for 6 turns.
  • A wish can permanently raise an ability score by 1 point per number of wishes used:
    • Raising Strength from 15 to 16 requires 16 wishes.
    • Raising it from 16 to 17 requires 17 more wishes.
    • All wishes must be cast within 1 week.
    • Wishes cannot permanently lower ability scores.

Maximum Experience Levels

  • A wish cannot exceed the 36th-level cap for human characters.
  • However, a wish can grant demihumans +1 Hit Die (new max: 9 for halflings, 11 for elves, 13 for dwarves).

Race Changes

A wish can permanently change a character's race:

  • Demihumans become human fighters of the same level.
  • Elves become magic-users or fighters (chosen by the wish caster).
  • Humans become demihumans, but never above their racial level cap.
  • If unwilling, the target gains a +5 bonus to their saving throw vs. spells to resist the change.

Rewriting Past Events

A wish may alter one event from the previous day:

  • Turning a lost battle into a victory (if feasible).
  • Changing a death to a near-death survival.
  • Changing a permanent loss to a temporary one.

The DM may warn players if their wish exceeds the spell's limits.

Important Restrictions

  • Effects labeled as "unchangeable even by a wish" cannot be altered.
  • Wishes cannot alter game mechanics (e.g., "dragons cannot breathe fire anymore").
  • Unreasonable or greedy wishes are less likely to succeed.
BgjnmuEaHM9i04FH.name: Wish

ByG0uvv2ewRX36o0.description:
This spell allows the cleric to raise any human, dwarf, halfling, or elf from the dead. The body must be present, and any missing parts will cause corresponding disabilities in the raised character.

Effect: An 8th-level cleric can raise a body that has been dead up to four days. Each level above 8th extends this limit by four additional days (e.g., a 10th-level cleric can raise bodies dead for up to twelve days).

The character is raised with 1 hit point and is weakened: unable to fight, cast spells, or move faster than half speed. These penalties last for two weeks of complete bed rest, which cannot be hastened by magical healing.

Undead Effect: When cast on an undead creature within range, the target must make a saving throw vs. spells with a -2 penalty or be destroyed. Vampires that fail the save retreat to their coffins in gaseous form. Against undead creatures stronger than vampires, the spell deals 3d10 damage (saving throw for half).
ByG0uvv2ewRX36o0.name: Raise Dead*
ByG0uvv2ewRX36o0.spellEffect: Raises one dead human or demihuman, or damages undead

C8BPJyJpAa4zFUaK.description:
Free person, lifts the paralysis from up to four victims affected by the normal form of the spell (including *hold person* cast by a magic-user or an elf). It has no effect on other forms of paralysis, such as that caused by a ghoul.

This spell paralyzes up to four creatures, affecting any human, demihuman, or human-like beings such as bugbears, dryads, gnolls, hobgoblins, kobolds, lizard men, ogres, orcs, nixies, pixies, or sprites. It does not affect undead or creatures larger than ogres. Each target must make a saving throw vs. spells or be paralyzed for nine turns. If the spell is cast at a single target, that creature receives a -2 penalty to their saving throw. If cast at a group, up to four creatures of the spellcaster's choice can be affected, but without any penalty to their saving throws. The paralysis can only be removed by the reversed form of this spell or a dispel magic spell.
C8BPJyJpAa4zFUaK.name: Free Person*

CXugATW8G7f6v0Z4.description: This spell heals 2d6 + 2 points of damage on one living creature when touched by the caster.
CXugATW8G7f6v0Z4.name: Cure Serious Wounds*

CibDNr6mf7Ua8qRx.description: When the spell is cast, the caster will see evilly enchanted objects within 120' glow dark red. It also causes creates that intent to harm the caster to glow when they are within the area of effect. Not all Chaotic alignment creatures will have evil intentions, but many do. Traps and poisons are neither good nor evil, merely dangerous; this spell does not reveal them.
CibDNr6mf7Ua8qRx.name: Detect Evil

E82ibGQx5vdlGfFU.description:
This spell affects all undead and enchanted monsters within 30'. Each affected creature must make a saving throw vs. spells or be destroyed. If cast on a single creature, it takes a -2 penalty to its saving throw.

Effect: Banishes creatures from other planes if they fail their saving throw. Those that save must flee and stay away as long as the caster concentrates, remaining stationary.

The spell can also remove a curse from one item or dispel a magical charm effect on a creature.
E82ibGQx5vdlGfFU.name: Dispel Evil
E82ibGQx5vdlGfFU.spellEffect: Affects undead, enchanted creatures, or one curse or charm

EKaXvAx8XH3krOjF.description:
This spell transforms [[/r 2d8 #sticks into snakes]] sticks into snakes, which may be poisonous (50% chance per snake). The snakes obey the caster's commands but will revert to sticks when slain or when the spell's duration ends.

Snake Stats: AC 6; HD 1; AT 1 bite; Dmg 1d4; MV 90' (30'); Save F1; ML 12; AL Neutral; SA poison (50% chance per snake to be poisonous).

Non-poisonous snakes grant 10 XP each, while poisonous ones grant 13 XP each.
EKaXvAx8XH3krOjF.name: Sticks to Snakes
EKaXvAx8XH3krOjF.spellEffect: Turns up to 16 sticks into snakes

F27ChYS6QsWWj6VE.description:
This spell instantly teleports the cleric and all equipment they are carrying to their designated sanctuary, regardless of distance.

Sanctuary Requirement: The cleric must have a permanent home (such as a castle) that includes a meditation room. This room serves as the spell’s destination.

Initiative Advantage: During the round this spell is cast, the cleric automatically gains initiative unless surprised.

Restrictions:

  • The spell affects only the cleric and their carried equipment.
  • Other creatures cannot be transported.
F27ChYS6QsWWj6VE.name: Word of Recall

FPzhRPTmgUbn6Th3.description:
This spell grants the recipient complete protection against all non-magical environmental hazards. While the spell is in effect, the recipient does not need air, food, water, or sleep.

Protection Includes:

  • Survival in extreme heat or cold (such as deserts or blizzards).
  • Breathing in airless environments (underground, underwater, space, etc.).
  • Survival in vacuum or toxic natural atmospheres.
  • Immunity to environmental damage from other planes (such as the Elemental Plane of Fire).

Limitations:

  • Does not protect against magical damage, including spells.
  • Does not prevent attack damage, poisons, breath weapons, or physical blows.
FPzhRPTmgUbn6Th3.name: Survival
FPzhRPTmgUbn6Th3.spellEffect: Protects one creature against all non-magical damage from the environment

G38zbVPnUSssgQRM.description:
This spell creates an invisible barrier around the caster, extending 10' in all directions. It grants each creature within the barrier a +1 bonus to all saving throws, while attacks against those inside suffer a -1 penalty on attack rolls.

Effect: Enchanted creatures (such as magically summoned or controlled beings) cannot engage in melee with anyone inside the barrier. However, if a protected creature attacks an enchanted one, the barrier no longer prevents melee attacks, though saving throw bonuses and attack roll penalties remain active.

Missile and magical attacks from outside the barrier still suffer the -1 attack penalty but are otherwise unaffected.
G38zbVPnUSssgQRM.name: Protection from Evil 10' Radius

Grs1XKOG7WWjIDc6.description:
This spell grants the cleric the ability to communicate with any living or undead creatures within 30'. Even unintelligent monsters will understand and respond.

Effects:

  • Creatures spoken to will not attack the cleric while in conversation.
  • However, if attacked, they may defend themselves or flee.
  • The cleric may ask only one question per round.

The spell lasts for one round per level of the cleric.
Grs1XKOG7WWjIDc6.name: Speak with Monsters*
Grs1XKOG7WWjIDc6.spellDuration: 1 round per level of the cleric

Hywr9Etbl8KDFTSc.description:
This spell allows the cleric to animate non-living, non-magical objects, causing them to move and attack. Magical objects are unaffected.

The spell can animate either:

  • One object up to 400 lbs (4,000 cn), roughly the size of two men.
  • Multiple smaller objects, as long as their total weight does not exceed 400 lbs.

Combat Abilities: The DM determines the movement rate, number of attacks, damage, and armor class of animated objects. As a guideline:

  • A man-sized statue might move at 30' per round, attack once per round for [[/r 2d8 #points of damage]] damage, and have AC 1.
  • A chair might move at 180' per round, attack twice per round for [[/r 1d4 #points of damage]] damage per attack, and have AC 6.

All animated objects use the cleric’s chance to hit in combat.
Hywr9Etbl8KDFTSc.name: Animate Objects

IA8zGnCjexi7kovA.description: For the duration of this spell, the recipient is immune to damage from normal fire and heat. They also receive a +2 bonus to all saving throws against magical fire (such as dragon breath or fireball). Additionally, any damage taken from such magical fire is reduced by 1 point per die of damage, with each die dealing at least 1 point of damage. For red dragon breath, the damage is reduced by 1 point per Hit Die of the dragon, but never below 1 point per Hit Die.
IA8zGnCjexi7kovA.name: Resist Fire

JSTz8Z5Jxd5Cehss.description:
This spell instantly destroys one magical barrier created by a cleric. It can also dispel certain barriers created by a magic-user.

Effects: *Remove Barrier* will destroy a cleric's *Barrier* spell and can also dispel the following magic-user spells:

  • Wall of Ice
  • Wall of Fire
  • Clothform
  • Woodform
  • Wall of Stone

Limitations: This spell does not affect the following spells: *Wall of Iron*, *Stoneform*, *Ironform*, or *Steelform*.
JSTz8Z5Jxd5Cehss.name: Remove Barrier*

JdYkNtlbJRdU0w5G.description:
This spell allows the cleric to temporarily wield the magical powers of a magic-user, enabling the use of certain restricted items.

Effects:

  • The cleric may use one magic-user-only item, choosing between:
    • A magic-user device (such as a wand, staff, or rod).
    • A magic-user scroll containing a 1st or 2nd level spell.
  • Spell Level Restriction: The cleric cannot use spells of 3rd level or higher, even if present on the scroll.

Duration:

  • The spell lasts for one turn (10 minutes) or until the cleric uses the item.

Temporary Knowledge:

  • During the spell’s duration, the cleric magically understands how to operate the selected item.
  • For a scroll spell, the cleric is treated as the minimum level required to cast the spell.
JdYkNtlbJRdU0w5G.name: Wizardry
JdYkNtlbJRdU0w5G.spellEffect: Allows the use of one magic-user device or scroll spell

K0e2hUqs4pVRzhvp.description:
This spell summons an intelligent elemental being called an Aerial Servant to retrieve a specified item or creature and return it to the caster. The servant appears immediately, and the cleric must describe the target and its location, or the servant will depart.

The aerial servant is ethereal at will, allowing it to bypass most barriers, but it cannot pass through a Protection from Evil effect.

Task and Duration: The servant will attempt to find and bring back the target within the spell's duration (1 day per caster level). If the spell ends before the task is completed—whether the servant is still searching or already returning—it is considered a failure.

Strength and Carrying Capacity: The aerial servant has 18 Strength and can carry up to 500 lbs (5,000 cn).

Failure Consequences: If the aerial servant cannot complete its task within the spell duration, it goes insane and immediately returns to attack the caster.
K0e2hUqs4pVRzhvp.name: Aerial Servant
K0e2hUqs4pVRzhvp.spellEffect: Servant fetches one item or creature

K7zz5EzLl8QHO9S0.description:
This spell creates enough food to feed up to 12 men and their mounts for one day. For every level above 8th, it creates enough for 12 more people and mounts.

Note: Created food spoils after 24 hours and cannot be stored for future use.
K7zz5EzLl8QHO9S0.name: Create Food

LRQgHpC3zZcv2078.description:
The reverse of *Speak with Monsters*, this spell prevents one creature from communicating in any way.

Effects:

  • The target may attempt a saving throw vs. spells, but with a -2 penalty.
  • If the save fails, the victim is unable to communicate for the spell’s duration.
  • This includes all forms of communication: speech, hand gestures, writing, telepathy, etc.
  • The victim can still cast spells but cannot use magic items requiring command words, as the words turn into gibberish.

Duration: 1 turn per level of the caster.
LRQgHpC3zZcv2078.name: Babble*
LRQgHpC3zZcv2078.spellDuration: 1 turn per level of the caster

MPZsz3bLrbxIeqUa.description:
This spell compels the target to undertake a specific task or quest as commanded by the caster. The target may attempt a saving throw vs. spells to resist; if successful, the spell has no effect.

Typical Tasks: The task might include slaying a particular monster, rescuing a prisoner, retrieving a magical item, or embarking on a pilgrimage. If the task is impossible or suicidal, the spell fails automatically.

Duration: The spell remains in effect until the specified task is completed. This spell compels the target to fulfill the task but does not compel them to do so willingly. Once completed, the target may hold a grudge against the caster, potentially seeking revenge depending on the circumstances of the quest.

Curse: A target who refuses to undertake the quest is cursed until they resume the task. The nature of this curse is determined by the GM and may be twice the usual strength of a standard curse.
MPZsz3bLrbxIeqUa.name: Quest*
MPZsz3bLrbxIeqUa.spellEffect: Compels one creature to perform a task

MgaroTaG1N3OLjQd.description: Continual darkness, creates a similarly-sized area of total darkness, unaffected by normal light sources and infravision. A continual light spell can cancel it. If cast on a creature’s eyes, the target must make a saving throw vs. spells or be blinded.
MgaroTaG1N3OLjQd.name: Continual Darkness*

O1FGiC7ToNiKnhSJ.description:
This spell is an improved version of Raise Dead, capable of restoring any living creature—not just humans and demihumans—to life.

Effects on Humans & Demihumans:

  • The recipient awakens immediately, fully healed.
  • They can fight, use abilities, and cast spells without penalty.
  • Any afflictions they had at death (curses, diseases, etc.) remain.

Effects on Other Creatures: All restrictions from Raise Dead apply, including time limits and required rest.

Time Limit: A 17th-level cleric can raise a body that has been dead for up to 4 months. For each level beyond 17th, the limit increases by 4 months.

  • 17th level: 4 months
  • 18th level: 8 months
  • 19th level: 12 months
  • +4 months per level beyond 17th

Effects on Undead: If cast on an undead creature, the spell has the following results:

  • 7 HD or less: The undead is immediately destroyed (no saving throw).
  • 7-12 HD: The undead must make a saving throw vs. spells at -4 penalty; failure results in destruction.
  • 12+ HD: The undead takes [[/r 6d10 #damage]] damage; a saving throw vs. spells reduces the damage by half.
O1FGiC7ToNiKnhSJ.name: Raise Dead Fully*

OKSGsTGBtQoa7DTF.description:
This spell grants the caster incredible mobility, allowing flight, planar travel, and even transformation into gaseous form.

Effects:

  • The caster can fly at a rate of 360' (120'), similar to the Fly spell.
  • Once per turn, the caster may shift into a nearby plane by concentrating for one round.
  • The cleric may bring one additional creature per 5 levels (rounded down), provided they are touching at the moment of planar travel.
  • Unwilling creatures may make a saving throw vs. spells to resist being taken.

Gaseous Form:

  • By concentrating for one full round, the caster may become gaseous.
  • In gaseous form, the caster and all carried equipment transform into mist.
  • While gaseous, the cleric may move at 720' (240') but cannot attack, cast spells, or use items.
  • In this form, the caster is immune to non-magical damage but cannot pass through a Protection from Evil spell or Anti-Magic Shell.
OKSGsTGBtQoa7DTF.name: Travel

PrhyGjFfdQPgG1vm.description:
The reversed form of the quest spell, *Remove Quest* dispels an unwanted quest or removes a quest-related curse. The base chance of successfully removing the quest is 50%, modified by ±5% for each level difference between the caster of *Remove Quest* and the original caster of the quest.

For example, an 11th-level cleric attempting to remove a quest imposed by a 13th-level caster has a 40% chance of success, while a 36th-level cleric removing a quest cast by a 20th-level cleric has a 99% chance of success (capped to prevent automatic success).
PrhyGjFfdQPgG1vm.name: Remove Quest*
PrhyGjFfdQPgG1vm.spellEffect: Removes an unwanted quest or curse

QHLR7lbzj2jNRXp2.description:
Blight, imposes a -1 penalty to morale, attack rolls, and damage rolls of enemies. Each affected creature may make a saving throw vs. spells to avoid these penalties.

It affects only those within a 20' x 20' area and only those who are not yet engaged in melee combat.
QHLR7lbzj2jNRXp2.name: Blight*

QYYv6O2ARMh0SsIB.description:
This spell allows any one weapon to inflict 1d6 additional points of damage per attack (similar to a magical staff of striking). The weapon will inflict this extra damage with every successful blow for as long as the spell lasts. This bonus does not apply to attack rolls, but only to damage rolls.

If the caster casts this spell on a normal weapon, the weapon may then damage creatures which are normally affected only by magic weapons; the weapon will do 1d6 points of damage per strike (regardless of the normal damage of the weapon).
QYYv6O2ARMh0SsIB.name: Striking

RAvFnqjTvXJ9TBFc.description: The saving throw against Breath Weapons is used to resist or mitigate the effects of a wide range of powerful exhaled attacks, not limited to dragons. This includes attacks like a dragon’s fiery or icy breath, a gorgon's petrifying breath, or a chimera's elemental breath. Each creature’s breath weapon has specific effects, such as damage, paralysis, or petrification. A successful saving throw generally halves the damage or avoids the secondary effect (such as paralysis or petrification), while failure applies the full consequences. The target number for the saving throw is determined by the character’s class and level.
RAvFnqjTvXJ9TBFc.name: Dragon Breath

RGlM0xv41sJayX9o.description: The Black Hag attacks with poison-coated iron claws. Any creature hit must save vs. poison at -4 or die instantly.
RGlM0xv41sJayX9o.name: Iron Claws (Poisoned)

RMK1daENP8lz8bQ8.description:
When the spellcaster casts this spell and then touches any living creature, it will calm the creature and remove any fear. If the creature has been affected by a fear spell or effect that normally does not allow a saving throw, the remove fear spell can still be effective. If the spellcaster uses the spell on someone afflicted by a magical fear effect, the victim gets to make a saving throw vs. spells, with a bonus to the roll equal to the spellcaster's level of experience (up to a maximum bonus of +6). If the saving throw is successful, the victim's fear is dispelled. Regardless of the spellcaster's level or any bonuses, a roll of 1 will always fail.

The reversed form of the spell, cause fear, will make any one creature flee for two turns. The victim may make a saving throw vs. spells to avoid the effect. This reversed spell has a range of 120'.
RMK1daENP8lz8bQ8.name: Remove Fear*

SEQLXr7UmAd7Jr22.description:
This spell destroys other spell effects within a 20' x 20' x 20' area. It does not affect magical items but can cancel temporary effects they produce.

Effect: Automatically dispels spells from casters of equal or lower level. For higher-level casters, there is a 5% chance of failure per level difference.

Examples: A 7th-level caster trying to dispel a spell from a 9th-level caster has a 10% chance of failure.
SEQLXr7UmAd7Jr22.name: Dispel Magic

SNjwUk6VSR8kpg8X.description: This spell inflicts 2d6 + 2 points of damage on a creature touched by the caster. A successful melee attack roll is required to deliver the spell.
SNjwUk6VSR8kpg8X.name: Cause Serious Wounds*

SbTNK0beCk5s5Sem.description:
This spell cures one living (not undead or non-living) creature of [[/r 1d6+1 #Cure Light Wounds]] points of damage. The caster can cure themselves with this spell.
